choices: Before You Can Do Anything Someone Comes In
1.content:
It was just another day for you in the nut house. Most sane people would consider being in a hospital full of crazies to be a nightmare. Well, you have to deal with a hospital full of crazies who happen to be giant monsters. You were the only human in the Kaiju Disarming Plant, a mental hospital where the staff and patients were all as big as skyscrapers. What made matters even worse was that 22 of your fellow patients and 9 of the 12 orderlies were carnivorous human eating beasts. You sit holding your knees in the corner of your room, which is just a padded cage on the desk of the head of the K.D.P., a giant nine tailed fox by the name of Kaguya West.

You turn your head to see Dr. West busily typing at her computer as her nine tails move in the air. You hated being here, but you had no choice. You were a human girl from Kansas who was taken to this monster world by a strange tornado and had to live in Terrordale for three months trying to avoid getting smashed or eaten. Then one day while you were walking down the street looking for food, you passed a strange looking house and heard a strange noise as if somebody was running, but you never saw anyone. Mysteriously a ring fell from the sky next to you and you held it up, only for a golem to see you carrying the ring.

As it turns out that ring was a family heirloom of a giantess nekomata that lived in the house you passed. Since you were holding the ring, the two tailed cat giantess assumed you were the thief and pressed charges. An invisible monster was the real thief and dropped the ring but there’s no way you could’ve proved it. You would’ve done hard time in Under Gloom and knew you wouldn’t last a day. You heard that Under Gloom was home to the worst criminal giantesses in the monster kingdom and that the guards were sadistic predators. So you decided to plead insanity. You thought you’d be better off but the K.D.P. was just as scary as any prison.

As you recall that horrible day you had to pretend to be insane in order to avoid going to prison, you let out a groan and hang down your head. Dr. West turns her head and looks at you. Since she doesn’t know you were faking insanity, she gives you a smile. “Don’t worry Sylvia,” says Dr. West. “Before you know it, you’ll be out of the K.D.P. and back on your feet.” You inch back in your cell. Even though she meant well, that fox woman was still frightening at how big she was compared to you and she was keeping you in a cage. Just like you were a prisoner or a pet. You needed to get out of here or you’d most likely end up in some monster chick’s belly.

As you’re trying to figure out how you’re going to get out of this one, Dr. West gets up out of her seat. “I’ll be right back Sylvia,” she says. “Got to run to the lady’s room real quick. Now don’t hurt get into any trouble while I’m gone.” You let out a groan as Kaguya walks away and leaves her office via teleportation. That kitsune woman and her magical powers made her super scary. But then you gasp and walk to the side of your cage. “Dr. West’s press-on nails,” you say. “I wonder.” You pick up one of the bright pink nails and hold the tip up to the lock on your cage as you start to pick it. You hear a click and the door opens. “Yes!”

Once you’re out of the cage, you slide down Dr. West’s chair and then land on the ground panting heavily. “I’ve got to get out of here,” you say. “I don’t care how as long as I don’t end up someone’s lunch.” You look around the room and remember that Dr. West’s office was a room of four walls that each had a door in the center that lead to one of the four hallways where they keep the monster patients. You honestly didn’t want to risk running into a giant psychotic human eating monster chick, but the hallways were the only way out.

But which path are you going to take?
1.title: Kaiju Disarming Plant

11.content:
You run under the door to the North to travel down Block A, shivering as you do so. You look ahead to see the rooms in the hallway and remember that there were five monsters that represented the elements of wood, water, fire, earth and air and one monster that didn’t fit into any of the categories.

The first of them was the only monster in the entire hospital to not be an adult. Her name was Kerry and she was a weredeer. She had anorexia and refused to eat anything no matter what. Her worried parents sent her to Dr. West to try and get her appetite back. But Kerry is one patient you hope isn’t cured anytime soon because if she gets her appetite back, she’ll be eating humans again.

The second monster was a water element monster called Ranru, an enormous werefrog under the delusion that she’s a ninja. It’s hard to tell whether or not she’s in her room or not given how fast she can move off the walls. You hated frogs and this one was so big that you were the fly. Her tongue was so fast that you could be outside one second and in her stomach the neck.

Monster number 3 in this part of the K.D.P. was Cassandra, a werebat. You heard that Cassandra got into an accident at work that left her with a head injury that left her with the mentality of a 5-year old. Cassandra was now just like a child, a five hundred foot tall child. But that delusional bat was still dangerous. You could imagine her playing with you as if you were a doll and manhandling your entire body. Just the thought was horrifying.

The fourth A-Blocker was Mira, one of the six regular monsters to escape and be escorted back by Roxy and Stephen. For a big monster made of clay, she acted a lot like Chicken Little. She thought the sky was going to fall and strike her dead. In fact, she slept under her bed instead of on top like she should. She was intimidating, but you were less afraid of her then the other monsters because she didn’t even eat humans. In fact, you don’t know if she even needs to eat.

Then there was the most psychopathic monster in A-Block, Phoebe, a harpy with the appearance and powers of a phoenix. You couldn’t understand her because most of the time, instead of speaking, she laughed like a maniac. The woman loved to set fires and if something was flammable she’d want her hands on it. You yourself were a pyrophobic and Phoebe’s habit of setting humans on fire even made it worse.

But there was one more A-Block monster you knew about named Onihime. Onihime was a Japanese ogress who was in a car accident. Her hippocampus (the part of the brain, not the monster species) was damaged and now she’s incapable of remembering anything. Unfortunately she forgot that she and her husband were human friendly and since she saw that she was an ogre, she assumed she was a predator. Onihime’s husband asked Dr. West to take a look at her after she tried to eat their human neighbors. It was definitely a bad idea to be anywhere near a hungry ogre.

Suddenly you hear loud footsteps and gasp. A guard was coming. From the demonic neigh you’re filled with dread. It could only be one monster, Tress, that horrible shishi. Tress has been lusting for humans since her qilin girlfriend broke up with her and you just had to be a girl. Tress thinks you’re her girlfriend now and shows it by keeping you in places you’d rather avoid. One time you were stuck where the sun don’t shine on her for three hours straight. But you’d rather be anywhere on that Chinese lion horror than in her stomach because if you don’t give in to her love, Tress is going to swallow you whole.

But that statue was coming fast and you were scared to death. “Oh Sylvie! Sylvia! Where are you? Don’t be shy, I know you broke out just to be with little old me.” As she comes forward, Charlene shakes her monster sized hips and you’re more terrified than ever. “Come on out sweetie,” says the living statue as she shakes her rear. “I have your favorite hiding spot all warmed up. Oh Sylvia!”

You see the six rooms with the six monster inmates waiting inside and gulp. It was risky going in with one of those psychos but you’re scared to death of Tress. As that guardian lion horror comes forward, you duck under a door and into a room. But who are you stuck with?
11.title: A Block

112.content:
"Oh Sylvia~ Where are you~?" Tress practically sang out while walking by the door you ducked under. Her footsteps got further away until they completely vanished. You breathed a sigh of relief and began to head under the door again.

Almost as fast as lightning, you were suddenly whisked away from the door to a nearby cornor of the room. Dizzy, you try to get your berings and look up to see what happened. That's when you saw who the room belonged to.

Right in front of you was a 550 foot tall, hourglass shaped werefrog with turquoise skin and darker blue spots. She had purple, bob-cut hair. She was wearing a tight, black ninja outfit with yellow highlights and a pink scarf.

That's right. You just ducked into the cell of Ranru Gama, the crazy ninja.

"Well, it looks like the rabbit has wandered into the tiger's cave." Ranru said.

"What?" You ask. You never understood Ranru in the rare times she interacted with the others. She always used these cryptic "Ninja" sayings.

"The mosquito is stuck in the spiders web." She replies.

You stare at her. "Nope. Still lost."

"YOU'RE IN MY CELL!" Ranru yells.

"Oh." You say. Then you glup as you remember that Ranru eats humans. "What exactly do you plan on doing."

You could just tell Ranru was smirking under her mask. "Well..."
112.title: Swift as a Butterfly

1123.content:
"I realized something today. Even us monsters must become petals in the wind someday. And I don't want my legacy to be lost to time. So, after seeing you, I know what to do: you will be my apprentice." Ranru said happily.

"WHAT!?" You yell.

"Yes. I will teach you all I know. Yes, I eat humans, but I see something special in you. I think you can carry on my legacy once I pass into the next realm." Ranru tells you.

"Um, that sounds nice and all, but I don't think the staff will like that." You say, trying to get out of this situation.

"Well, then let's ask them." Ranru replied.
--------------------------------------------------
20 minutes later, Whitney was in Ranru's cell and looking at her like she had just broken a metal chair with a toothpick. You were in Ranru's hand.

"So, let me see if I'm hearing you right," Whitney said, "Sylvia broke out, got into your cell, and... you want her to be your apprentice?"

"That's correct. Is that alright?" Ranru asked.

To your surprise and fear, Whitney smiled. "That's PERFECT. I don't see why she can't. I'll talk to Dr. Kaguya and have Sylvia transfered to your cell."

'Maybe this will teach her a lesson.' Whitney thought to herself.

"But... but..." You try to say.

"No buts Sylvia. In fact, I think Ranru should start her teachings right now." Whitney says.

"Yes. A quick start begets a quick mind." Ranru said.

"Um, yeah. What you said. Have fun." Whitney replied before shutting the cell door, leaving you with Ranru.

"Excellent. Now, before we being, you need the proper uniform."

Before you could even blink, Ranru grabbed you and changed you clothes. Looking down, you saw that you were now wearing a dark blue ninja suit with green highlights and a crimson scarf.

"Why did you have a human sized ninja suit if you EAT humans?" You ask.

"Hush, my student. Your teachings begin now." Ranru says. "First, I will teach you in the art of...
1123.title: Welcome to Ninja School

choices: She wants to play dress up
She wants to have a tea party
113.content:
With no other choice but to hide, you quickly duck under the nearest cell door. You hear that overgrown library ornament thunder past the door, and breath a sigh of relief. But that quickly turns to terror as you realize who's cell you're in. In the center of the room sat that giant five year old, Cassandra. It was only just now that you realized there were several giant children's toys scattered about them room. They had been provided by Dr. West to keep Cassandra occupied.

Cassandra was currently brushing the hair of a doll she clutched in her hand, and didn't realize you were there. You couldn't go back outside, for fear of being caught, but then you noticed an open window with bars at the other end of the room. If you could just get to it, you could easily slip past the bars and you'd be home free!

The only problem was getting the unnoticed. You make your way across the room, hiding behind the various toys scattered about the floor. When you're directly behind the giant bat, you accident press on the button of a teddy bear you were hiding behind, causing it to say "I love you."

Cassandra's ears perk up, and she looks behind her at the stuffed bear. "Did you say something Mr. Fluff?" She picks up the bear, and immediately notices you, smiling with delight. "Oooh, a new toy!" You try to run, but she quickly grabs you, holding you in her palm. You shake with fear. Now you were the plaything of a gigantic child.

Cassandra looks from you to the doll in her other hand. "What should we do with our new toy, Miss Josephine?" She holds the doll up to her ear, as though it were whispering, and smiles.

"That's a great idea!"
113.title: Playtime with Cassandra

choices: Cassandra continues to play with you
1131.content:
"You and I are going to play dress up." she said to you just as she keeps you holding on and she goes to her mini dress shores, and her mental capability proves that just as she grabs some dresses for you, and makes you try them. "Oh great, that is just great." you said to yourself just as Cassandra picks out some clothes for you to try out. She made you try out a few clothes, like knight suits, bunny suits, and many other suits. Each one of them was more mockery than the last, and it made you look like a fool to a child, but you are the plaything, so that is okay, until she eats you of course.

Eventually you ended up dressing like a princess just as her Miss Josephine toy plays around with Cassandra. "So, what do you think of our new princess?" she asked her, and then the doll (cannot speak) says "Good idea.

"That is great Miss Josephine, now it's time to set up the big wedding." said by Cassandra just as she brings out her castle and her play sets, and so far, you aren't even close to enjoying the experience at all. In fact, it really bombs you out, and you just want out, but it's nothing you can do with right now. You just have to deal with it. She gets out her place sets, and then places you on top of the castle with the prince (your size on it). Cassandra then grabs you again.

"Ah perfect." you muttered. "So now... Prince Charming, do you... ah what the heck." Cassandra makes her prince start kissing on you aggressively, and overall your day is not going well at all. You broke out, then end up in here, and it's just not a good day for you at all.

What happens now?
1131.title: Dressy Sylvia

choices: You talk to her, and you ask for a plan of escape
She is called for group theapry
114.content:
It was Mira, the Golem. She was currently hiding under the bed, and she was looking at you just as you came in (and of course the same girl who chased you curses at you for escaping) and she grabbed you right in an instant and brought you close to her. "Hey... what the heck?" you shouted at her, and then she told you to hush down a bit. "Calm down, the sky might fall any minute, we might all die! Humans and monsters alike!" Mira said as she panicked and screamed into you ear, and it nearly deaf you. "Can you might calm down, there is no sky falling." you shouted back at her.

"But you don't know yet, it might one day.... we must be ready, I'll get the pillows." Mira said just as she grabs the pillows and covers you and yourself. "Tell me, what the heck is wrong with you?" you asked her. "I know it's a long story, but I fear the sky will fall. PLEASE... just stay with me, everything will be okay!" Mira said just as she goes insane again.

"I heard what happened to you, and I understand your situation. Taken by monsters for a crime you didn't committed, and then placed here when you plead insanity hoping the place is better." Mira said, calming down for a moment. "I am Mira, and you are" "Sylvia... I am Sylvia." you told her, and then she smiles. "Well it's rare to meet a human like you." Mira made a smile with her rock formations.

What happens now?
114.title: Mira the Golem

115.content: You see three more doors, but you better hurry, Tress's coming fast and she looks extra vivacious today.
115.title: A Block Part II

choices: Start begging her not to eat you
Try to remind her that she likes humans
1151.content:
As you enter the room you try to scan the area and see who you ended up with. You walk forward a little and spot the the room's occupant. It was Onihime the ogress. She's chubby with navy skin and a zebra striped loincloth and bra. You begin to walk slowly so as not to alert her to your presence. Normally she was friendly with humans but a car accident messed up her memory. She doesn't remember liking humans and became predatory. She also forgets things almost as quick as she learns them due to short term memory loss. You want little to do with her but you can't just leave with Tress outside. As if to prove your point you hear the giant shishi outside calling for you.

As you quietly try to find a hiding spot Onihime randomly looks in your direction. Her eyes light up and she comes at you. "A human!" You quickly run away and manage to dart underneath a nearby dresser and sit there with your heart pounding. You see her feet near the dresser for a moment but then they turn and walk away. You peek out from your hiding place and see that she looks as if she never even saw you. You think that Tress might be gone by now and decide to head for the door. When you sneak out however, Onihime begins wandering around the room. You dive out of the way to avoid her giant feet as she heads toward the door. Suddenly she stops and you hear her muttering to herself. "What was I doing? Ah never mind." She then turns back around and almost crushes you again. This time she absentmindedly looks at the ground and spots you. "A human!" she says aloud, causing you to panic. You run away terrified as Onihime reaches for you. She manages to grab you this time and you are lifted into the air while struggling.

Onihime brings you to her face, giving you a clear view of her horns. They only serve to frighten you more and you begin to shake a little. "Well looks like I got a snack." the giant ogress says. "I guess its down the hatch with you." Even though she seems intent on eating you, you can hear in her voice that she doesn't seem too dedicated. "Its been a while since I've had a human, I think." she says. You notice that when she said that she seemed a little confused. Maybe part of her still knows she used to be friendly with humans. When she brings you closer to her mouth you panic and try talking to her. What do you say?
1151.title: The Forgetful Ogress

choices: She plays with fire a bit
1152.content:
You duck into one of the rooms to hide from Tress. As you enter you're immediately met with a strong smell. It smells like something's been burnt recently. Walking forward you look around and see that various things in this room are either burnt or melted. You get an idea who's room this is and sure enough you see her in the corner. Its Phoebe, the phoenix harpy. She really is flat out insane. She uses her flame powers to start fires and burn anything she can. Now that you look around more you see that some things are charred, but not completely ruined. You guess the staff made some of things in here fire proof, but that didn't stop her from trying. Knowing that this is a very dangerous place to be you try to head back to the door. Just as you reach however a small wall of fire springs up and blocks your path. You then hear a chuckle from behind you. "Heheheheheheh." You feel the ground shake from the harpy's approach as you take off running.

Now that the door is blocked you really don't know where to go. All you can hear is the booming stomps and laughter of Phoebe. Your first thought is to hide under the bed but you find that impossible. Her bed is just the mattress sitting on the floor, as she burned the bed frame to ashes. Turning in another direction you search for another way out. As you run a small fireball is thrown into your path. You scream and stumble backward . You fall onto you butt and then scramble to your feet and start running again. The result is the same though. Wherever you go you're met with flames in your path. Phoebe is just toying with you! The endless flames are made even more frightening by the laughter of the phoenix filling the room. Eventually you begin to get tired and stumble to the ground. You sit there and shiver in fear as the gigantic harpy walks over to you.

Phoebe picks you up and brings you up to her face. You can see the sadistic smile on her beak as she looks you over and laughs menacingly. You can't even speak as you stare into her eyes. Your attention is shifted to her hand as she lights a small flame on the tip of her finger. She chuckles and then....
1152.title: Out Of The Frying Pan....

11522.content:
Phoebe eyes you sadistically as she holds you between two fingers. The flame on her fingertip grows a little larger and starts to become erratic. You tense up in fear when she points the flame right at you. The flame shoots at you and you let out a scream. You feel a warm sensation on your body and look down. Your clothes are burning! Phoebe set your clothes on fire! As you scream and struggle the insane harpy cackles at your panic. You feel embarrassed as the last of your clothes burn away and your naked body is exposed. You feel your eyes start to water, and know that you're about to cry. This is cut short however, as you feel another warm sensation. You smell smoke and look at your shoulder to find that your hair is catching fire! In a panic you frantically bat at the flames in an attempt to put them out. Thankfully only a little of your hair is burned before you put the fire out. All the while Phoebe is getting a kick out of your suffering.

As Phoebe holds you in her fingers you look to the other side of the room and see more flames popping up. Just as you wonder what could happen next the giant harpy tosses you across the room. You sail through the air, screaming as you head for the flames. With a thump you land in the middle of a ring of fire. Standing up you cover your exposed body and whimper. Phoebe begins to walk over, but in a stroke of luck the curtain on the window above you comes loose. It must have already been damaged in one of Phoebe's episodes. The fire proof curtain falls down and smothers the flames, giving you a chance of escape. Not wasting any time you take off running. The sudden disappearance of her fire catches Phoebe off guard and she tries to grab you in frustration, without using her flame powers. You dive out of the way as she lunges at you, causing her to crash face first into the wall. As you head for the door...
11522.title: Playing With Fire

11523.content:
Before Phoebe could do anything, the door opened, distracting her. Using this oppritunity, you ducked under her mattress. You peeked out to see who walked in.

You saw that the guard was a gorgon, around 825 feet tall. She was looking at a clipboard. She had pythons for hair and has wearing sunglasses. Her body was covered in brown scales with a white diamond pattern. She was slim up top, but her butt was enormous, easily wider than she was tall. She was wearing a black bikini, clearly made to fit her. Her right arm was prosthetic, ending in a hook.

You recognized her as Luz, a new guard from Venezuela. She only worked here a month, and was still trying to get to know everyone. She didn't like Tarja, since Tarja always mocked her and called her "Medusass". Sometimes, when not patrolling, you heard her in the break room, caressing and talking to her butt. You knew she didn't eat humans, but you were still afraid of her, since she might sit on you without knowing.

"Alright," Luz said in her Venezuelan accent, "It's time for your check-up, Kerry. I hope you've been eating well. We don't want you to-." She looked up and saw she had walked into the wrong room. "AH! NOT YOU!" She cried.

Then you remembered. When Luz started working here, she got into a fight with Phoebe, which ended with Phoebe burning off Luz's arm. Since then, Luz has been deathly afraid of Phoebe, to the point of trying to avoid her cell.

"Well well," Phoebe said. "We meet again, Luz. It's been a while."

"Please, st-stay away fr-from me." Luz stammered, clearly terrified.

"Why? We have so much catching up to do." Phoebe said, advancinig towards Luz, who back into a wall. Phoebe lit a flame on her finger. "Maybe I'll burn your other arm. Even you out."

"I me-mean it. I'll ca-call Dr. Kaguya. You'll be so-sorry."

As Phoebe lit more flames, you looked and saw the open door. You could make a break for it now. But then you looked at Luz's terrified face. You couldn't leave her here with the person of her nightmares.

After a second, you decided to...
11523.title: Pyrophobia

choices: Yes, and she fishes you out
115233.content:
Before you could even think about what you were doing, you dashed out from under the mattress. You sprint underneth Phoebe's legs and start climbing up Luz's body. Both Luz and Phoebe notice you doing this.

"Now what do you think your doing?" Phoebe asked. "Don't want Luz to burn alone?"

Luz grabs you and brings you up to her face. "What are you doing?" She asked, still terrified.

"This!" You yell, just before you jump onto Luz's nose and, with all your strength, rip off her sunglasses, exposing her golden eyes. Instinctivally, Phoebe covers her eyes.

"Luz, run." You yell while still falling. Luz grabs you and her sunglasses mid-fall and you both dart out of Phoebe's cell. Luz slams the door and locks it.

"Thank you so much." Luz says, breathing heavily and replacing her sunglasses on her face. "Hey, aren't you that human who pled insanity to get in here? What's your name again?"

"Sylvia." You reply. "And I only did that because I wouldn't survive in Under Gloom."

"I don't blame you" Luz told you. "I was originally going to work there, but I walked in, saw the inmates, and walked right out."

"Hey, what's going on?" You hear a voice yell from behind Luz. It was Whitney!

"Crap!" You reply. "Luz, please don't let Whitney-"

Before you can finish your sentance, Luz whips her hand to her back and sets you on one of her mountainous butt cheeks. Then she turns to face Whitney, quickly enough that she doesn't see you. The movement causes you to fall in between Luz's gigantic cheeks.

"Luz, what happened here?" Whitney asked.

"I walked into Phoebe's cell by accident. I managed to get my sunglasses off and distract her long enough to get out." You were surprised she didn't mention you. She must be covering for you. Why?

"Does this mean your over your fear of her?" Whitney said, surprised.

"Oh, Zeus no." Luz replied. "I'm still staying away from that psycho."

"Alright, well we have a problem. That little pest Sylvia escaped. Have you seen her?"

"The human? No I haven't."

"Damn it. Well, let me know if you find her." Whitney said before leaving.

You breath a sigh of relief. That was one problem dealt with. But, when you tried to climb back up, you realized you had another problem: you were wedged too tightly in between Luz's cheeks. You were stuck! Luz looked back at her butt.

"Alright Sylvia, your sa-. Huh?" She said. "Where'd you go?" Does she realize your stuck?
115233.title: Out of the Frying Pan... Again

choices: The left door down the hall
The right door down the hall
1153.content:
You continue to run down the hall, not wanting to risk those two. Stopping to catch your breath you look up and discover that you are outside Victoria's cell.

From what you heard, Victoria was a 1,000-foot-tall, orange Slavic Dragon. She was here because she had a superiority complex and was running her so-called "servants" ragged. Once they found out just how insane she was, they called the KDP. The only other thing you heard about her was that she was somehow even fatter than Diana, weighing nearly three tons and completely immobile. She had to have a special cell made just so she could fit. While she ate a lot, she would never eat humans, since she thought of them as vermin, not even worth her time.

You could hear Tress getting closer. You thought that, if you could appeal to Victoria's gargantuan ego, maybe she would keep you safe.

However, there were two other doors down the hall: one on the left and one on the right.

What choice do you make?
1153.title: O.C. Time!

11531.content:
Deciding it would be better to deal with an ego then a stalker, you quickly duck under Victoria's cell door. As soon as you enter, you run into a flabby, orange wall.

Before you could react, a booming, Russian voice rang through the cell.

"WHO DARES TO SULLY OUR PRESENCE?!"

Looking up a bit, you see nothing but a massive dragon belly. Looking up further, you see the rest of Victoria.

You were wrong to think she was three tons. Because from the looks of it, she was even fatter then that. Her enormous ass was parked on a matress the size of a building. Her arms and legs were so thick you could barely see her hands and feet in their fat. Her breasts could rival Ayu in size. And her belly dominated her body, nearly filling up the room.

Peeking over the massive breasts were Victoria's three heads. The center one had red eyes. The right head had green eyes. The left head had brown eyes.

You then remembered that each head had a complex. The center head had the superiority complex. The left head thought she was a god. And the left head thought she was inferior to everyone.

"WE SAID, WHO DARES SULLY OUR PRESENCE?!" Victoria's voice rang again, coming from the center head.

"Um, Sylvia, the human?" You say.

All three heads look at you. The Left one starts laughing.

"A human? A mere vermin thinks that she can grace the presence of a goddess?" Left asked.

"Feh. She is nothing. We would eat her, but she is unworthy to even wash us." Center replied.

"At least she can leave when she wants. We're stuck here." Right moaned.

"WE CAN LEAVE! WE JUST CHOOSE NOT TO!" Center yelled at Right.

You gathered from this that the heads disagree with each other. As they argued, you heard Tress get closer. You needed to convince at least one of the heads to help you. But which one?
11531.title: The Royal Pain

choices: Try to convince Mei to help
11532.content:
Not wanting to risk dealing with an egotist like Victoria, you quickly race down the hall and duck under the left door. You breath heavily as you listen to Lilith's footsteps go past you're door, her having not seen you. You sigh in relief, then look up to see who's cell you've blundered into.

The person in front of you was on her bed, moping. The woman was a qilin, about 950 feet tall. She had short, naturally grey hair and grey eyes. Her body was covered in dull yellow scales. She had what looked like deer hooves for feet. She had an athletic body, but you saw that her breasts were truly massive. They even looked to be slightly larger then Ayu's.

You only barely knew this woman. You did know her name was Méishénme, but everyone called her Mei for simplicity sakes. You couldn't for the life of you remember why she was here, but you did know she didn't eat humans, so you decided to introduce yourself.

"Um, hello Mei." You say.

Mei looked at you. "Oh, you're the human. Why are you here?" She asked in a soft Chinese accent.

"I'm hiding from Lilith. Don't want to get eaten." You reply.

Mei sighs. "Why would she eat you? In fact, why do monsters eat humans at all? There's no point to it. They're just going to die one day anyway, so why waste their time with something so pointless?"

That reminded you why Mei was here. She was a complete nihilist. She felt that everything was pointless, and that things like life and death, beauty and ugliness, and good and evil had no meaning. She felt there wasn't a point to doing anything, since in her words, "we'll all be dust and forgotten anyway". Everyone called her a downer who sucked the fun and happiness out of everything.

You heard she was this way due to her immortality, seeing people age and die and civilizations collapse and be forgotten. So she had given up on happiness.

You also heard she tried magic once, but accidentally gave herself an unbreakable curse that made her breasts never stop growing. After that, she never used magic again.

You didn't know how to respond to Mei's comment on eating humans. "Well, she enjoys it. In fact, most monsters here enjoy it."

"Then they're wasting their time." She replied.

You rubbed the back of your neck. Mei really was depressing. "Hey, think you could help me get out of here?" You decided to ask.

"Why? You won't win. No one really wins. The only person who wins in the end is the Reaper, so why bother?"

You were confused. You REALLY had no idea how to respond to that. Before you could respond, you heard Lilith's footsteps. She was coming back!

"Oh, look. Lilith's coming back. Must want to check on me? Why bother? I'm not important. None of us are. in the end." Mei said.

You weren't listening. Lilith was getting closer. You needed to do something and FAST! But what?
11532.title: How Depressing

11533.content:
You decided dealing with Victoria's ego isn't worth it, so you ducked under the right door. You sigh as Tress's footsteps pass by the door. You made it just in time.

"Hey, about time you showed up."

You look up to see who was speaking to you. You groan when you do see.

In front of you is a 500 foot tall gremlin. She had green skin, brown eyes, and black hair in a ponytail. She had fangs and long, pointed ears. She was hourglass shaped with big, beefy arms.

This was Lacy Teller. She was in here because she believed she was a fictional character in a story. Nobody really liked her, so she was kept seperate most of time.

"Hey Lacy." You say.

"Aw, you look upset. You shouldn't be, this will be fun." Lacy replied.

"What will?" You ask.

"You don't know? You didn't read the title of this chapter, did you?"

"What chapter?"

"You know, 'Bye Bye 4th Wall'? Means we are going to have some fun messing with the readers heads. You know, once Doc up there decides to get off his lazy butt and write again."

"Um, Doctor Kaguya is a woman." You say.

"Not her. The nut writing this chapter."

"Who?"

"We are going to be here all day if you keep this up."

"Look, can we just be rational for a second. I want out of here, can you help?"

Lacy thinks for a moment. And thinks. And thinks.

"Um, Lacy." You say.

"Sure, I'll help. I was just building tension for the readers. Though I don't think it worked."

"I will never understand you. So, do you have any ideas?" You ask Lacy.

"Well, 2. One, we turn you into a monster, say you were here by mistake and let you leave legally. Two, we unleash the nebutori, and in the confusion, you break out. Of course, you'd be fat too, though I don't think the readers would mind that." Lacy explains.

"Those sound like good ideas actually. But which one do we do?"

"That isn't up to us." She then turns for some reason. "So, people reading this, what's it gonna be? You want Sylvia here to be a monster? Or get really fat? Your choice."

"Who are you talking to?" You ask.

"Shut up." Lacy replies.
11533.title: Bye Bye, 4th Wall

115331.content:
"Just one question," you say. "How exactly would you turn me into a monster. Not a lot of gremlins can use magic." Lacy then smiles. "Be right back." She said. Lacy then walked offscreen and you hear footsteps. There's no way her room could be that long. It would be impossible.

"Alright," says Lacy. "Now to go back to the start, show member's chapters. Oh geez, he must've been writing in bulk, he's been favoring this particular story lately. I know, aha, there's something promising." You begin to wonder exactly what that Lacy was up to. You couldn't even figure out how she's doing whatever it is she is doing. That gremlin sounded like trouble.

Lacy then returns and smiles. "Sorry, I took a wrong turn at Monster Boondocks. I still can't believe he's offering 1000GP for a certain chapter in that story." You raise an eyebrow. "Monster Boondocks?" "Hello," says Lacy. "The story that Red wrote after this one. You know, with names like Cadence, Charlene, Elisa, Roxy, Mazee and Lockette, Maggie is a surprisingly common name for the main ally monster in that story." You raise an eyebrow. Lacy then lets out a sigh and then holds out what looks like a strange potion.

"What's that?" you ask. "It's a transformation potion some kappa was planning to use in case she ran into the authorities. It has the power to transform any monster into any other monster." "But does it work for humans?" Lacy then scratches her chin before she looks down. "Good question. Okay, so it might have a side-effect of making you ginormously fat, but the readers will love it." "What?!" you yell. "What are you saying?! You're not making any sense."

But it's too late because Lacy gives a smirk and pours the entire potion on you as you cough. Then suddenly you begin to switch. "I hope he makes it good," said Lacy. "He's had a lot of practice with TF lately." You hiccup and then you feel yourself getting bigger and soon you're the same height as Lacy's knee. But it doesn't stop their, you feel a tear and look back to see your butt expanding and then feel around to find your belly getting fatter as well. "Oh no," you say. "Oh..." You then scream as the real transformation begins and your body gets ready to transform into....
115331.title: Sylvia the Monster

1153311.content:
You groan and then you see that as your ass expands, it is turning a whitish shade of gray as it becomes thicker and bumps appear. You then see your feet turning into hooves as you keep getting bigger. By the time you're as tall as Lacy, your pants are coming apart and revealing your panties as you scream and then your belly bulges out as your breasts get bigger and your ears get longer. Your body becomes more wrinkled, hard and lumpy as you actually become taller than Lacy just as you sprout a small tail. "Irony," says Lacy as she turns her head to the side. "You know I love it."

You hold your head and let out a grunt that gets louder and deeper as your face stretches out and sprouts two rather long horns. You grunt and blow smoke out of your nostrils before you look down and see you are now exactly 950ft tall. Lacy gives a smirk. "Well, Doc, are you happy now? Was it worth the wait?" You let out a grunt and then look into a nearby mirror in surprise. You were now a wererhinoceros as big and tall as Whitney, the same type of rhinoceros as well. However, you actually seem to be even fatter than Whitney and you look to see that you're completely naked. You let out a loud scream as you try to cover up your nudity.

In the hallway, Whitney is nearby and she hears you scream. "What was that?" she asks. Whitney runs into Lacey's room and you see her and scream. However, instead of being enraged, Whitney looked worried. "Oh my gosh! How did you get in here! Get away from her! She could be dangerous!" Lacey just gave a smirk and turned her head. "If she read the last few chapters she wouldn't be feeling the way she is now." Whitney grabs you by the hand as you grunt and leads you out of Lacey's room before locking the door behind her. "You must've wandered in here and that gremlin tricked you into her room. The mentally disturbed thing must've stolen your clothes. I don't know who you are, but you really shouldn't be here. This is a mental hospital." "I'll keep that in mind." You say.

You couldn't believe it. Whitney didn't recognize you as a wererhinoceros. But then again, Whitney's eyesight wasn't the best. Speaking of which, you see a blur moving across the hall and squint to realize that the blur was actually Cyprus. You then rub your eyes and continue to squint. "By the way," says Whitney. "I don't see a lot of wererhinos in this area. Heck, I thought I was the only one in Terrordale. What is your name?" You gulp. You definitely couldn't tell Whitney that your name was Sylvia, the very name of her archenemy. Then you figure something out. "My name is Gwendolyn." "Gwendolyn?" asked Whitney. "That's a fancy name. Oh my gosh. You're still naked." Whitney reaches into her lab coat and takes out a purple bikini with daisy designs on it and hands it to you. "Here," she says. "It's lucky for you, I keep a spare bikini on me. And that we're both the same size." Whitney then adjusts her glasses and sees how tight the bikini bottom is on your ass. "Although, your ass looks slightly bigger than mine. You best be getting out of here." "Uh," you say. "Thanks. I'll take that advice."

The moment Whitney turns her back, you run out of the K.D.P. and onto the beach, albeit tripping over a cooler in the process. You spit out some sand and get up as several buff male monsters, all of which are shorter than you, can't help but stare. One of them even whistled, causing you to blush as you walked away. You continue to squint as you walk along the sand. "I guess it's not just Whitney," you say. "I may be out of the K.D.P. but I can't see a thing. That's not surprising. Rhinos have very bad eyesight." Then you giggle to yourself. "But I'm finally free. I'm out of the K.D.P. I made it. Ouch!" You then bump into and trip over a blonde haired fairy who was dressed as a lifeguard. "Watch where you going, you fat, stupid, pachyderm bitch!" yells the fairy before flying off. "Stella," you mumble. "At least now I'm big and fat enough to squash her. But I have to do something about this eyesight problem."

You then squint and see what looks like an ophthalmologist shop nearby and smile. You walk into the shop and then walk out with a pair of large purple horn-rimmed glasses. "Well," you say. "That was easy. Now, I need to find a job somewhere. Then maybe if I wait a year I can get enough cash to bail Wade out." At that moment, a newspaper blew and got stuck to one of your two horns. You take off the newspaper and see that it's a list of job listings. All of them looked interesting, but which one do you settle on?
1153311.title: Sylvia the White Rhino

choices: Skip to the Arrival in Direopolis
The Makoas Stop at a Gas Station on the Way
11533111.content:
The ad in front of you was a help-wanted add for a restaurant called Neo Neapolitan. “Employees Wanted. We’re currently understaffed. You can literally count the staff without the use of all 10 fingers. We’ll pay you plus tip. Contact Patty, Salli, Pam or Dorothy.” You run your rhinoceros chin and give a snort before you grunt, accidentally pricking yourself on one of your new horns. “This sounds promising. I’ll just work at Neo Neapolitan for a year and I should have enough money to bail Wade out by then. Now, the address... 23 Harlequin Drive... Direopolis!?” You give a grunt. You had no idea where Direopolis was. From the sounds of it, it was an entirely different town that was far away from Terrordale. How the heck were you going to get there? You let out a sigh. “Nothing is ever easy.”

- - - - - - - -

Meanwhile, at Neo Neapolitan in Direopolis, the restaurant is currently closed and on top of a table in the center of the restaurant were three human brothers squabbling. The oldest was a tan-skinned brunette with a slight goatee wearing a pair of glasses who was dressed like a heavy metal fan. The middle brother was the shortest and was scrawny with long blond hair in an emo-like attire. The youngest brother was ironically the tallest and was beefy with the same light skin tone as the second brother but with a dirtier shade of blonde in his hair. He was dressed like a bodybuilder. From the looks of it, the oldest brother was upset with the youngest brother.

“Norman, you’re a half brain!” yells the oldest brother. “Cut me some slack, Wes,” says the youngest brother. “I did what you asked and put an ad in the newspaper.” “Oh,” says Wes, the oldest brother. “You did. In the Daily Tombstone! That newspaper doesn’t even reach Direopolis, you chowderhead! Who would apply for a job that’s miles away from their home city?!” “It’s called outsourcing, four eyes!” Wes lets out a groan as the middle brother decides to give his two cents into the situation. “Maybe we should try a different approach and have an online application.” Wes lets out a sigh. As there are three large tremors and three shadows are cast over the three brothers.

The shadows belonged to three monster women who each stood 1350ft high. First was a strawberry pink-skinned werehippo woman, albeit bigger and fatter than Jedda or Cyprus. She had long golden red hair down to a butt wider than she was tall and a blue tattoo of a pyramid over her right eye. She wore a red tanktop and skin tight black shorts as well as Egyptian style earrings and a tongue piercing. The second monster girl was a vanilla white loxodon, a monster resembling an anthropomorphic elephant. In her case she resembled an Asian elephant with long black hair and a very large belly. She was dressed as a goth girl and was carrying an umbrella in her trunk. Surprisingly she had the fangs of a vampire and a second pair of fangs in her trunk. The third giantess was an obese hourglass-shaped chocolate brown-skinned wereboar with long blonde hair and six sharp tusks. She also had wings like Mandy except that hers were leather wings.

The werehippo giantess lets out a sigh and then turns to the wereboar giantess. “I don’t know who’s the bigger chowderhead, Pam,” she says. “Your husband for screwing up a simple assignment or me for giving him the assignment in the first place.” Pam, the boar giantess gives a snort. “You bite your pierced tongue, Patty. This could work.” The loxodon woman lest out a sigh and then picks Allen up with her trunk. “Allen, Dear,” she says. “I think maybe we should leave your brothers and their wives alone. They’re having another of their disagreements.” Allen nodded his head. “Well, look on the bright side, Salli. At least nothing weird happened... yet.”

- - - - - - - -

Meanwhile, back in Terrordale. You are reduced to holding up a sign and hitchhiking while mumbling to yourself as you held up a sign that read “Direopolis or Bust”. “What kind of idiot would post a help wanted ad in a different town as the place where the job is supposed to be? It doesn’t make any sense.” You keep muttering to yourself before somebody finally pulls over and you look in surprise. In the driver and passenger seat of the car was a mother daughter pair of wererhinos just like what you had been transformed into.

However, they both resembled extinct rhino species and both looked Hawaiian. Though both were also quite obese. The mother was a 1300ft tall brown-skinned rhinoceros woman resembling an indricotherium, a prehistoric rhinoceros without a horn. She wore a tiger print sari and tanktop with a tattoo of Hawaii on her back. She was also completely bald in contrast to her daughter who had long raven hair. Speaking of the daughter, she was a 1240ft high teenager who had pinkish gray skin and resembed an elasmotherium, a rhinoceros with an enormous horn in the center of her face. She had a floral print sari and tanktop and wildflowers in her hair.

“Aloha, stranger,” says the mother rhinoceros. “Didn’t think we’d see a fellow wererhino on our way home.” You give a snort. “You’re both from Direopolis.” The daughter nods her head. “We were just in town for a wedding in the family. Come on in, we’ll take you to Direopolis.” You were very wary. These women were wererhinos like Whitney. Then again, now you were a wererhino as well. You give a smile and get in the back seat before the mother rhino begins to drive off. “What’s your name, cousin?” asks the daughter rhino. “Gwendolyn,” you say giving the same lie you gave Whitney. “Just Gwendolyn.” The daughter rhino smiled. “I’m Elisabeth Makao and this is my mom, Isabella. My dad, Kaikane is asleep right now.”

You look around but don’t see anyone else. “Your dad?” you ask. You hear snoring and then you see a purse by the side of Isabella and inside it is a Hawaiian human man taking a snooze. You give a blink. “I guess Whitney’s not the only wererhino with a human mate.” But then you realize something. “Wait, that means...” You look at Elisabeth in shock. That would technically make the teenage wererhino half human. You didn’t even know monsters could interbreed with humans. Of course, you knew Whitney didn’t have any kids but you remember hearing somebody say Whitney didn’t even want kids.

“Uh,” you say to Isabella. “Shouldn’t you be wearing glasses as you drive.” Isabella bursts into laughter and you’re confused. “But I thought wererhinos...” Elisabeth then reaches and takes out a contact lens from her left eye before cleaning it. “Well duh. Everyone knows that Wererhinos have the worst eyesight of all monsters. But Mom and I prefer contact lenses. So, why do you want to go to Direopolis in the first place?" You bite your lip. You could tell them you needed the money but you definitely couldn't tell them it was to bail Wade out of prison, so you give a cough.

"I want to get a job at a restaurant. Neo Neapolitan I think." "Oh!" yells Elisabeth. "Good for you. That place has the best donuts. Me and my BFF, Beatrix go there all the time." "A donut shop?" you ask. "Why would a donut shop need a waitress or a delivery girl?" Isabella stops at a red light before speaking. "It's not just a donut shop," she says. "It deals in donuts, burgers, pancakes, sundaes, pizzas and panini." You drop your jaw. "What? You're kidding me. What kind of menu is that?" Elisabeth let out a giggle. "The three main proprietresses that run the place couldn't decide what to sell." "Uh-huh. It says I'm supposed to look for Salli, Patty, Pam and Dorothy. What kind of monsters are they?"

The light changes before Isabelle drives again. "Well, Patty is the cook and the leader. She's a big Fiery Redhead of a werehippo." You give a gulp. "Werehippo?" you think. "I hope she's not like the behemoth and bahamut back at the KDP. Hippos and I don't mix." "As for Salli," says Elisabeth. "She's the head waitress. She's an odd mix. Her dad's a vampire but her mom's a loxodon." You gasp again. "A vampire elephant?" you think. "Her poor dad." "Pam," says Isabella. "Is the delivery girl/village idiot. She's a wereboar who was born with wings." "Great," you think. "Another flying pig. I hope she's not as obnoxious as Mandy." "And most recently," says Elisabeth. "They obtained a fourth partner named Dorothy. She's a manticore. It was her idea to add panini to the menu." You were now beginning to sweat.

"I think I made a big mistake." You think to yourself.
11533111.title: Crossover with Neo Neapolitan

choices: You Reach Direopolis with No Trouble
115331112.content:
As Isabella continues to drive down the highway, there’s a blinking noise and you look to see that the car is running low on gas. “Oh scrud!” groans Isabella. “I knew I should’ve refueled before we left the hotel.” Elisabeth takes out her phone and then uses it to search for nearby gas stations before nodding her head. “There’s a station at the next exit, Mom.” Isabella pulls over into the gas station and then gets out of the car. The car pulling over woke her husband, Kaikane. “Huh?” asks the Hawaiian man as he stands up. “Are we in Direopolis already?” Kaikane looks up at you and Elisabeth and you look down at him in surprise. You knew he was human, but he looked like an ant at your size. Being a giant wererhino was going to take some serious getting used to. Of course, Kaikane seems more concerned with the fact that there was another wererhino in the car besides his daughter.

“Elisabeth?” asks Kaikane. “Who is this strange wererhino?” Elisabeth picks up her tiny father and places him on her shoulder as you look down in surprise at him. “Dad,” says Elisabeth. “This is Gwendolyn. She’s applying for a job at Neo Neapolitan and Mom decided to give her a ride.” Kaikane seems really concerned and it concerns you. “You mean you picked up a hitchhiker? How do you know she’s on the level. After all, for all you two know, she could be a human eater.” You bit your lips. How could he say that about you? Sure, he had no way of knowing you were a human turned into a wererhinoceros but... then again, the only wererhino you knew was Whitney and she didn’t eat meat period. Just because one wererhino you knew was a vegetarian, doesn’t mean that they’re all vegetarians. You bit your lip before Elisabeth lets out a scoff. “Come on, Dad. Just look at her. She has a face you can trust.”

You’re desperate to change the subject and clear your throat. “You don’t see too many human/monster married couples around, Mr. Makoa. How did you and Isabella meet?” “She nearly swallowed me with a handful of coconut trees.” Your face turns a paler shade of white upon hearing that. Elisabeth let out a laugh. “Yeah, but he was able to avoid being eaten by grabbing onto her gums. By the time she realized he was in there, it took a lot of sweet talking to convince her not to devour him. It worked a little better than he expected. Ow!” Kaikane twists his daughter’s ear to get her to shut up. “You don’t have to worry about me, Mr. Makoa,” you say. “I’d never even think of eating a human. I just need this job and I appreciate your wife going out of her way to...” Mr. Makoa waves his hand to stop you right there. “It’s okay. After all, you didn’t eat me in my sleep. But I have to warn you, Neo Neapolitan is in the middle of a rather crazy town. The townsfolk are all eccentric bordering on insane.”

You begin to sweat. “They are?” you think. “Oh no. I’m heading to a village-sized KDP.” You grunt before speaking. “What about the staff of the KDP?” Kaikane has to hold back the urge to laugh. “Are you kidding me? They’re two sets of stooges. Patty, Salli and Pam are always getting themselves into numbskull situations and their husbands aren’t any better.” “Husbands?” you ask. “Elisabeth didn’t say they were married.” “ Patty, Salli and Pam’s husbands are brothers,” said Elisabeth. “All three of them are humans. Patty’s married to the oldest of the brothers, Wes. Opposites attract. She’s got a fiery temper and he’s got a sharp tongue. Salli’s husband is named Allen. He’s the most timid thing you’ll ever see. Always hiding in his wife’s elephant ears.” Elisabeth laughs at that before you blink. “And Pam’s husband?” “His name is Norman and he the youngest. Not to mention the biggest blockhead you’ll ever meet. He and Pam are perfect for each other.” You blink and bite your lip. “I see.”

You let out a groan. “Are the customers any better?” “If anything,” says Kaikane. “They’re crazier. First is Elisabeth’s best friend, Beatrix. She’s a basilisk who comes from a family of automechanics. She practically eats nothing but mangos. And I’ve met her father. He’s one of those people who is sick of the world after one too many bad days. Another of Elisabeth’s classmates who goes there is a jersey devil named Scarlett.” “Jersey Devil?” you ask. You wonder if she’s anything like Charlene. “Yeah,” says Elisabeth. “But don’t stand upwind of Scarlett. All she ever eats is garlic.” “Yuck.” “Then there’s that hyperactive dancing Nue she hangs out with,” says Kaikane. “What was her name? Mariana?” “Juliana, Dad,” says Elisabeth. “And then there’s Perry Hart. That otaku peryton.” “What’s a peryton?” you ask. “It’s a monster that’s a hybrid of a deer and a bird.” You begin to hope that this peryton isn’t like Kerry. “She wouldn’t happen to eat humans would she.” “No,” says Elisabeth. “But she’s way stronger than she looks. She can lift a werehippo and a loxodon with just one hand. But let’s not forget about Akira Oda, the Japanese dragon.”

You rub your head. “I know European dragons eat humans and Chinese dragons are benevolent,” you think. “But do Japanese dragons eat humans?” “Akira and her mom run a hair salon together,” says Kaikane. “But we have no idea what her mom looks like.” “But isn’t she a Japanese dragon like her daughter?” “Her husband is, but Mrs. Oda, nobody has ever seen her. The only thing that we know for sure is that she’s at least 3 times bigger and fatter than her daughter.” “Can’t her husband tell you?” “Her husband is blind.” You raise an eyebrow. “Are you kidding me?” you think to yourself. “This sounds like a town made of weirdos.”

“And don’t get me started on the adults,” says Elisabeth. “The Howler-Grunewalds for starters. Crescent Howler is an artist who builds life-sized sandcastles for a wedding.” “Howler? Would she happen to have a relative named Diana?” “I don’t know, Gwendolyn. It’s possible. She comes from a very big family. Of course, her wife, Trini is the real crazy in the family. She’s a sabertooth tiger...” “Sabertooth? I thought those were extinct.” “Well Trini is lively as ever. She’s a mad scientist who’s always building some crazy contraption.” You begin to sweat. “On the opposite side of the spectrum is Una Pride, the Nemean lioness witch doctor.” “A witch doctor and mad scientist in the same town?” you ask in concern. "Are the rest of the town as colorful."

"You don't know the half of it," says Kaikane. "There's this mountain ranger named Delphine Dare, a weredolphin. She is so utterly incompetent, that I don't know how she hasn't gotten fired by now. There's also a Loch Ness fisherwoman named Lapis. She has no boyfriend so she spends her whole day sitting on her enormous and still growing rump as it grows numb waiting for fish. She doesn't realize how obese she is because she's lost all feeling in her ass." "Don't forget about Ms. Vile, Dad." "Ms. Vile?" you ask in surprise. "Gardenia Vile," says Elisabeth. "She's an elderly werecheetah who really knows how to put away burgers. Of course, Pam, Delphine and Dad think that she's a retired thief." "It's possible." Mutters Kaikane. "Then," says Elisabeth. "There's Mia, NN's personal Ms. Fixit. That cyborg wereleopard spends so much time fixing crap around the place, they oughta hire her full time. Oh, don't forget Esther Tortuga." "The newscaster?" you ask. "Oh yeah," says Kaikane. "She comes in everyday at noon for pizza. Her tastebuds must be dead because she'll eat pretty much anything." "Oh," groaned Elisabeth. "Don't forget about that crazy “super-villain”, Deathina.” “Supervillain!?” “Don’t worry. Her real name is Mallory and she’s pretty much too stupid to do any real damage.”

At that moment, Isabella finishes refueling and gets in the car. “If you’re talking about crazy customers, you can start with that crazy teacher of yours. Ms. Ringmoore. That crazy flamingo harpy dresses like a luchadore, but I know I can take her. I’m a boxer you know.” Isabella blows on her fist before driving away. “Also, I’d be on the lookout for Deneb.” “Deneb?” “She’s a so-called superhero who goes out looking for crime to smash. Has to look extra hard since there’s not a lot of it in the mountains. Then there's Ethiopia who wants to combine basketball and sumo." You were really starting to regret this decision.

"Oh," says Kaikane. "But don't forget the three most important customers." "Important?" you ask. "You mean big names like Neo's cuisine." "Three in particular," says Elisabeth. "You ever heard of Corona Poe?" You've heard of her alright. She was a minotaur movie star. Sometimes, Dr. West played her movies for the patients. What would she have to do with Neo Neapolitan. "Corona is Wes, Allen and Norman's sister." Says Isabella. You're confused. "But she's a minotaur." "Step-sister." "Oh. That makes more sense. And the other two?" "You heard of the Rainbow Tongue hotel chain?" asks Elisabeth. "Claire Melon, the CEO is a regular customer at Neo Neapolitan. But boy is she a stress fiend. She drinks way too much caffeine.” “Don’t forget,” said Kaikane. “She likes to snatch humans up with that chameleon tongue of hers.” You gulp, being really glad that you were transformed into a wererhino.

“And the last one?” you ask. Isabella smiles. “Did you know that Vienna is an old friend of Patty’s.” “The jazz singer?” you ask in surprise. “Oh my gosh. It sounds like Neo Neapolitan attracts all sorts of customers. Exactly what am I in for?" You were now starting to regret your decision more and more.
115331112.title: Job Description

choices: Claire Melon, the neurotic hotel tycooness
1153311121.content:
The trip to Direopolis thankfully goes off without a hitch, and in no time the Makoas' car is on the final stretch of road into the town. The drive had given you time to stew over the news of how crazy this town was supposed to be. Elizabeth had told you eating humans was illegal there--something you still couldn't believe--but from the sound of it your new size and form wouldn't make things much better. Wannabe supervillains, mad scientists, bumbling cops who should have lost their jobs by now...it was almost like going back to the KDP!

....Well, maybe not. At least none of the monsters in Direopolis sounded as sadistic or evil as the patients back there. But that chameleon woman DID still eat humans...wait a minute!

You turn to Elizabeth, flipping through a magazine she'd bought at the gas station. "Er, Elizabeth? Can I ask you something?"

"You just did," she quips.

"Well...you told me eating humans in Direopolis is illegal, right? But didn't you say that Claire Melon ATE humans? Wouldn't she get arrested for that?" You try to hide your worry. If that lizard woman just had to pay a fine or something for eating a human, this town may not be as safe as you thought.

Elizabeth chuckles, slapping her forehead. "Oh! Right; I forgot to mention she only eats humans when she's out of town. Within the city limits, she wouldn't even think about it. I've heard she even lets humans work at her hotel there...if they're okay with the risks of getting accidentally stepped or sat on, that is."

Isabella laughs from the driver's seat. "Or not so accidentally, like that poor busboy who came to clean our room when your father and I stayed there for our honeymoon. He was quite the rude little punk, and I put him in his place. Right, dear?" She asked Kaikane.
Her husband nodded with a smug grin. "Pretty stupid of him to call that blue bikini you loved so much ugly. You gave him a closer look right quick."

Elizabeth facepalms as her parents laugh. "UGH! Will you guys ever stop telling that story? It was years ago!" She huffs and turns back to you. "Anyway...yeah, Miss Melon doesn't eat humans in Direopolis; like ever. Even when she's out of town, I've heard she has...standards for eating them. Her biggest is 'No Kids, Ever'. But I think she'll let adults go, if they can pay her off. Sorta like what Mom did, before she married Dad. Now Mom's quit eating humans completely."

"Best decision I ever made," Isabella adds with a firm nod.

You blink. All the human-eating monsters at the KDP gulped down humans like candy, without conscience. A monster sparing humans outright, or just being persueded to let prey go....you'd never imagined that. "...Huh. I guess that's not so bad. I mean, if kids are...off the menu--" You shudder at the phrase; "--then she's not as...sadistic as other monsters I've known. Er, no offense." You add the last part hastily, remembering Isabella's story.

"None taken, sweetie." Isabella assures you with a rather comforting laugh. "Well, anyway, we're almost there...."


==========================

It's not long before you're dropped off in front of Neo Neapolitan itself, the Makoas giving you their address so you'll have a place to crash before they drive off.

The restaurant itself looks like.....well, like someone sliced five different buildings into pieces, then took one piece from each and fitted them together. Neon lighting right out of the 1950s abruptly stops against Italian stucco; a sign advertising a new ice cream flavor (Raspberry-Vanilla Swirl!) juts out from between two posters for various burgers...and wedged in below them, a cartoon of a human cop chowing down on a box of doughnuts. This place might as well have had Hey! This Place Is Weird As Hell! written on everything in bright red.

Still...this was your first lead on a new job, and you wouldn't be turning back into a human any time soon...
You steel yourself and head inside---

Only for the door to open at the last moment, revealing a monster woman whom you walk right into, staggering you both.



But which of Direopolis' residents did you (literally) bump into?
1153311121.title: New (Rhino) Girl in Town

11533111211.content:
You look up and are in pure surprise at the giantess you had bumped into. She was a rather obese and voluptuous minotaur woman with copper brown fur and long black hair. She looked like a cross between a buffalo and a Native American woman and had an udder that was three times as big as her head. For clothing she was wearing a yellow jacket, black T-shirt, blue jeans and a pair of round glasses. “Oh my gosh,” says the cow giantess. “Are you alright?!” As you realize who is it you bump into, you’re struck with surprise and awe as your eyes go wide behind your glasses. This was no ordinary woman. This was the actress, Corona Poe. After seeing her from Dr. West’s movies, you could not believe you were in her presence. Even though she was still a very young adult, she had been in a good number of films that did well throughout the monster world. You could not believe there was such a famous monster in front of you and you step back as Corona looks at you in concern.

“Y-Y-You. You’re Corona Poe! Oh my gosh!” You laugh nervously. “From the sounds of it,” says Corona. “You’re not from around here.” You have to catch your breath before you speak again with the buffalo giantess. “I-I’m a huge fan! I mean, you were awesome in Nuclear Winter! Your best role so far!” You begin to look around for anything and see that you only have the bikini and glasses you’re wearing. “Damn!” you yell. “I don’t have anything to autograph.” “Oh,” says Corona. “Don’t worry about it. I’m in town for a week visiting my brothers and their two wives.” You give a blink. Two? But she has three brothers and they’re all married. “Oh,” you say. “That’s right. I’ll wait until I get my apron and you can sign that.” “Apron? Oh... oh! You must be here to apply for the waitress job. Since I’ve never seen you around Direopolis, you must be from out of town. Figures. That moron must’ve put the ad in the wrong newspaper. Guess I’ll be seeing more of you Ms...” “Syl... er, Gwendolyn. Just Gwendolyn.” You give a sigh. You almost gave Corona your real name. No need to fangirl out when it’ll blow your cover. But wait, you’ve never been here before. What do you have to worry about. Well, better not take chances.

“Well,” says Corona as she puts away her glasses and puts in her contact lenses. “My brothers and their wives stepped out for a bit. They just asked me to wait here in case any applicants showed up.” “That’s another thing I wanted to ask. You’re a minotaur and yet you have three human brothers.” Corona gives a laugh. “Well, my mom married their dad when I was a kid. She was actually his second marriage. I heard the first one didn’t end well.” “And you had no trouble getting used to a human father.” Corona let out a sigh. “It wasn’t hard. I never met my real father. I’m actually older than my brothers.” “How well do you get along?” Corona let out a scoff. “Are you kidding me. We’re very close. In fact, I’m the reason they met their wives. They attended the same high school as I did.” You gasp. “Humans in a school for monsters?” “Oh, you don’t have to worry about Wes, Allen or Norman. They’re harder to kill than crabgrass on steroids. Ever heard of Achilles?” “The Greek hero? The one who was invulnerable except for his heel. What about it?” “Well,” says Corona as she sits down in two chairs at once and then starts to fasten her hair into a ponytail. “My bros are descendants of Achilles. They’ve been swallowed, sat on and stepped on so many times, it’s only a minor annoyance. That allowed me to get some immediate payback on Allen and Norman when I caught them reading my diary all those years ago.”

Corona gave a laugh before speaking again. “Anyhow, their wives have been friends since they were kids. Hence Wes and Allen met two amazing girls.” “What about Norman.” Corona gives a grimace and twitches her eye. “Well,” she says. “Let’s just say Wes got the brains, Allen got the looks and Norman got what was left. Hence he got saddled with that no account... pig.” Corona said the word “Pig” as if she was having a stroke as she said it. “And you know what they say about stupid people and smart people. Smart people wait. Norman and Pam were the first to get married. Then a year later, Wes proposed to Patty and the rest was history. Allen took his time before he married Salli.” You figure that you might as well try to know more about your would-be employers.

“And what are your sister-in-laws like.” Corona let out a sigh and smiled. “Patty’s in charge of cooking. She’s the brains of the trio. She’s a decent enough person and very beautiful. But she also has a bit of a temper and a low tolerance for stupidity. Of course, Wes has always been a smart aleck so opposites attract I guess.” You give a gulp. “I’ll stay on her good side.” “Salli,” says Corona. “She’s the sweetest one. Very perky and bubbly. She’s the perfect girl for cowardly little Allen. She’s head waitress, so she’ll be your supervisor.” You nod your head. “And Pam.” Corona gives a snort and glares. “Pam is a feeble-minded porker who’s always getting my brothers in trouble.” “That’s kind of harsh, Corona.” Corona let out a sigh. “I probably should be nicer to her, but I had a VERY bad experience with a wereboar a long time ago and they’re not what you’d call my favorite species of monster.” “I see.” you say nervously. You were beginning to wonder if you made the right idea when you heard somebody come in.

“You chucklehead!” yells a deep female voice. “How stupid can you get!? How stupid can you get!?” “Cut me some slack, Patty,” says a scratchy yet girly sounding voice. “He was low on cash so he paid for the pizza with magic beans to take us to the land of the giants.” “Pam,” says Patty. “WE’RE the giants! Everybody knows those beans only grow as high as an ogre’s chin. I can’t believe even you were that gullible.” “Come on, Patty,” says a bubbly sounding goth girl’s voice. “It’s not Pam’s fault she’s stupid.” You turn your head and see Pam, Patty and Salli arguing, their husbands on their shoulders. All three monster women were two heads taller than you and you sweat as you watch them arguing. “We put a want ad for more waitresses,” says Wes with a groan. “But from the sounds of it, we need a new courier.” “Patty’s gonna need a new husband if you don’t shut up, Wes.” Says Norman as he holds up his fist. You give a blink. “That’s the youngest brother?! He’s built like a wrestler.” “Norman,” says Patty. “You couldn’t harm Wes if you tried.” “That doesn’t mean it don’t feel good to try.” “Could you guys stop fighting for once?” complains Allen. You bite your lips. “Great,” you mutter. “I just applied for a job working for the Three Stooges.”

Corona then stomps her hoof on the ground to get the girls’ attention and then points to you. Patty, Salli and Pam come forward and you are very intimidated. Not only were these girls much bigger than you even when you were a giant monster yourself now, they were very fat and were somewhat frightening with Patty’s sharp hippo tusks, Salli’s two sets of fangs, the other in her nose that looked like it was stained with blood and Pam’s sharp tusks and leather wings that looked unnatural on a wereboar. “H-Hi,” you say nervously. “I’m Sly-er... I’m Gwendolyn. I’m... I’m here for the... waitress position.” The trio and their husbands all look in surprise before blinking. “Well I’ll be,” says Wes. “Somebody actually went all the way to Direopolis for the position.” Allen fell back into Salli’s breasts as the loxodon vampire trumpeted. Patty bent over to get a good look at you.

"Do you have any experience in the kitchen?" "Uh... yeah." Patty gave a snort. "You have to be prepared for anything in this town. I must warn you. This is the monster world's weirdest town. The lunch rush begins in 15 minutes. Can you handle it." You look the enormous werehippo woman in the eye and shiver. "Yes!" you yell. "Yes! I can do that!" Patty rubs her double chin and then she takes out an apron that is split into the colors pink, white and brown. "Are you really ready to do this?" You think about it. You don't even know how much this job pays. But still, if you could survive without going legitimately insane, you'll be able to bail Wade out after a year or so. He'll just have to get used to you being a rhinoceros for the rest of your life.

You nod your head. "I'm ready." Patty nods her head and tosses you the apron before turning to Salli. "Salli," she says. "Starting today, you're her boss." Salli trumpets and nods her head. You then give a gulp and turn to Corona smiling at you and giving you a thumbs up. "Oh good grief," you say. "What did I get into?" Salli then trumpets to you. "Don't worry," she says. "Me and Allen will show you the ropes." You just give a nervous laugh as Salli smiles at you with her vampire teeth unnatural for an elephant-based monster.
11533111211.title: Four Sisters-in-Law

115331112112.content:
Salli decides to take Corona’s order while you heard somebody else come in. “Sounds like your first customer, Gwendolyn,” says Corona. “Go get her.” You turn your head and don’t see anyone but then you remember that you’re a wererhino now and there was a possibility of monsters shorter than you. You look down and see that the customer that came in was a 785ft tall werecheetah who looked elderly. Her yellow fur had taken a more grayish hue that she almost looked white. Her hair was white with black spots. Her face didn’t look too bad, except for a few wrinkles and as for her body, it looked surprisingly young and from the looks of it, she was rather fat with an enormous belly that entered the room a full 30 seconds before she did. She was wearing a gray unitard and red leg warmers that made her look like a Thundercat.

“Hey, girls,” says the cheetah giantess. “I didn’t know you hired a new waitress.” You take a closer look at the woman who just came in and you recognize her from what the Makoas said about her. This must’ve been Gardenia Vile, the alleged Black Spot. She sure didn’t look like a cat burglar to you. Heck, she just looked like a cat to you. She also looked slightly tired. “Right this way, ma’am.” You say as you lead the elderly giantess to her seat. You find it hard to believe that this sweet-looking old lady could possibly be an ex-thief.

“My name is Syl... er Gwendolyn and I’ll be your waitress today, Ms. Vile.” Gardenia smiles and then lets out a yawn, giving you a view of her fangs. From the looks of it, they’re real teeth meaning that she doesn’t wear dentures. “Just bring me a seafood lover’s pizza and three Grape sodas.” You give a look of surprise. “Three sodas?” Gardenia nods her head and yawns. “I need something to wake myself up. I didn’t sleep well last night.” You write down Gardenia’s order and walk into the kitchen to find Patty already busy cooking burgers. You’re confused but then you realize the only other customer out there was Corona so she must’ve ordered. You give a gasp.

“Is that Corona’s order?” you ask. “Of course it is,” says Wes. “Burgers are Corona’s favorite food.” Your face turns paler than it already was. “But... but... isn’t it cannibalism for minotaur to eat hamburgers?” “That doesn’t stop grootslangs from preying on elephants.” Says Wes. You hand Patty Gardenia’s order and she heads off and picks up some pizza dough before you bend down to speak with Wes. “The Makoa’s told me about your customers, Mr. Round,” you say. “Didn’t she say that Gardenia was a thief.” Wes lets out a sigh. “You think she’s Black Spot? That makes three of us. Pam and I think that she’s Black Spot but we’re not 100% sure. Nobody got a good look at Black Spot. All they knew for sure was that she was that she was some kind of feline. It happened 100 years ago though. A lot can happen in 100 years. Gardenia may be Black Spot but we don’t know. Besides, even if she was, there’s nothing anyone can do.” “Why’s that?” you ask. Wes gives a scoff. “There’s such a thing called statute of limitations. Everything that Black Spot stole that wasn’t recovered was stolen 100 years ago. There’s no way the authorities would still be after her then, even if she was still alive and active.” Patty gives a scoff. “Gardenia is no thief,” she says. “We’ve known her for years. Gwendolyn, don’t worry about it. There’s a very low crime rate in Direopolis.”

You nod your head and soon you deliver the pizza and sodas to Gardenia who pays you with a generous tip. You look in surprise because she gave you a strange necklace of some kind with her tip. “Uh,” you say. “Thanks.” Gardenia uses one of her claws to cut herself a slice of pizza. before speaking. “Don’t mention it. It was just something that was laying around the house and I wanted to get rid of it. It’s not really my style.” You nod your head and take the money back to put in the register. Both Salli and Corona hold their thumbs up at you and you smile. But as you put away the money and place your tip in your pocket, you look closer at the necklace that Gardenia gave you. It looks ancient and from the looks of it, it had a piece of amber in the shape of an eye in the center. You shrug your shoulders and put it on. “I don’t know about this,” you think to yourself. “For all I know, this necklace could be stolen. Then again, there’s that statute of limitations thing. I think it should be harmless.” You then hear the door open and look out to see another customer just entered. From the look of it, she was a yellow-green colored monster resembling a humanoid wildebeest with long shaggy hair that obscured her eyes. She was carrying a Japanese human young man on her shoulder and was wearing a strange outfit. She was wearing a basketball tanktop along with a mawashi and was bouncing a basketball.

“Ethiopia!” yells Patty. “How many times do I have to tell you not to bounce that ball in here?” Ethiopia gives a scoff. “You think that I want to damage your property, Patty? Mia charges an arm and a leg.” “What do you expect?” asks Pam. “She only has one good arm.” You take it that this was Ethiopia Gnu, the nut who was trying to invent a sport that combined basketball and sumo. That human she came in with must’ve been her husband. You figured that you had to take her order but as you’re exiting the kitchen, Patty is busy fixing a banana split for another customer and tosses one of the bananas to the side. Unfortunately, the trash can is closed and you wind up slipping on the banana peel, breaking off the door in the process as you bump into Salli who is carrying a plate of chili fries and a strawberry shake. Salli grunts and Allen hides in his wife’s ear as you inadvertently spill the fries and drink all over Ethiopia.

You gasp as does Ethiopia’s human husband. Ethiopia shakes the food off and you see that she’s wearing goggles under her hair. Makes sense since like gorgons, catoblepi had a petrifying gaze.
