From the looks of it, Ethiopia is not happy and gives a snort. Corona gets up and runs up to defend you. Salli steps between you and Ethiopia. “Please, Ethiopia,” says Salli. “Gwendolyn is new to the job. It was an accident. Anyone can make a mistake.” Ethiopia gives a look of anger but then smirks. “Well,” says Ethiopia. “It’s time that this rhino girl earned her keep. Something tells me that right now, she’s about to score big.” You give a gulp as Patty comes out. “What’s all the commotion?” asks the hippo giantess. Patty then sees that there’s a crowd outside looking in on Ethiopia looking at you with a confident grin and you looking nervously.

“There’s about to be a spectacle here, Patty,” says Ethiopia. “You might want to get the arena set because your new employee just challenged me to a...”
115331112112.title: The Scrap

choices: Claire Hands You a Maid Outfit
11533111212.content:
You look down and see that the monster you bumped into was a silver-skinned werelizard who resembled a giant chameleon with three long horns, two in the center of her forehead and the third on the end of her nose, the latter of which had a coffee cup stuck to it from when you bumped into her. She was very obese with a prominent gray-striped hunched back and a massive rear that looked like it could take an entire booth and made her curled tail look undersized in comparison. From the looks of it, she had brownish red hair worn in a long bob cut and was wearing a tan suit with a skirt like the kind a businesswoman would wear, one that was currently stained with hot caffeine. She’s 875ft high, which makes her slightly shorter than your current height transformed into a wererhinoceros. You gasp and step back, realizing that this must’ve been Claire Melon, the hotel tycooness that the Makoas told you about. And you just literally bumped into her and from the looks of it, made her spill her coffee. Given how her eye was twitching, it was still extremely hot.

“Oh my gosh!” you yell. “I am really sorry, Ma’am.” Claire just gives a yell of pain and frustration. “Are those glasses on right?!” yells the chameleon giantess. “Watch out where you’re going! Just what I didn’t need! Now I have to add “Change clothes” and “Do laundry” to today’s list.” You look in confusion before Claire writes down some notes on her phone while at the same time using a few napkins to wipe off her dress. Then she places her phone into her purse and grumbles to herself before she takes out what appears to be a second outfit wrapped in a plastic bag. You then follow her as she makes her way to Neo Neopolitan’s ladies’ room and then she turns around and spots you. “Do you mind!?” she yells in an indignant tone.” You crack a nervous look. “Sorry.” You say. Claire tries to open the door but it won’t budge. “Are you kidding me!? What possessed those idiots to lock the bathroom while they stepped out?!” Then the chameleon giantess lets out a sigh. “I really hate to do this.” She complains.

At that moment, you see Claire turn completely invisible. “Well,” you think. “That’s... understandable. She IS a chameleon after all.” However, Claire’s clothes didn’t turn invisible with her and she unbuttons her coffee stained suit and hands it to you. From the looks of it, underneath the suit she was wearing a Jurassic Park bikini. Somewhat appropriate given that even though she was a chameleon werelizard, she looked like a colossal dinosaur queen. Claire then reaches into her purse and takes out her second outfit. From the looks of it, it’s a pale cloudy blue suit with a rainbow-colored shirt and zebra-striped tie. As Claire is putting on her second outfit, you look at her coffee stained suit and then you decide to put it on. After all, it may be wet, but you couldn’t show up to work the first day wearing nothing but a bikini. You put on Claire’s coffee stained dress and find that it’s rather tight in the chest and stomach area but it’s loose in the rear area, to the point where you’re practically swimming in the skirt. “Do you have Glutos Syndrome?” you ask. Claire gives a hiss as she finally puts her jacket on. “No,” she says sorely. “I’m just FAT! Is that what you do? Go around bumping into people and asking weird questions? Where do you think you are? The K.D.P.?” You give a gulp. “I’m sorry. Please don’t sue me.”

Claire turns visible again and lets out a sigh before turning to face you. “You got off on the Makoas’ car, didn’t you? Are you Isabella’s niece?” “Uh,” you say. “No. My name is Gwendolyn. I’ve come to apply for a job at Neo Neapolitan? Where are the proprietresses?” Claire rolled her eyes. “Just what we need,” said Claire. “Another crazy working here. If you must know, they stepped out for a minute. They’ll be back in a while. I don’t even want to know what they’re doing. The only staff they have at the moment besides you is Tanya.” “Tanya?” you ask. You look and see another waitress busy setting up chairs. She was a 900ft tall werecat with gray fur, blue eyes and orange hair in a ponytail. From the looks of it, she had glutos syndrome as her butt was twice as tall and wide as she was, to the point where it was as big as one of the tables. From the looks of it, she was busy listening to her iPhone as she had yet to notice you. You give a blink. “A werecat?” you ask. “Ooh boy.”

You remember that being framed for trying to rob a feline based monster was what got you in the KDP to begin with and let out a sigh. As you do this, you see a cicada the size of a blimp buzzing around. At that moment, Claire flicks out her tongue, revealing that it’s colored like a seven-colored rainbow and snatches the cicada before dragging it into her mouth and chewing on it like bubblegum right before swallowing it. Your face turns pale as you realize that if A) you were still human and B) it was legal in Direopolis for monsters to eat humans, that cicada could’ve easily been you.

Suddenly Claire’s cell phone rings and then Claire picks it up. “Hello?” asked Claire. “Rebecca, what is it? What!? Juliet quit!? But we need all our maids in place for tonight’s guests. Why did she quit!? Brenda! Why am I not surprised! That acid-tongued little shrew! Tell me what’s the worst job at our hotel right now! Good. Now tell Brenda that’s her new job! Now I need to find a new maid.” Elisabeth and Isabella weren’t kidding. This was the most neurotic woman you’ve ever met. All that caffeine she drank didn’t help the fact. “Thank goodness I didn’t apply for a job at the hotel.” You think to yourself. That is when Claire hangs up and lets out a yell. “If it’s not one thing it’s another!”

Suddenly, Claire turned to you and a flash came to her as she focused her bulging eyes on you. You begin to sweat as she looks at you. "I wonder." Says Claire. At that moment...
11533111212.title: The Lady with the Rainbow Tongue

choices: Skip to the End of the Tour
115331112121.content:
Claire gives a smirk and then she walks up towards you and takes out what looks like a maid's outfit that was just your size. "Consider yourself, hired." You were dumbfounded. You came to apply for a job at Neo Neapolitan but you were being hired for a job at the Rainbow Tongue Hotel. "B-But Ms. M-Melon," you say. "I came to apply for a job working for Salli, Patty and Pam." Claire lets out a sigh. "You can apply tomorrow. You can work for them during the day and work for me at night. Do I look like I have the time to argue? There is important company coming to my hotel in Direopolis over the next few days and we need all the maids we can get. Come on." Claire grabs you by the ear and pulls you out the door.

"Yikes," you think. "She sure is impatient. I just hope she's a benevolent kind of boss. Elisabeth did say that she hired humans to work for her. But wait, she must have hotels all over the monster world. Some of which might be in places where monsters can eat humans without breaking the law. I wouldn't want to work for a giant chameleon woman who could eat me at any time. But the Makoas said she was reasonable. I hope." You decide to put on the maid's outfit while you're running. After all, Claire already hired you, whether you like it or not. "Wait?" you think. "Shouldn't we be traveling by limousine? She's certainly rich enough to have at least one. Maybe she's too impatient to let somebody drive her anywhere."

- - -

Back at the hotel, the manager, Rebecca, a gigantic wending with bright pink fur, a deer-like noise, pointed ears with skull earrings and no horns, was carrying a human in each hand as she went to wait for Claire. One of them was a tan-skinned young man with medium length blackish brown hair and the other was a dark-haired and pale-skinned girl who was too busy filing her nails to pay any heed. "Brenda," says the young man. "You didn't have to be so mean to Juliet. She never bothered you." Brenda just gave a scoff. "Hello, Craig! She was a werehyena. She was probably planning to eat us." "It's illegal to eat humans in Direopolis." "Well, she almost stepped on us. We're better off without that clumsy tongue dragger." Rebecca gives a glare at Brenda. "You know," says Rebecca. "You were lucky to get this job in the first place. It was the only thing we could find above janitor that you were qualified for." Brenda stuck out her tongue "Oh, thanks a lot," she says. "You know, Rebecca. I am not planning to be a gopher forever. One day I'll be running a hotel that will bury this dump." Rebecca just gives a laugh. "Oh," she says. "Oh ho. I'd like to hear you shoot your mouth off to the boss the way you're doing to me."

At that moment, you and Claire arrive at the hotel and pass by the gargoyle doorman. Claire arrives to find Rebecca waiting for her. "Good morning, ma'am." Says Rebecca. Claire glares at Rebecca who looks nervous. "You have a lot of gall calling it a good morning after delivering me bad news. Brenda, I can't believe you drove Juliet to quit. I swear, you're more trouble than you're worth." "That's not saying much with what you pay me, fly breath." You look on and can't believe what Brenda is saying. Who would be stupid enough to insult a boss the size of a skyscraper to her face?

From the look on Claire's face, you could tell this girl was a problematic employee. "You're walking on thin ice, Brenda," says Claire. "Ever since I let Rebecca hire you, all you've done is complain and insult both staff and guests alike. I don't remember the last time I've seen you do actual work." "Maybe that's because your eyes are so weird looking. You'd need to wear salad bowls as contact lenses. Claire shows her sharp teeth and growls. "I am warning you, Brenda, if I get one more complaint about your conduct..." "You'll fire me? That would be doing me a favor." Claire gives a smirk. "Fire you? Yeah right. I think I'd rather transfer you to our hotel in Horrorville. That way, the next time you act up, I can just eat you." The chameleon giantess gives a malicious smile that actually scares her disobedient employee right before she's dragged away by Rebecca.

"That is your coworker, Brenda Tap," says Claire to you. "She's a chronic complainer who thinks she's qualified to be the boss. I keep her around to remind my human employees how NOT to behave. But you're not human, so why am I telling you this?" You give a laugh. "If only you knew." You think to yourself. Rebecca then comes back and Claire speaks to her. "Rebecca," she says to the wendigo. "Please give our new employee a tour of the hotel. I'll be in my office preparing for the arrival of a certain royal guest." "Yes, ma'am." Says Rebecca as Claire walks away. You give a gulp. "I hope I know what I've gotten into."
115331112121.title: The Rainbow Tongue Hotel

1153312.content:
"What about this monster type?" Lacy asked.

"Who are you talking to?" You asked.

115331221.content:
You let out a snort and then you feel your face begin to elongate into a snout and a long nose like that of a matamata turtle and you see your fingers getting thicker and thicker as they grow webs. Your body starts to become rounder and rounder as your skin starts to turn bright bronze with dull green stripes. You feel your clothes tearing and revealing some sort of bronze armor underneath and you look back as you pass the 800ft tall bracket and then you see that you have a shell like that of a turtle, teal in color with jagged spikes that left your shell shaped like a hexagon. You then feel your head in pain as a dome grows on it, filled with water. Lacy smirks and takes out a mirror. “You know, you gotta hand it to the guy writing this chapter, being the type of guy with standards, who mainly writes for the plot. Personally, I wouldn’t have expected you to get turned into a kappa. Here, take a look.”

You take a look and you look in surprise. You were a kappa. You were a 1000ft tall kappa resembling a giant obese anthropomorphic matamata turtle. You feel your chin in disbelief as if to prove to yourself what had happened. “You better get used to it,” says Lacy. “The guy is into transformation without it being undone. But look on the bright side, kappas can live and stay young for a very, very, very long time.” You continue to look in surprise and then walk out in disbelief. You hear somebody coming and then instinctively duck back into your shell. That somebody was Whitney but from the looks of it, she was too focused on her clipboard to pay you any heed. She doesn’t even seem to notice you, when she stops. By the time your rhino nemesis turns around, you’re already gone and then she lets out a sigh and polishes her glasses. “I have got to get my prescription changed.

It isn’t long until you are outside and you let out a sigh of relief, albeit still getting used to your new doughier, scalier body. You even feel your mouth and then pull on your ears slightly. “I’m a kappa,” you mutter. “A large and fat turtle-like yokai. Well, the good news is that I got away from Whitney. Now I got to find a job somewhere.” You waddle and look at the lifeguard house to see a succubus and a gargoyle walking out of it, but then you shake your head. “No,” you say. “It’s too close to the K.D.P. Whitney might get suspicious.” You then decide to sit on a bench, breaking it as you scream and land on your shell.

You struggle to get up right before the gargoyle lifeguard lifts you back up. “Thank you.” You say. The lifeguard smiles and then flies off on her merry way. From the looks of it, she was even fatter than Whitney. As you stand up, you see something caught in your shell and you mutter before you pull it out. It was a newspaper and it had an article in it about something happening in Dreadberry. “Fate’s Hand Casino Opens up in Dreadberry. Help Wanted.” You rub your chins and then you give the article some thought. Perhaps the owner is looking for somebody like you. You really don’t like the idea in a casino but you didn’t have many options. If you were going to live as a monster in the monster world, you needed a job.

 The problem is, how do you get to Dreadberry.

11533122221.content:
"A wereshark, huh, here we go." You give a blink. "Shark?!" Suddenly, you fell yourself getting bigger and bigger as your skin was changing color. You had turned bright blue with white spots and your mouth stretched out as gills grew on your neck. You then grew a long tail and your body took on a more muscular shape as you let out a growl. By the time the transformation was over, you were a wereshark resembling a humanoid whale shark. You give a dumbfounded look and even feel one of your teeth. "Okay," you say with a gulp. "This is definitely going to take some getting used to."

After the transformation, you notice that Lacy has a glum look on her face. “Lacy?” you ask. “Is something wrong?” Lacy let out a sigh. “Well. The thing is that Red said this would be one of his last chapters on the site and from the sound of it, he’s serious. He said he was going to continue his career with his professional work he’s been doing for years before he decided to go to this website. But he’s a fair man and wants somebody to take his stories and keep them on the site so somebody will take care of us. He didn’t put me in this story so I can’t complain, but it’s still too bad that he’s returning his membership card.” You just blink because once again, you have no idea what that gremlin is even talking about.

Suddenly, you hear Whitney calling and flinch. “Sylvia?” she asks. “Are you in here?” You’re confused. Whitney sounds like she’s more concerned than she is angry.” Whitney enters Lacy’s room and then she spots you and looks in surprise. “What happened to you?” asks the rhinoceros giantess. You bite your lip and shake. Whitney rolls her eyes. “Sylvia,” she says. “Don’t say anything. I know it’s you. Come on out, there’s something I need to tell you.” You blink and Lacy shrugs. “Don’t say I didn’t warn you. This is another sign of things to come.” You follow Whitney out of the room and Whitney gives a snort. “There’s been a new development. New evidence shows you WERE framed. And you pleaded insanity just to avoid Under Gloom. Now that I know for sure that it was a misunderstand, I will be the first to apologize for misjudging you and treating you like a criminal.”

 You drop your jaw. “Wait,” you say in confusion. “Whitney? Are you serious? I can go free?” Whitney nods her head. “That’s exactly what I said, Sylvia. You don’t belong in the KDP. It’s too dangerous for someone as delicate as you.” You’re excited and jump up and down for joy and giggle. But then you remember something. “Wait a minute,” you say. “I’m a wereshark now! I can’t go back to Kansas.” Whitney nods her head again. “I’m afraid that I’m no sorceress. I have no idea how Lacy managed to turn you into a shark and I have no idea how to turn you back. If you returned to Kansas as you are, it would cause a panic. Which is why I have a different idea.” You look at Whitney and Whitney looks serious at you. “You are invited to live with me and Xander until we can find you a more permanent residence.”

 You could not believe what you’re hearing. Not only had Whitney had a change of heart, but she was inviting you to live with her. Now, you take back everything bad you ever said about her.
11533122221.title: Sylvia the Shark and Whitney's Change of Heart

12.content:
You saw the door on the West side of the room and remembered that door lead to B-Block. You hesitate slightly before you make a dash under the door. As you’re running, you look back and see six doors and start to recall the monsters staying in B-Block

First was the wereskunk Hazel. You heard she wanted to be a comedian, but nobody thought her jokes were that funny. This led to her becoming the giant monster equivalent of the Joker with her green hair, white makeup and permanent slasher smile. She played all sorts of pranks that nearly got tens of monsters killed. She’s so far the only monster you know of in the K.D.P. to be in a straightjacket and even then she managed to unbuckle it. What made her even scarier was her skunk spray. While all skunks sprayed a foul scent, Hazel sprayed out a gas that was highly toxic to humans and could render a human metropolis uninhabitable.

Then there was Artemis, a python. She was a dragon resembling an actual python but with legs. Artemis was a drunk who came to the K.D.P. to quit drinking. It was a good thing to do for herself but bad for you. Since Artemis has been deprived of alcohol so long, she’s got a serious case of the munchies and will eat anything considered to be food by humans and monsters. That includes you.

One of the more infamous monsters in the K.D.P. was Jen, a haniver, a monster resembling a giant stingray. The woman got a head injury walking home from a movie about the mad scientist Dr. Saturday. When she recovered, she was convinced she was Dr. Saturday and begun to build all sorts of crazy weapons to take over the world. Of all the monsters, she’s escaped more than anyone else combined. You still don’t know how she manages to smuggle all that high tech equipment into the institute. The woman also had an electric stinger in her tail and knew how to use it. She could fly and breath underwater, making her the hardest critter for the lifeguards to catch. To make matters worse was that she often tricked the weaker minded patients into helping her escape. And just your luck, Jen used humans as guinea pigs or a quick snack. Mad scientists are bad enough when they’re not giant monsters.

There was also Phoenicia, a hippocampus, a type of monster resembling a cross between a horse and a fish, similar to the creature from the Black Lagoon. There was a similar creature called a kelpie, but Phoenicia had a large fin on her lower back that her kelpie cousin Aqua didn’t. Phoenicia wasn’t an ice element monster but she hated heat so much that she would willingly expose herself to below zero conditions to the point of wearing a bikini in the snow when she didn’t have any fur to protect her. It’s a wonder she didn’t get frostbite. She especially loves the taste of chilled humans.

Then there was a giant monster version of Jekyll and Hyde. Eunice the spriggan. She was a fairy whose malformed face ruined your childhood image of fairies and made you fear them. But it wasn’t her ugly mug that was the scary part. One minute she could be the sweetest thing and the next thing she could be an angry, swearing, violent fiend who hit everyone below the belt. But what really terrified you was that she had a human boyfriend, but she ate him because her hostile personality accused him of cheating on her, which he didn’t even do.

Last of B Block was an obese crow tengu named Core. Core was a klepto who stole everything shiny that wasn’t nailed down. She was actually brought to the K.D.P. for stealing a diamond. While she acted friendly towards humans, she was no friend because Core was a compulsive eater and will unconsciously stuff herself with anything edible available and that included people. What’s scary is that she could be talking to you one second, not realize she’s swallowing you the next second and still be talking shortly afterwards without realizing you’re in her stomach.

This was yet another hall of horrors and you were shivering. Suddenly you hear a strange noise that sounded like snapping and gasp. There was only one creature that made that snapping noise. It was that werecrab Lilith. Lilith was one of the orderlies that wanted to eat you and she loved to taunt you with her snapping claws. Dr. West doesn’t like the orderlies to eat human patients but unfortunately for you Dr. West wasn’t in the hallway. If Lilith saw you out of your cage, you’ll be eaten. Your only hope is to hide in a B-Block cell and even then you’d risk getting eaten.

But Lilith’s shadow comes closer and you realize you’re going to have to take your chances since it appears you’ll be in somebody’s stomach no matter what. But who’s room do you go into?
12.title: B Block

choices: Lilith notices you are in Hazel's cell and tries to get in.
121.content:
Out of pure nervousness to avoid Lilith you quickly duck into the first room there. Hazel's room.

Experimentally sniffing the air it seems clean and skunk free. She must not have sprayed in a very long time. Good News-it means you aren't swooning the instant you stepped foot in there. Bad News-it means Hazel's fully loaded if she notices you.

Speaking of which.....where was she? You take a few steps forward nervously. Look around. Maybe she's asleep? It would be great if you could wait until Lilith leaves without her noticing you.

Stepping back you sit down and lean against the wall, which was unusually soft. Very soft. Almost fluffy. And.....gurgling.......

You spin around. That wasn't a wall! It was Hazel's stomach! The pear shaped skunk was rather plump to begin with and her gut could get even bigger when she was preparing to release one of her massive stink bombs. And you just walked right into it.

"Hehehehehe. Comfy down there?" a female voice boomed out. You look up to see Hazel's grinning face. The skunk was lying on her side, looking over at you. So much for getting out of here in one piece, she saw you.

Stepping back you try to run as Hazel stands to her full height. She takes one stomp forward, shaking the ground causing you to fall.

1253.content:
You run into a room without even thinking. When you catch your breath you look around. Everything seems normal until you hear someone muttering. "This sucks! Why are we even here?" The voice says. "They're only trying to help." the same voice says. "They're not doing anything useful though." Once again, the same voice. You creep closer to see just who this is. You see a large hell hound woman with a voluptuous figure. She's got crimson colored fur and dark red hair that reaches her a little past her shoulders. She appears to be talking to herself. "Look, maybe if we just cooperate, we'll be out soon." she says. "Don't be so naive." she responds to herself while looking slightly to the left. "I also think we shouldn't cause any trouble." she says this while looking to the right.

As you stare at her you suddenly remember who she is. This is Hadie, a hell hound. She was admitted to the asylum for multiple personality disorder. She's convinced that she's a cerberus thats missing two of its heads. She talks to herself because the personalities of the other two heads are still there. One of them appears to be the actual Hadie, who is pretty rational, while the other two are abrasive and cautious, respectively.

Hadie suddenly starts to sniff the air and turns in your direction. Crap! "A human!" she says. You run away to the door but she runs after you and is gaining fast. Unfortunately she steps right in front of you and you crash into her furry foot. As you wait for her to make her move you instead hear her talking. "What should we do?" she asks. "I say we eat her!" she responds. "No way! We don't know where she's been! We could get sick" You stare up as she argues with herself and then take off in another direction. "Look at that! Now she's getting away!" Hadie tells herself. "We should try to calm her down" she also says. "I think we should just get rid of her and be done with this." You run for all you're worth but once again you feel her bearing down on you. Looking back you see that she's practically got you, but which personality is in control?

12531.content:
A giant hand picks you up as your legs continue to run in midair. Hadie lifts you to her face and gives you sigh. "What is a human like you doing in here?" she asks. You're caught off guard by how nice she seems but remember that she has three multiple personalities. "Um, I was trying to get away from one of the orderlies and sort of ended up in here." you answer meekly. Even if she seems reasonable now you can't forget that she could change any second. "What are you running for?" she asks. You try to think of a response but you are interrupted. "I bet you're trying to escape!" Hadie blurts out while turning her head slightly to the left, but still keeping her eyes on you. You start to sweat as Hadie eyes you accusingly. "Leave her alone. If I recall, you wanted to escape too." she says as the center personality regains control. She then addresses you. "But honestly, I don't know what to do with you."

The hell hound walks to the center of the room and begins pacing back and forth. "Now how should I handle this?" she ponders. You sit in her palm and wait for her decision. You really hope she'll just let you go. "I could just let you go." she begins. "No way! We should eat her for trespassing!" her left personality says. Hadie ignores her own outburst and continues. "Or I could keep you here. It gets kind of lonely with just these two for company." The right personality butts in this time. "No! We can't keep her! We could get in trouble!" You sit there and wait for her to make a decision. After a few minutes Hadie decides....
12531.title: Rational

125312.content:
"All right, I'm going to keep you." Hadie decides. This is bad. If you're stuck with her then its only a matter of time before one of her other personalities does you in. "Come on!" her angry side says. "Why can't we just eat her? Its been so long since we had human!" You wince at her words. "Oh be quiet. You may like to eat humans, but we don't. It always leaves a bad taste in our mouth." the calm Hadie says. You really don't like this conversation.

Hadie carries you to her bed and sets you down. Before you can make a move she plops down in front of you with her face very close to you. "So what's your name?" she asks. "Uh, Sylvia." you answer meekly. "Well I'm Hadie. I may look like a normal hell hound, but I'm actually a cerberus. I just happen to have one head instead of three." she says. You stare at her nervously and she suddenly moves her face closer. "Hey I'll bet she doesn't believe us!" she says in her angry voice. You fall on your butt and cover your head with your arms in fear. As you tremble Hadie pulls her head back. "Stop that! You're scaring her!" she tells herself. This whole talking to herself thing is really starting to creep you out. Suddenly you feel feel her furry finger rubbing your back, as if trying to calm you down. It helps a little, but you're still scared.

Suddenly Hadie grabs you and starts to lie on her back. She gets under the covers and holds you to her face. "Well its about time for lights out." she tells you. Its that late? You must have spent more time wandering the halls and dealing with this gigantic hell hound than you thought. "We're sleeping with it?" Hadie's nervous voice says. "I really don't like this." You and her both. "Everybody quiet. We're going to bed. " calm Hadie says. "Now good night." Where does she keep you for the night?
125312.title: Sylvia The Pet

1253122.content:
Hadie lifts the covers and slips you down her shirt. "There, you'll be nice and warm." she says. You sit on your butt and back up slightly. Soon your back runs into something that you realize is her breast. "Ew, I can feel it moving!" nervous Hadie says. You can feel her cringe as you absentmindedly feel her giant boob. Suddenly she peers directly at you while tilted to the left. "You better not wake me up with your squirming, or I'll be having a midnight snack!" she warns. Her middle self then takes over. Your fear gets the better of you and you decide to go the other way. Crawling back into her shirt you make your way to her stomach.

You make you way past her breasts and find yourself on her belly. The fur feels nice and you are calmed a little by it. This calm is short lived as a shift causes you to stumble onto your own belly. In a panic you dash forward as it comes down and scratches the place where you were.

When you land you catch yourself on the front of them and end up feeling Hadie's private area. There is a sudden shift as she tenses up and you hear her begin to whimper. Her pants are lifted and the dreaded paw returns. You once again dash forward and escape as she fondles her crotch. The world shifts again as she turns onto her right side. You can hear her panting and whimpering and you try to shut it out of your mind. Moving forward you are impeded again as her legs close together and you have to struggle to get free. When you slip out of her leg lock you crawl forward to the opening at the end of her pant leg.

When you get to the end of the tunnel you don't hear Hadie anymore. She must have finished and is now sleeping soundly again. You crawl into the open and find yourself on her furry foot. You think you're home free until she moves again and is once again laying on her back. This causes you to tumble to her toes and she unconsciously grips you with them. As you struggle in their grip you hear her giggling in her sleep. She scrunches her toes and moves them around while you try to escape. You finally manage to get away and fall onto the bed right in front of her paws. You crawl to a spot where you can see her face and find that Hadie is.....
1253122.title: The Path Of The Hell Hound

13.content:
You look to the hallway directly behind Dr. West’s desk and see that it leads to the C-Block area. You heard there were some seriously screwed up patients there, but it was in Charlene’s jurisdiction so you weren’t completely concerned, so you dart under the door. However, as you walk down the hallway you see that it was completely dark and shiver. “I sure hope I see Charlene today,” you say. “I could use a little protection in this area.”

Your words were all too true because the monsters in this wing were extremely dangerous to humans. The first of the C-Block patients was Mandy, a literal flying pig. Even though Mandy was a big fat sow, she was as vain as a peacock and a perfectionist in regards to her own beauty, to the point where she got insanely jealous if there was anyone who she thinks might be more beautiful than her. Most of the time she’s staring at her own mirror. You dreaded being a girl human when you were near Mandy because Mandy especially hated the idea a human could be more beautiful than her. Knowing that laughing pig, she’d eliminate that kind of competition, to her belly.

Next was yet another of the regular escapists and a really bizarre one. Her name was Natasha and she was a black widow drider who thought she was a pirate. Whenever she escaped, she usually attacked the beachgoers and tried to rob them. She even spoke like someone out of Pirates from the Caribbean. As much as you were afraid of crabs, you were afraid of spiders even more since Natasha trapped humans in her webs and is just as carnivorous as any other spider.

The third C-Block patient was Eartha, a hot-tempered French gargoyle who was said to be a rouge. She used to live near Paris and never caused any trouble, but some annoying kid started playing all sorts of rotten pranks on her. Eartha endured the tricks until one day the brat sprayed graffiti all over her when she was sleeping. Eartha snapped and went on a rampage. You even heard that she ate three hundred humans before it was over. The court sentenced Eartha to the K.D.P. to take anger management courses. Being in the same room with her was a fatal mistake if you were a human.

Then there was one monster who really destroyed your fantasies, Amalthea the unicorn. As it turns out unicorns are so rare in the monster world that Amalthea thinks they’re extinct and that she’s the last of her kind. She’s so upset about this (false) fact that she actually tried to kill herself before they admitted her. You used to love unicorns as a kid, but Amalthea was no pony you wanted to be around because she drowned her sorrows by eating humans by the handful.

There was even a patient who had an opposite problem to Mandy. Allegra the siren. Allegra was a beautiful caramel skinned woman who just happened to have scaled legs of a fish and gills. Allegra however for some reason couldn’t see her own beauty and was convinced she was drop dead ugly. This boded badly for humans because Allegra thinks eating human girls like you will make her pretty. She practically demolished Miami Beach before she ended up here.

Last was a monster that was very unusual. Jessie, a questing beast resembling a leopard with a snake’s head. Dr. West herself found Jessie living in the jungle alone as a child. Dr. West took Jessie back to Terrordale and adopted her as her own daughter. But Jessie was feral even after all these years. While she listens to Dr. West and has a respect for her, Jessie acts more like an animal than a monster, like a monster Tarzan. And since she lives by the law of the jungle, being in the same cell as her equals getting eaten.

That’s when you feel tremors and you scream slightly. But these tremors weren’t normal. There was a monster coming who was bigger than the orderlies. Then you gasp and see a horned shadow. It was Dr. West’s right hand woman, Whitney, the wererhino. Whitney was the monster you feared the most. That nurse took the K.D.P. very seriously and she didn’t know you were framed for theft. Whitney hates people who plead insanity to avoid going to jail and that includes you. She felt you were taking advantage of Dr. West and tried to convince her boss that your escape attempts were proof of your sanity. That pachyderm nurse even warned you she’d punish you severely if you tried to escape one more time. That woman was even scarier than any predator.

You hear Whitney snort and realize that she’s pissed. Being a rhinoceros, that woman was easily set off. “That no good little cockroach!” she shouts. “I told Kaguya not to let her out of her sight. When I find Sylvia this time... oh... oh, she just better hope I don’t.” You had to hide from Whitney fast or you’re in dire straights. Your only choice is to hide in a patient’s room. But who’s?
13.title: C Block

choices: Attempt to use you to escape
132.content:
Wrong choice, as the moment you entered Natasha's room, you were instantly out in some sort of a web that was fired onto your body. You were screaming in terror as you realized who you entered, and you probably should have thinked before entering the domain of Natasha, the drider. You heard that she is a pirate, always robbing someone etc, and she even spoke like a pirate is most cases, but unfourantely this is your unlucky day, as the dridler starts to appear before you, and you screamed in terror.

"Well, well well, what me have here?" Natasha said as the half-human, half spider beast now appeared before you, and for some reason, she looked quite attractive, even though she was wearing some sort of pirate clothes. "A human entering my room, well this should be interesting, what should I do with a human in my coven (I ain't an expert on pirate talk)?" Natasha smiled with her mouth starting to be licking as she was about to....?
132.title: Trapped!

choices: Play along and stay in-character--you can't afford to antagonize her.
Try to sweet-talk Natasha out of this insanity!
Before you can respond, Whitney enters the cell!
1322.content:
Natasha's fanged mouth almost splits open in a swaggering grin as she tips her tricone hat at you. "Avast, tiny! Got yerself tangled there, eh lassie? Now, what's a wee bilge rat like you doin' in Captain Natasha's quarters?" The delusioned spider-giantess skitters towards your tangled form, her spindly legs clattering on the concrete floor all the while. Natasha towers over you, her human upper portion blocking out the light, and you can't help but gulp.

Fighting down a whimper, you try to answer. "N-nothing, M-Miss Natash--"

"ARGH! Stop that blasted lubber-talk this second!" Natasha growls, cutting you off. She punches a wall to to punctuate the threat, shutting you up right quick. "Listen here, you yellow-bellied little barnacle-shit: I am NOT a 'Miss'! You'll address me as Captain Natasha, and nothing else! 'Miss' be for callin' little prisses on land that be good fer nothin' but robbin' or blastin' holes through the their bloody petticoats with a broadside! Do I look like one of those fancied-up little wenches, little lubber?" She scowls and crosses her arms, seeming to eye you for the first excuse to make you a meal.

...Still, she hadn't eaten you yet, and she seemed to be giving orders (like, what else, the captain of a pirate ship) rather than teasing prey. Maybe you could still get out of this!

"Er, no Captain Natasha. Not in the least...arrr?" You add the weak growl as an afterthought, shrugging as much as you can with the binding web.

Natasha chuckles and shakes her head. "I enjoy t' proper respect, lassie, but...leave talkin' like a sea-dog t' the actual pirates from now on. Bloody 'ell, you're awful at it!"

Ignoring the insult, you fake a chuckle. "So...what now, er, Captain?"

Much to your surprise (and fear), Natasha reaches down and pinches you out of her web between her thumb and index finger, picking the remaining silk off you with her other hand.

"Well, since you asked, lassie...I'm plannin' a mutiny! Ain't right at all to go puttin' the Captain in the brig, and without charges at all! Every swab 'round this bloody place goin' on about how I'm off me rocker! Me! The legendary Captain Natasha, the Black Widow of the Seven Seas! Tell me, lassie: could anyone with their screws loose fight alongside Nelson at Trafalgar, as he sank the dreaded Titanic? Or survive the bloody days at Midway, facin' down the cursed Aztecs? Or brave the treacherous waves of the Black Sea, fightin' off the scurvy-ridden Irish?!"

You very, VERY nearly start laughing right then and there. Natasha wasn't just deluded into thinking she was a pirate, she didn't know a goddamn thing about sailing! Where did this overgrown arachnid learn her history, a Cracker Jack box? (Seriously, the Titanic being sunk by Admiral Nelson? Aztecs at MIDWAY?!) But thankfully for your well-being, you manage to stay serious.

"No, Captain! It'd take a strong, clear mind to survive battles like those!" Mentally, you add Coming up with them, on the other hand...

Your answer must have stoked Natasha's ego something fierce, for lets out a loud, hearty laugh that fills her room, and dispite the fact that she's a man-eating, pirate obsessed lunatic you want to laugh too. She's crazy, but...she's got charisma, you have to admit!

Natasha fans herself with her hat, the last of her laughter ending. "Ha-ha-ha! ...Well, lassie, about that mutiny I'm plottin'...looks like I just found me new First Mate!"

...Oh, fuck.
"Er, I'm not so sure about that, Captain. After all, I'm just a little lubber..." You stutter, trying to get out of this.

"Nonsense, me girl! You'd make a fine addition to me crew; I'd be proud to have ye aboard on me adventures! Why, what with ye bein' so small--no offense!--Ya could sneak and slither 'round this overgrown brig easy, and find a way out! None of the others here would give ya a second look!" Natasha is jovial, but her big grin melts away a bit. "A'course, if yer too bloody yellow to want out of here, I be ye taste better than the blasted gruel they been servin' me..."

"N-NO! I want out as much as you do, but..." Dammit, if you didn't help this wannabe pirate, you were lunch! But there was no way her so-called 'mutiny' could work!
...Right? Maybe you'd get lucky and get out of here!
But then you'd be responsible for letting a man-eating psycho out of captivity!

What the hell were you supposed to do?!
1322.title: Shanghai'd!

choices: She Walks Away - Continue with Plan A
She Heard You! - Time for Plan B
13221.content:
"Aye," you say nervously. "So what am I supposed to do?" Natasha let out a loud and hearty laugh before lowering you down on the ground. "Good choice, lass," says the literal pirate spider. "I need ye to stowaway on the next landlubber that comes on by and plunder their keys. But first, we need to create as much hell as possible in the process. Like Bartholomew Roberts' raid on Impel Down, we will unlock the cells of the most dastardly rapscallions and while the guards are distracted, those that manage to get away shall join us as we escape and set out to sea!" As Natasha was laughing, you groan. She's confusing real pirates with fictional pirates.

Then you gasp. "Wait," you say. "You want me to steal the keys from one of the guards? What if it doesn't work?" Natasha let out a hiss as all of her eyes closed and opened. “Then we have our contingency plan. You will lure the guard to my quarters where me webbing will make short work of her. We’ll shanghai the lass and force the bilge rats that locked us up to provide us with a seaworthy ship that will allow us to make our great escape! Now off with ye!” Without warning, Natasha wraps some webbing around you and tosses you out through the bars on the door to her room.

You let out a yell and then you grunt as you land on the next of the K.D.P. staff who comes by. You see long strands of cyan hair all around you and you realized that you landed on Tori, the salamander. Tori was a pitch black-skinned monster resembling a cross between an actual salamander and a dragon. She had four arms that doubled as two extra pairs of legs and was wearing a cyan bikini as she moved through the hallway on all sixes and then stood up, forcing you to grab her hair. Of course, maintaining your footing is easily said than done on this amphibious giantess’s slimy back. Tori sniffed the air before she blew smoke out of her nostrils and coughed. From the look on her face, she was really tired. “Why did I stay up watching White Butler all night? I’m supposed to be awake and alert in case Grandma isn’t. I overheard Whitney talking to Dr. West about forcing her to retire. Without even asking her first? That’s just mean. What are they thinking.”

Tori’s grandmother Cressida was a large and elderly dragon who was also an orderly. However, Cressida was weak in her old age. She couldn’t fly anymore, she needed a cane to walk, her eyesight was failing her and she couldn’t even breathe fire anymore without hurting her own throat. She was getting too old and weak to do her job properly but she wasn’t willing to retire. Tori became an orderly to protect Cressida’s job and that made her the clear threat among the grandmother-granddaughter duo and she proved it by looking around. You look down yourself and you see Cressida carrying a keyring at the side of her bikini. You inch down from her hair as the salamander doesn’t seem to notice you.

You yourself have your doubts on whether or not Natasha’s plan will even work. But you couldn’t walk away now. After all, pirates don’t like being betrayed. You inch down and find yourself standing on Tori’s keyring. You climb onto the ring and tug on the side in an attempt to pull it out of Tori’s belt. But in the process, you manage to tear the side of the belt and then you gasp. “Oh no,” you say. “Oh no. Please don’t break. Ah!”

You scream as the keychain starts to fall, broken off of Tori’s belt. You hold the chain tight as you fall from hundreds of feet in the air and scream. You could swear your heart is beating right up your throat. It looks like it’s all over, but then there’s a clinkering sound. You look and see that you’ve landed harmlessly. Holding onto the keychain saved you from the impact of the fall. You let out a sigh of relief. But then you realize that Tori might’ve heard you and gasp.

But did Tori hear you?
13221.title: The Mutiny Begins

133.content:
You duck into one of the rooms in order to escape from Whitney. As you try to catch your breath you hear the giant wererhino pass by the door. You hear the stomping of her massive feet as well as her muttering. "That little bug. When I find her she's gonna get it!" As you stand there panting you feel her getting farther away. You can't relax however because the once Whitney's gone you hear someone else muttering. "Don't even know why I'm here. Those rotten humans started it. I was just doing what anyone would do." The voice has a french accent and you know just who it is. It was the gargoyle Eartha. She was in here because she went nuts when some human kids wouldn't stop playing pranks on her. They pushed her too far and sent her on a rampage. The courts put her in the KDP for anger management. "Anger management? I'll show them anger management!" the gargoyle continues to mutter.

You decide its best to get out of here but at that moment someone walks very close to the door. The sudden tremor scares you enough to make you jump away from the door. This catches Eartha's attention and she looks in your direction. You lock eyes with her for a second before she reacts. "What?! A human?!" You immediately panic as she begins stomping in your direction. You dart off in a random direction in an attempt to get away. You manage to slip under a dresser just before she can grab you. You can hear her cursing in french as she reaches under the dresser. You watch as her clawed hand feels around for you to no avail. You sit down and rest for a minute, but it doesn't last long. Just as your heart calms down it begins beating fast again as the massive dresser begins to move around you. The shade it provides disappears and you look up to see Eartha's face. "I've got you now!" she says.

You run away again and Eartha begins her chase again."You're not getting away! Its little bugs like you that put me in here! I'll bet you snuck into my room just to make fun of me! You humans just piss me off so much!" She rants as she tries to grab your scurrying little form. This was not good for your heart. You're scared enough of these patients as it is, and now one of them is chasing you! You don't know how much longer you can keep dodging her clawed hand. You see her bed and decide to try and make it underneath. Do you make it?
133.title: The Angry Gargoyle

choices: You are discovered during the session
1332.content:
You try your best to make it under the bed but you're too slow. Eartha manages to grab you and lifts you into the air. "You little rat!I'm gonna show you what happens to humans who bother me!" she growls at you. Terrified beyond belief you try your hardest to escape the grip of her claws. Seeing your futile struggle only makes the gargoyle laugh. "Hehehe. Not so fun being the one squirming huh? Just wanting to live your life until someone comes along and decides to torment you?" She really does have anger issues. That kid that messed with her really drove her over the edge. Now she's projecting her anger at you.

"I wasn't up to anything! I was just looking for a place to hide!" you almost cry at the giant gargoyle. Eartha snorts and brings you closer to her face. "If you're trying to hide then you must have done something wrong! You need to punished, and its gonna be delicious!" With that she opens her mouth and slowly lowers you inside. You let out a scream and she chuckles at your fear. Just as she has you inside however there is a knock on the door. "Eartha? Its time for your anger management session." You know that voice. Its Charlene! Even though you're still in a horrible situation you can't help but feel a little relieved. Eartha curses out loud and jerks you away from her mouth as the door slowly opens. She stuffs you into her cleavage without thinking and walks over to Charlene. "Is it that time already?" she asks in an annoyed tone. "I don't need anger management, I just need stupid jerks to leave me alone!" Her voice is very loud, something Charlene picks up on. "See? Outbursts like that are the reason you're here. You need to control yourself to avoid another rampage." Eartha scoffs. "Who cares about that? I only ate some humans. They probably had it coming anyway!"

While the two of them talk you try to crawl your way up through Eartha's breasts. You try to call for Charlene but Eartha notices you and discreetly pushes you back down. She then folds her arms to keep her breast pushed together in order to keep you trapped. She probably knows Charlene would take you from her and doesn't want to lose her snack. Eventually Charlene leads Eartha to a door and holds it open. "Here we are. I hope it goes well." she says as Eartha walks in. The gargoyle just rolls her eyes and sits on a couch. How does her session go?
1332.title: Displaced Anger

choices: uses you to relieve some stress
13321.content:
Eartha sits down on the couch as Dr. West waits in a chair. "Hello Eartha, how are you feeling today?" the kitsune asks. Eartha just sighs. "Just great Dr. West." she replies sarcastically with her arms still folded. With her arms like this you're pretty much trapped and can't move much. "Now there's no need to be defensive. We're here to help you." Dr. West says calmly. Eartha rolls her eyes. "I don't need help, I just got a little carried away." she shoots back. "You ate 300 innocent humans." says the doctor. "So? Lots of monsters eat humans." Eartha counters. "You used to like humans though. What happened to change that?" Dr. West asks. The gargoyle begins to raise her voice a little. "Because I realized how annoying they are! If they're going to be a nuisance then I might as well get rid of them!" She hugs her arms tighter to her chest when she says this, which increases your discomfort.

The session last a little longer but doesn't go anywhere. Dr. West tries to explain that just because one human went too far doesn't mean all of them should be eaten. Eartha isn't very receptive however. When time is up Charlene returns. "Oh hello Charlene. We're just about out of time for today, so would you mind taking Eartha back to her room?" says the doctor. As she leads the gargoyle through the hall Charlene asks how it went. "Did you make any progress?" she asks. "Oh loads." says Eartha sarcastically. "I've learned that eating those little jerks is wrong." Charlene sighs as they reach Eartha's room. "Well I hope it goes better next time. And try to be less defensive, you haven't unfolded your arms since I took you out of here." she says as the gargoyle enters. "Sure." says Eartha as the door closes.

"Now back to my snack." Eartha says as she pulls you out of her cleavage. "Please, just let me go! I didn't do anything!" you plead in a terrified voice. "Didn't do anything? I had to keep my arms folded that entire time because of you! Do you have any idea how annoying that was?" she responds angrily. You want to mention that she didn't have to do that and only did it so she could keep you, but you know it would only make her angrier. It seems impossible to get through to her. She's sarcastic and a little rude, and when it comes to humans she's clearly beyond reason. all you can do is wait in fear for what she does next. Eartha....
13321.title: Not Very Productive

133211.content:
Eartha looks down on you and gives an evil smirk before she licks her fangs. You scream as the gargoyle giantess laughs wickedly. "Please," you say. "Gargoyle don't eat humans." Eartha begins to drool as she scratches your head. "I'm not like other gargoyles Ma petite repas," says the giantess. "But don't worry, you'll be delicious."

You scream again and then Eartha pushes you against her huge belly and then rubs one of her thunderous thighs with you. "Feel that little human?" asks Eartha. "You'll be part of my thighs real soon." Eartha then grabs you by your hair and makes you grunt in pain as she holds you up into the air above her open mouth. You look down and see the bottomless pit leading to certain doom. "Spare me!" you yell. Eartha laughs wickedly before she drops you. You scream and fall before Eartha snaps you in her mouth and swishes you in her mouth with her tongue.

You can't help but yell in horror as the tongue assaults your body and pushes you into Eartha's fangs. You try to hold onto her gums but Eartha puts her teeth down on your hand and traps you. Eartha licks you as you struggle to break your hand free. Then Eartha pushes you in between her jaws and starts chewing on you, not enough to break the skin, but you're still in terror as the gargoyle bites down on you.

Then you feel the mouth shifting and soon enough Eartha spits you out into the air screaming, right before she snaps you up again and swishing you in her cheeks. She was toying with you before she ate you, like a cat. You're now so horrified you scream at the top of your lungs. "HELP ME!!" Eartha just laughs wickedly as her tongue wraps around you like a snake.
133211.title: Eartha's Hunger

135.content: You hear the tremors of Whitney's massive feat and realize that the wererhino was getting closer. If you don't hide in someone's room fast, Whitney will catch you and punish you for trying to escape again.
135.title: C Block Part II

1353.content:
You quickly go in a room only marked with a single word:


"Xyn"


As soon as you're sure you are completely in, you turn around to find........old pictures of a someone's family throughout the generations.


"Is someone there?"

A voice not yours rung out. You quickly turn your head to the side and see.....
1353.title: Good old war(It's a band.)

13532.content:
Odaxitar the 800 ft succubus would be there, sniffing the air languidly. Her large talons were especially prominent as her violet hair streams straggly over broad porcelain muscles, her elegant face still having the hint of the feral to it, she seems to be in a straitjacket and seems to spend some time gnawing at the straps. Glinting silver eyes would meet yours as she grimaces. Odaxitar's giant fangs lacing the air as she yawns deftly, a long slithering tongue would flop out sideways, you would back away as the succubus would growl ferally, she seems to have noticed your presence as you see bags under her eyes, Odaxitar evidently hasn't slept a jolt. As if on cue, she would begin arguing with thin air.
"Dr. Kaguya put me into this jacket, but I have yet to tear out of here!" You hear Odaxitar growl to herself.
Almost on cue, you hear Odaxitar reply in an innocent tone, "These injections don't seem to be helping."
"Whatever Olapen, I'm sure that Kaguya would let us out of here anytime soon." Odaxitar laughs in a growling voice at Olapen's reply.
"Oh look, there's a human here! Maybe you can help us?" Olapen points out cautiously as you stare at the apparently deranged succubus
"I don't trust you," Odaxitar glares straight at you...
13532.title: Odaxitar the succubus

14.content:
You see the East side of the room and run into the D-Block holding room. This time, you’re really careful and look around as you walk backwards. This is where they keep the most messed up patients.

First was the infamous Avery, a 27 year old chimera. Her mother was a landshark but Avery herself was a combination of a landshark, a yuki-onna and some type of octopus based monster. She was only 12 when she came to the K.D.P. but she was really messed up. Her human boyfriend was killed in a bloody explosion by a vampire serial killer and caused Avery to snap and tear the killer to pieces. Avery was usually friendly, but when she saw blood, she went bonkers and went on a rampage. Even though she was only 300ft tall she was super strong. She was able to pile drive that gargoyle lifeguard Roxy and given how fat Roxy was that was quite an accomplishment.

Then there was Nicole, a nuckelavee, a freakish looking creature resembling a skinless horse with veins all over her body. The woman was a masochist who tortured herself in such grizzly ways that her already malformed body became hideously scarred. But she didn’t know when to stop and her boyfriend sent her to the K.D.P. to break her of her odd habits. You heard that she even swallowed humans carrying guns, knives and bombs and went so far as to eat tanks. It’s a wonder her decrepit body is in tact.
 Then there was Paula, a big fat cyclops woman who worked as a maid in a mansion until she mistook a crack in a window for a stain and went into a mental breakdown trying to clean it. The woman had the worst case of OCD you ever saw and considered humans to be dirty vermin. She even screamed when someone so much as left footprints in her room. Unlike most other monsters in the K.D.P., Paula had a child, a daughter named Irene who visited her once a week, though given how athletic Irene was compared to her obese mom, you don’t know how they could be related. But you’re not complaining since unlike Paula, Irene considers humans to be too unhealthy to eat.

One of the most bizarre cases in the K.D.P. was Mercy, a Southern Belle who doesn’t realize she died hundreds of years ago. That zombie still hasn’t realized she’s dead. In fact, she thinks she’s checked into the hotel and that the K.D.P. patients and staff are wearing monster costumes. That dropped dead ditz even sees you as a type of insect that’s considered a delicacy. If only she knew she was eating humans. But you couldn’t believe how she could be oblivious to her rotten flesh, exposed bones and tattered clothes.

Next was Missy the werealligator. Missy was a soldier in a terrible war a few decades ago. They say she was injured and washed up on shore in the human world. She was so starved that she resorted to eating anything she could, including humans. Even though she got out of the war alive, Missy was still shellshocked and had flashbacks of her terrible experiences that caused her to be violent and hostile without realizing it. She didn’t even take off her armor from the war. But she was the most terrifying creature in the K.D.P. because that gator girl developed such a taste for humanity that her skin, hair and armor were permanently stained red with the blood of every human she’s ever devoured.

The last patient was Taylor the Stymphalian Bird. She was an obese avian with golden feathers that were as sharp as swords. Taylor wouldn’t be in the K.D.P. unless something was wrong with her, but Dr. West couldn’t diagnose exactly what the problem was because Taylor never speaks and communicates by stomping her talons on the ground instead. But she was nonetheless creepy because Taylor ate humans, spat out their bones and made them into jewelry. Just the thought of being made into a bracelet filled you with dread.

But not as much dread as what you heard next. It was a clucking noise that made you scream. “Gail!” you shout. You see the shadow of Gail the cockatrice, that chicken lizard would no doubt either try to eat you or try and feed you to your friend Charlene. Oh, this was bad, bad bad. You had to hide in a cell with the craziest monsters in all of D-Block. Who’s room will be your shelter?
14.title: D Block

choices: You go through a period, you know what that means for Avery
141.content:
You ended up running into Avery's room, the chimera. The girl who can bring down a monster twice her size, and the fact that she doesn't eat humans, you see this as a good hiding place... hopefully. She is a pretty crazy girl in her own right, as whenever she sees blood, she goes all musha and goes crazy in an instant. It's bed not to injured yourself with some blood, otherwise that might end up being your downfall. She looks and sees you, and you kept yourself still just in case she might be hostile or something, but actually, she isn't.

"Well, who are you?" Avery asked just as she use her fins on you to blow off any problems. "I am Sylvia, and you are?" "Avery. I hope you and I can be friends." she replied just as she brings you to your deck. "So, what brings you here?"

How does Sylvia react?
141.title: Bloody mess

choices: She decides to eat you right there.
She wants to make you more appetizing.
You actually manage to get her attention.
144.content:
You look around the room and take in the decor. The walls are painted a light blue and the carpet is green. There is a canopy bed that looks pretty fancy for a mental ward. There are also things like a desk, chair and even a sofa, all of which look old fashioned. Sitting in the chair by the window is a woman with grayish green skin. This is Mercy's room. She's a lich who died many years ago and still doesn't know it. The zombie girl gets out of the chair and turns in your direction. As she walks you see that being dead hasn't hurt her figure. You jump out of the way as she almost steps on you. She walks up to the door and lays a hand on it. "This is a charming hotel but I do wish the rules about leaving our rooms were less strict." she says in a southern accent. Mercy is from the old west, and rose from her grave many years later. The shock must have been too much because she simply refuses to acknowledge what year it really is, let alone that she's actually died. Now she lives here, thinking that she's in a hotel.

Mercy turns again and walks back to the window. You wonder to yourself why she doesn't question that it has bars on it. You have to dodge again as she almost steps on you. As you run she notices your movement. She looks down and catches you scurrying across the floor. "Well what have we here?" she says aloud. Right then and there you freeze in place before taking off like a bullet. You had hoped she wouldn't notice you, but that didn't work out too well. Not wanting to get caught you bolt back towards the door. but the booming of Mercy's footsteps fills your ears. Before you reach your goal you are scooped up by a hand wearing a worn out glove. Mercy dangles you in front of her face, giving you a full view of her. She must have been pretty when she was alive, and it still shows. However now she's missing part of her lip.

"I haven't had one of these in long time!" Mercy says happily. "I was a little scared to try eating bugs at first but these turned out to be quite the delicacy." Looks like she's confused you with some sort of bug people used to eat in her time. Now you're terrified that this giant belle wants to eat you. "Try all you want little guy, but you won't get away. You're too tasty to let go." You're going crazy with fear and start to struggle furiously, which amuses Mercy. What happens?
144.title: Have Mercy

145.content: As you wonder what you'll do, you hear Gail come closer. "Today is (buckaw!) the day! I'm (cluck) finally going to get Charlene to try a human. Think of how closer we'll be when we (buckaw!) both have the same favorite food." Crap. You have to think fast. Gail's in that mood again.
145.title: D-Block Part II

1451.content:
With the giant Cockatrice approaching you rush into one of the rooms. When you look around you feel a tense atmosphere. As you walk forward to find a place to lay low you suddenly hear the sound of metal clanking. You look over in the direction of the sound and see someone lying on the bed. Its Missy the weregator. She's a veteran of a monster war that happened decades ago, but is still haunted by the memories. Because of this she refuses to take off her armor, which is what made the clanking noise you heard earlier. Missy herself is bad enough, but the sight of her armor fills you with dread. Its supposed to be silver but instead its bright red. You heard that it was permanently staind this color from the blood of all the humans she's ever eaten. Her scales are red for the same reason.

You slowly make you way to bed. You can hide under it until you feel its safe and then make your way back to the hall. You once again hear the sound of metal and look over. Missy is sleeping and just turned over. She's now facing your direction, making you rather unnerved. As you make your way closer you glance at her constantly. She may terrify you but you have to admit she has beautiful hair. Its long and scarlet colored, and actually goes well with her scales. Thinking about that makes you shudder as remember why her scales are red. Eventually you reach your destination and walk under the bed. Slumping down you let out a sigh and relax. Just as you do however you hear the groaning of the bed as Missy begins to get up. Whether she actually heard you sigh or woke up naturally you don't know. All you know is that now escape will be even more difficult.

Missy gets off the bed and you see her scaly feet touch the ground. She walks over to the window, creating booming noises as she does. "I can't believe I'm stuck here." you hear her say in frustration. "I fought for bravely in the war and this is what I get? I don't even know why I'm here." You peak out and see her looking out the window as she talks. You decide to sneak away while she's not looking. You make you way to the door while checking to make sure she's still not looking. When you're about halfway there Missy suddenly turns around and leans on the window sill. She sighs and then happens to look in your direction. She spots you and her eyes widen. "A human!" she exclaims. As she comes after you she's.....
1451.title: The Veteran Gator

1453.content:
not wanting to be caught you quickly duck into a darkened room hoping it is unoccupied. you catch your breath just inside the door frame as Gail runs past the room and down the hall. you give it a few minutes before you let out a sigh of relief and begin to explore the room you are currently in. its dark but your eyes are beginning to adjust to the darkness and you begin to make out the shapes of the generic furniture the hospital uses. you continue to explore the room before you begin to notice signs of occupancy such as papers on the floor and the mess the bed is in. you also notice that there are claw marks on various surfaces. you decide that it would be best to leave before you awaken the rooms inhabitant, but as you turn to leave you are now face to face with massive creature. you immediately freeze, shocked by the silence with which the giantess was able to sneak up on you "well well well, what do we have here?" the giantess purrs "if it isn't a little human." the monster says grabbing you in her paws and standing to her full height. she keeps you in her closed hand as she closes her door and turns the lights on. you are assaulted by the sudden rays as you are dropped onto the gigantic bed. you look up at the giant before you and immediately recognize her as none other than the Were Panther Amara.

Amara is a 400ft tall were panther with black fur, yellow eyes and a petite figure. she was admitted to the K.D.P. due to issues with paranoia. it began when she was a teenager and she was betrayed by those she considered her friends and only got worse as she got older. now 22 years old she has severe trust issues when it comes to her fellow monsters and will only trust a select few such as Dr. West. surprisingly this mistrust doesn't extend to humans although you are not sure about wether or not this is because she believes they are food.

you look up at the giantess and can't help but feel odd as she sits in front of you and gives you an odd grin. "so whats your name?" she says. "I'm Sylvia" you reply. "Hi Sylvia I'm Amara sorry about sneaking up on you but you never know who's going to show up" she says "you gotta watch your back at all times". you smile as Amara begins talking to you as if you were an old friend and after a few hours you feel as if that may be true. you can't help but feel bad for the giantess' plight after hearing about the pain she had endured at the hands of her peers. as you continue with your conversation something happens what is it?
1453.title: Amara the were panther

145321.content: As you and Amara continue your talk you are interrupted by the sound of the door opening. like a flash of light Amara quickly jumps from her bed and launches herself into the closet. shocked by her sudden reaction you duck under the covers of the bed and peer out towards the door. "Hello, Amara its Dr. West may I come in?" you see the familiar image of Dr. West standing in the doorway holding her clipboard. "Come in quickly" Amara says as she jumps out of the closet to quickly close the door behind the doctor. "so why are you here?" Amara says with a hint of suspicion in her voice. "well I was on my way back to my office and it sounded as though you were talking to someone, I figured I would check in on you". you suddenly wonder what Amara is going to do. If she tells Dr. West you are here you will be caught again, but if she stays silent it could set her treatment back. how does Amara respond?
145321.title: Dr. West

1453212.content: "oh!" Amara perks up "I was just talking to my new friend Sylvia". "Sylvia?" Dr West says "It can't be". suddenly before you can even react the blanket is torn off the bed and you are scooped up into Amara's large paws. "Here doctor allow me to introduce you to my new friend Sylvia". "so you've escaped again Sylvia" Dr. West says as she takes you from Amara. "what are you going to do with her?" Amara asks. "don't worry Amara I just need to take sylvia back for today but we will see about having her visit again". "ok then Doctor". "I'll see you tomorrow for your therapy session" Dr. West says and with that she begins to walk towards her office. "looks like you've had a bit of an adventure" she says "although I can't be too mad considering you managed to help a fellow patient, I haven't seen Amara open up like that to anyone". "she just looked like she needed someone to talk to" you say. "well perhaps you could talk to her more frequently, it would be good for both her therapy and your own." Dr. West says "so Would you be willing to help with her therapy?"
1453212.title: New Friends

1453222.content: what about one of the other orderlies? or perhaps a D block patient.
1453222.title: other

15.content:
Before you could consider a decision, you hear a door opening and gasp. Dr. West couldn’t possibly be back this soon. This was one of the staff. “P-Please don’t be Whitney.” You groan to yourself. Whitney was a wererhino nurse who was Dr. West’s second in command. While she was friendly towards humans, you were the one human she didn't like. She saw you as a criminal trying to take advantage of Dr. West to stay out of prison and feels that you deserve to go to Under Gloom. This is mainly because she finds your situation unfair to the monsters with legitimate mental problems. That wererhino was the biggest monster you’ve ever seen and her sumo wrestler like build made her seem even larger to a scrawny human girl like you. If she caught you out of your cage, she’d be furious.

That woman is so strict. You decide to hide under Dr. West’s desk to avoid being noticed. There’s a chance Whitney wouldn’t find you. But what if this wasn’t Whitney? More likely it was one of the 12 orderlies and then there’d be a high chance of being eaten since you knew of 9 predatory beasts with two ambiguous. Which of them could it possibly be?
15.title: Escape Interrupted

choices: Whitney Gets Up with you Holding Her Tail
151.content:
As you hide under the desk, you feel the tremors from the footsteps. You're knock across the ground to the other side of the desk before you crawl back underneath. Those footsteps were MUCH louder than usual when it comes to monsters. Whoever this was, was not only bigger than all the other monsters in the K.D.P. but also several times heavier.

Then you gasp because you realize there's only one monster that woman could possibly be. You hear a door open and you look ahead to see a pair of white pachyderm style feet and your concerns come true, it was Nurse Whitney the wererhino. You hide behind one of the legs of the table and start to sweat. The massive rhino woman at the time was walking towards Dr. West's desk and as she adjusted her glasses (wererhinos are notorious for bad eyesight) she sees your empty cage and gives an angry snort.

"That little bitch got out again," she grumbled to herself. "I warned Kaguya about her. If there was something wrong with that hussy, she wouldn't have the common sense to know how to pick the lock. That little liar. This time I'm going to put her in a jar!" You gulp in your hiding place as that enormous horn nosed nurse stomps around looking for you. "The little snot couldn't have gotten far. You try to be nice, but no, some cowardly thief has to pretend to be crazy just to save her own ass. I know you can hear me Sylvia. If you give yourself up, I might be lenient about your punishment."

Lenient and her? Those were two words that didn't fit together at all. You're just lucky that Whitney actually likes humans and not in the food way. She actually was against monsters eating humans. According to Dr. West, Whitney was actually married to one. You wonder what kind of man would want to marry a colossal, bloated, thick skinned pachyderm with the temper of a bulldozer.

Suddenly you hear a loud thud. Whitney had got on her knees to look for you. You stay hidden as you see her enormous eye trying to spot you. That blue tattoo around it struck fear in you and you're literally frozen with fear. Whitney inches herself forward to look for you and you nervously step back. You think about trying to make a run for the back door when you look and see that rhino woman's meteor sized rear, her bright orange hair directly over it and her silver bikini bottom barely covering it.

You then see Whitney's short tail shaking back and forth. Then you think that Whitney could be your ticket out, as frightening and unlikely as it sounded. Whitney scared you more than any other monster you've ever met. But you gulp and walk to the sole of Whitney's heavy foot before you climb it. Whitney continues looking for you on all fours and you're amazed that the wererhino didn't feel you climbing her. You take it her thunder thighs were too thick to notice a petit human girl like you. You see Whitney's tail waving and grunt before you jump and grab it.

The tail swings you back and forth until you press your legs against the fabric of Whitney's bikini bottom and start to climb. You see Whitney's lab outfit at her side and figure that if you could reach it, you'd be home free. A rather risky move given that you were climbing your worst enemy but Whitney would never look for you on her own body. Would she?
151.title: Rhino Rampage

choices: Downtown to do a Few Errands
1511.content:
As the rhino giantess scans the floor for you, she wags her tail and shifts her body. As you hold on tight you see Whitney's long orange hair hanging down her back and jump. You grunt and grab hold of the end of the hair before Whitney lets out a confused grunt.

The wererhino's ears twitch and she snorts as she starts to get up. You rapidly climb up her hair and grunt before you leap into the pocket of her lab coat. You almost miss it but grab hold of the lining to climb inside.

The rhino giantess arises and looks around and you cross your fingers and hope she doesn't notice you're in her pocket. She then lets out a snort. "I'm going to find her," she says. "And when I do, I'm going to punish her so hard she'll be begging for prison. Whitney looks down as she walks out of the room slowly, her every movement shaking her labcoat as it dangles. You let out a sigh of relief. You're safe in Whitney's pocket. All you have to do is hang on, hope she doesn't realize you're in there and you can make it out when she clocks off.

Meanwhile, Whitney is walking down the hallway where she sees that Cyprus in the hallway. Cyprus was a behemoth, a monster resembling a gigantic hippopotamus and in her case with a dragon's skin. Cyprus was eating what looked like a sandwich made from roasted humans as her wife and fellow orderly, the bahamut Jedda looked on. Cyprus stops eating and smiles at Jedda. "I'm sorry baby," she says. "I forgot you swore off humans." Jedda gives a nervous laugh. "No problem Cyprus. Just because I've gone cold turkey doesn't mean you should."

Whitney walks up to both hippopotamus based monsters and gives a glare. "Hi Whitney," says Jedda. "Something bugging you?" "Have either of you seen Sylvia?" "She got out again did she?" asks Cyprus. "Nope, if I saw her, she'd be in my belly right down." Cyprus rubs her fat stomach and you shudder in Whitney's pocket when you hear that.

Whitney looks at Cyprus's human sandwich and gags in disgust. "That's barbaric!" she yells. It would make sense she'd disapprove of human consumption, if what you heard about her having a human husband was true. "Well if you see Sylvia, don't you dare eat her. She isn't getting off that easy." Whitney stomps off and you sigh in relief.

After a long day, Whitney is checking out with Dr. West who is visibly concerned. "Oh," says Dr. West. "Poor Sylvia must be scared half to death. I really hope she didn't get eaten or stepped on, especially after Phoenicia ate Mark. Someone as unwell as hers can't be wandering about." Whitney lets out a sigh. "Kaguya, Sylvia is perfectly fine. I keep telling you that she's just hiding from justice. That woman is a common thief." Whitney really thought you did commit that robbery. She had no idea you were framed and you couldn't prove otherwise.
