Dr. West lets out a sigh. "Well," says the doctor. "I just hope she's safe wherever she is. See you tomorrow Whitney." "See you tomorrow Kaguya." Whitney leaves the K.D.P. and you're absolutely giddy. You couldn't believe it, you were finally out of this madhouse for monsters. Now you just had to stay on Whitney and then slip away without her noticing and you can get back to the human world.

Speaking of Whitney, where is the wererhino giantess going now?
1511.title: Whitney's Pocket

choices: Xander Notices You and Alerts Whitney
15111.content:
Whitney walks forward and you hold on tight to the fabric of her lab coat pocket. Each step feels like an earthquake. Not only was Whitney the biggest monster in the K.D.P. but she was also the heaviest. Makes sense given that she's A) a rhinoceros and B) A BBW. The next thing you knew, Whitney was starting a car based on the noise you heard. You hold on tight and scream. Fortunately, as Whitney drives away, the engine sound covers up your screaming.

The wererhino woman drives down the road from the beach and you feel like you're about to throw up, only to pause. Whitney hated you enough already. If you barfed in her pocket she'd really be sore. Whitney drives further down the street and suddenly comes to a stop.

You hear a door and the wererhino gets out and hums to herself. You peak your head out of Whitney's pocket and look up to see a beautiful two floor house not that far from the beach. You gasp because you realize that Whitney had taken you back to her place. Of all the rotten luck. You slap yourself in the face. "Way to go Sylvia," you mumble to yourself. "Now it'll be twice as hard to get away from Whitney in her own home."

You hear a key turning and realize that Whitney is going inside. Once indoors, you hear Whitney let out a sigh. "Rough day at the office dear?" asks a male voice. "You can say that again Xander," says Whitney. "I envy you being able to work from the house. Everything was crazy. Amara climbed up the roof and I had to get her down. Cassandra was crying over a splinter and Phoebe tried to set a fire in the kitchen. I feel like I'm dealing with children." Whitney takes off her lab coat and nurse's hat and lays them down on a recliner as you peak out in curiosity. You look in pure surprise.

On Whitney's coffee table was a human. He was a tan skinned man who had to be in his late 20s if not early 30s with brown hair worn in a ponytail and a beard. You heard Whitney was married to a human, now you know it's true." Whitney lets out a sigh and bends over as she smiles at Xander and Xander turns off his laptop.

Xander smiles back at his giantess wife. "Is that one girl causing you trouble Whitney? Sylvia I think it was." Whitney snorts and nods her head. "She got out again. But this time I couldn't find her. But that coward will turn up." You shiver and decide to get out of the lab coat pocket and slide down the couch while nobody is looking.

Xander rubs Whitney's horn and then starts to take off his shirt. "Baby, you need to relax. Don't let one unruly patient get you down. I think I know how to get your mind off of Sylvia." Whitney lets out a pleasured moan and then she undoes her bikini top and throws it to the side before you see her bikini bottom go down.

You gag. Here was your archenemy, naked in front of you with her tiny husband. That was sick and wrong on so many levels. What could Xander possibly see in a giant fat rhinoceros woman. As Whitney waves her long red hair over her large rear, you remember that you have to get out at once and rush towards the door. If Whitney found you in her house, you'd be in serious trouble. She might even think you were trespassing. This was not your day.

Of course, if you made it to the end, you would most likely have to deal with the dangers of Whitney's lawn, but it sure beats being in the same room as the giantess who mistook you for a criminal.
15111.title: Home of Whitney

151111.content:
And suddenly, you are able too as Xander and Whitney are too busy talking and admiring each other to notice that you actually made it out of the building, and after going through the steps, you are finally outside, where you needed to be, in the big lawn area. The area was huge, and had much grass and crops, so it pretty much making finding out where to go a complete chore, but it sure beats having to deal with Xander and Whitney.

"Okay, I have finally made it out of here. Now, where to go from here." you started to think about what to do next. You are a good escaper, just like your boyfriend Wade, and then that gives her a good idea.

You can A, go to the prison and attempt to break Wade out, if he has escaped or not, but then that puts you at risk of you not being able to get your life back. You really like Wade as he is your boyfriend, and you learned a lot from him in your life.

Or B, you can perhaps just head back home to your human life, and be happy again as you are living with your friends and family.

So where to go now?
151111.title: Free at last

choices: You Jump on a Passing Car
One of Whitney's Neighbors Sees You
1511111.content:
You let out a sigh. The least you can do is try to break Wade free of prison. He's do the same for you... at least you think he would So you make your way across the jungle that is Whitney's lawn and you start to approach the street where you see a car coming and hurry to see if you can catch a ride.

The only problem is that the grass is so thick and you even run into a large snail before you let out a scream and run the other way. You pant as you rest under a large mushroom. "Hasn't that rhino heard of a lawnmower?" you ask. You then see Whitney's shadow in the window and it looked like she was standing up with her bikini top around her horn. You don't even want to think about what she and Xander are doing in there and you really don't want Whitney to find out you're on her lawn.

You run forward and jump over a few giant ants before you reach the curb. You see a car coming and although you don't know where it's going, there was a good chance it was heading for Fearfield where Wade is being kept. You make it to the curb and....
1511111.title: Going for Wade

15111111.content:
Without a second thought you jump up and grab hold of the side of the trunk of a passing car. It was a yellow car that looked similar to a range rover, except that it had spikes on the sides and the grill resembled teeth. As you climb up and find a stable footing, you begin to pant. "How the heck did I survive that?" you ask. But you couldn't think about that now, because you needed to get to Wade in Fearfield.

But is this car heading to Fearfield?
15111111.title: Fearfield or Bust

151111111.content:
As you climb further down the truck, you look down and see that it has a Fearfield license plate. You were definitely on the right track. This car was heading for Fearfield. You grunt and then you slip through a gap to get into the trunk. You let out a sigh. Now all you have to do is follow the driver to Fearfield and find some way to get to Under Gloom. You gulped and were horrified that you'd even think about doing such a thing. "Only for Wade," you say. "Only for Wade."

As you look around the trunk, you see that the windows were all painted black. Then you see a strange cooler like one for drinks and out of curiosity, you take a closer look and then scream because you wish you hadn't. Inside the cooler were large packets of blood. As you step back, you bump into something long and thin. It was a coffin!

You climb up the coffin and you see the driver of the car was a purple skinned young woman, pear shaped and with long blonde hair. You looked at the rearview mirror and gasp because there's no reflection of the driver. This woman was a vampire! From the looks of it, the vampiress was on the phone. "I'll be in the office first thing in the morning Lexi. I just had to pick up my new bed. It's not my fault the coffin shop in Fearfield is closed for repairs." "Just make sure you're back in time to interview Governor Liza's opponent first thing tomorrow morning, Tara," says a voice coming from the cell phone. "I want the Daily Tombstone to be the first to know. The early thunderbird gets the sand worm. Keep your head up." Tara lets out an angry hiss. "What is that supposed to mean?! You think my head is ugly Lexi?!" The voice on the phone, who you now know is named Lexi, lets out a sigh. "Just be ready first thing tomorrow morning."

Out of curiosity, you decide to climb up the back seat of the car and look forward. You see something dangling from the mirror. It looked like a press pass, except instead of having a photograph, it had a painting of the reporter instead. Makes sense. Vampires don't appear in photographs. Suddenly, Tara hits a speed bump and you scream as you fall back and land in her coffin bed. The vibrations cause the coffin to slam shut and seal you in. Now you were very afraid. You were in a coffin the size of a skyscraper in a vampire's car.

You run and pound on the walls for hours as the vampiress drives to Fearfield. You don't know where Tara is, but from the sound of it, she stopped the car. You hear a door opening and a yawning noise. "I'm not even waiting to go home. Time to see if this coffin was worth the 1500 skulls I paid for it." You freeze in fear as you hear the trunk open up and Tara climbs in. The next thing you know, Tara is opening the coffin. You look up and see a 550ft tall vampire girl wearing Batgirl pajamas, but then you look at her face and are horrified. Half her face looks normal but the other half is disfigured with charred skin, exposed muscles and missing lips, as if it was burned.

Does the vampire giantess notice you in her coffin?
151111111.title: To Fearfield with a Vampire

choices: What if she woke up first and left you in the coffin? Stay up and prepare!
You don't want to pass out in the middle of a rescue operation, go to sleep!
1511111112.content:
Crap. The vampiress was scanning the insides of the coffin thoroughly, looking all around at the soft, purple, velvet-y surface with a grin. Her eyes fall on you for a moment, and you're about to yell out in fear, before they suddenly continue to glaze around the coffin, the darkness having kept her from noticing you. You breathe a sigh of relief. All too often you forget that you're bug sized in comparison to these creatures...something that may or may not be a good thing.

"Well, it looks comfortable." she says, and the coffin shifts slightly as the giantess begins to move around. You wonder what it is she's doing before her leg appears over the lid of the coffin, and you suddenly realize; she's about to sleep in here! You couldn't be stuck in here with her all night! Even if she was going to Fearville, she was still a gigantic vampire, and you were a tasty little ketchup packet. You try and climb up the violet fabric, but are unable to get a grip, the softness and smoothness of the surface making it impossible to scale. Damn the coffin company! Why couldn't they make a lower quality product?!

Your attention shifts to the massive purple skinned woman currently trying to fit inside the coffin, having lowered her lower body and now shifting to allow her upper body to get in...only to encounter a problem. "...it's too small?!" she complained, unable to fit her head inside the coffin all the way. She groaned, pulling her knees closer to her body to make room for her head. "Well, it'll do for tonight...I just hope I can get this exchanged at the Fearville coffin shop..." she mumbles, and grabs onto the lid of the coffin. The lid! You would be stuck in here if you didn't get out now! Running towards the vampire woman, hoping to scale her body just in time to slide out unnoticed, you immediately fall flat on your face as the velvet conforms under your legs like a trampoline, tripping you up. Before you can get up, the world is suddenly coated in darkness as a loud CLANK fills the coffin, nearly making you go deaf. Looks like you were staying in here for the night.

Only now, however, you realize that what she said earlier wasn't an understatement; it really was too small. Although your eyes had adjusted to the darkness, you could still barely see a thing, but you saw enough to know that the vampire nearly completely filled the coffin, her curves managing to fill out the coffin quite nicely, if a little uncomfortably. As she rested on her side, the only empty spaces were around her head and legs, and anything in between would be a tight squeeze as far as you could tell. God, you hope this woman didn't roll around in her sleep. You were currently in front of her large, unsightly face as it began to snore, the sound of which was nearly deafeningly loud.

You wouldn't be able to sleep in here...or at least, not next to her head. And you weren't sure you wanted to, honestly. You were in a coffin with a blood sucking monster. You needed to keep your guard up, and find a way to hitch a ride on her for tomorrow! Then again, it would do you no favors trying to rescue Wade exhausted...your pounding and yelling on the sides of the coffin wore you out pretty badly. You needed the energy for the morning. If you crawled passed her arms, legs, and the rest of her, you could rest easy on the opposite end of the coffin... But she could just as easily kill you or crush you in your sleep...decisions, decisions.
1511111112.title: No.

choices: You hide behind an outrageously sized cup of coffee in her cupholder.
You hide near the pedals, near the base of the seat, out of view.
15111111121.content:
If you managed to get yourself trapped in the coffin, well, that'd be it for rescuing Wade. Or rescuing yourself for that matter. It'd take a stroke of luck to get out alone, and if she decided to exchange this coffin at another coffin store...well, you could die in here.

So against your better judgement, you leaned up against the soft, velvety surface, and waited. Her snoring, while already annoying, began to drive you a little insane as it went on and on. At the very least, it served to keep you from falling asleep, but that didn't make it any less annoying, and you found yourself really hoping she'd shut up. Wade had better be grateful that you endured this.

A seemingly indescribable amount of time later, with you completely mentally and physically exhausted, you are suddenly blasted with Tara's powerful yawn, the sound of which threatened to burst your ear drums. She stretched her arms and legs, only to hit the walls of the coffin, and she opened her eyes, remembering what had happened the other day. Her eyes seemed to settle on you for a moment, but she didn't notice you, as she seemed to stare through you towards the walls of the coffin. "Shit, what time is it?" she muttered to herself, using a single outstretched arm to peel the lid off the coffin. Letting it fall to the side with a thud, she leaned her torso upwards and looked towards the front of the car. "Crap! I have to be there in an hour!" she said to herself, suddenly pulling herself out of the coffin. Seeing this, you snapped back to attention. Your ride was getting away!

Running towards her legs, now the only thing still contained within the coffin, you latch onto the knee of her batgirl pajamas, holding on as tight as you can as she clambers over the seats to reach the front seat from the trunk. You figure that if she's in a hurry, it's easier than getting protective clothing on, getting out of the car, and going around and getting in, although it's not exactly a smooth ride. Either way, within moments, you found yourself watching as she quickly turned on the car and peeled down the road, going 20 something over the speed limit, although it was hard to tell from your vantage point. And speaking of your vantage point...you were on this girls knee! You could stare straight up at her and her gross half-face, and she'll surely see you if she looks down towards you!

Quickly assessing the situation, you decide that you need to stay close to her if you ever want to get out of here. That being said, although she's currently busy breaking the law (or maybe not, you don't know enough about monster laws), your current position was still quite vulnerable. You were going to have to hide close enough to her to reach her if she leaps out of the car to get to wherever she's supposed to be...but also not be caught. Narrowing your options down to 2 choices, you decide it'd be safest to...
15111111121.title: What if she woke up first and left you in the c...

151111111212.content:
You figure that it would be a good idea to hide near the pedals where Tara is unlikely to see you. You slide down the vampiress's leg and bounce off her chalk white toes and blood red nails as you land near the gas pedal and then have to get out of the way to avoid being crushed underfoot. You begin to pant and pant and pant just as she drives into a parking lot to park her car. Tara then grabs a notepad and pen. 'If I'm late," she says. "Lexi is going to kill me." Tara almost leaps out of the car but has to step back as the sunlight nearly touches her and burns her. "Ouch! Dammit! I almost forgot." Tara reached back into the car and takes out an umbrella to protect herself from the sun's rays.

You let out a sigh because the vampiress was gone. From the looks of it, she was a newspaper reporter of some kind. That was perfect. At one point, one of the reporters would have to go to Under Gloom to cover a story of some kind. Then you can follow them and see if you can break Wade out. But then a thought occurred to you. You heard that Under Gloom was run by Warden Destiny Sirtis. You only knew about her through Whitney. Destiny and Whitney were college roommates. Whitney said that Destiny was a gargoyle and that she had quite a nasty temper on her. You really hope that you don't have to deal with her.

Half an hour later you hear Tara return and from the looks of it, she got her story but she was embarrassed. "That interview with Ms. Red would've gone better if I hadn't come in my pajamas," the vampiress says to herself. "Note to self Tara, bring an alarm clock." You smile because you're going to get a ride to the newspaper building and hopefully to Under Gloom. Then maybe you'll be able to bust Wade out. Soon Tara reached her destination and you climb onto her sandal as she walks out of her car and into a large office building with a headstone on top of it that said "the Daily Tombstone". That must've been the name of the newspaper.

In the building, you see all kinds of monsters. First, Tara walked past the day security guard who was a tannish yellow skinned and obese behemoth woman who appeared to have a skull tattoo on one of her butt cheeks from what you see at her butt crack. Tara then passes a red wooled-weresheep woman by a water cooler and an elderly green Chinese dragon woman. A black furred werewolf girl walked by and had to fight back the urge to laugh at the vampire girl in her pajamas. You rub your eyes and swear that the black wolf girl looked a lot like Diana, albeit not as morbidly obese.

The vampiress then walked up towards the editor's office. Outside was an obese tanuki woman who appeared to be slacking off and reading Manga while stuffing her face with donuts. The tanuki then stares at Tara. "I don't want any guff from you, Kiki. One would think you would come to work in your pajamas." The tanuki goes back to reading before Tara enters the editor's office and you slide behind a potted plant as Tara speaks with her boss. "Did you get the interview?" asks who you assume is Lexi. "Got it right here boss and I'm gonna type it up right now." "Good, good, good gravy! Tara, I hope you didn't interview Ms. Red dressed in your pajamas."

Tara stomps off and you get a good look at Lexi and become nervous. Lexi was a giant violet-furred and gray-haired sphinx with large wings and sharp teeth. She was wearing a business dress and circular glasses and like all sphinxes, walked on all fours. If she saw you, you were as good as snacked.

What happens now?
151111111212.title: The Pedals

choices: You Start to Search the Cells for Wade
One of the Guards Spots You
1511111112121.content:
Into Lexi's office came that black wolf girl. You take a closer look and you see that she really does resemble Diana in the face. You did hear that Diana had a daughter who was locked up in Under Gloom for cannibalism, her name was Persephone. Except for one thing, Persephone was said to be a white wolf. This wolf girl looked similar to what you heard Persephone to look like, except that she was black with blue eyes.

"You wanted to see me, Lexi?" asks the wolf girl. "Yes, Hecate," says Lexi. "I have a mission for you." "Hecate?" you think to yourself. "That's the name of a Greek goddess associated with the underworld. She must be related to Diana. I didn't know Diana had another daughter. I hope this one isn't a man-eater like Persephone." Lexi then gives Hecate her mission. "Listen, Hecate. I'm sorry to do this, but I must ask you to go to Under Gloom. There's going to be a parole hearing. Elaine Cotonza I believe." Hecate gives a sad look as Lexi lets out a sigh. "I know your sister is there and I understand. You don't have..." "No," says Hecate. "Persephone is locked up where she belongs. She brought it on herself. I'll go."

So she was Persephone's sister after all. From the sound of it, Hecate and Persephone didn't get along. Not surprising seeing as one of the sisters was a cannibalistic serial killer. But wait, Hecate was heading for Under Gloom. This was your big chance to rescue Wade. Wasting no time, you run and grab Persephone by the pant leg and crawl up into her back pocket just as she's leaving. You begin to shiver. Breaking into Under Gloom was not going to be easy and it wasn't going to be easy to get out. The monsters you were locked up with were mentally ill, but the monsters in Under Gloom were outright evil criminals. Wade had better appreciate what you're going through.

You hear a car door open and Hecate enters her truck. Before you can do anything, she sits down, pinning you under her ass to the seat. You grunt as the wolf butt presses down on you and she starts the car. Thank goodness that Hecate is a lot less weighty than her mom. If Diana sat on you, you'd be nothing more than a ketchup stain on a wolf's overstuffed bum.

Thankfully, Hecate soon reaches Under Gloom and then you stick your head out her back pocket to inhale. Hecate walks up to a couple of guards, one of which was an enormously obese werehyena with spotted brown fur and red hair. The hyena giantess had a psychotic grin on her face and was butt-naked and even was sticking her tongue out. The other giantess was a fat and green grootslang, a monster resembling an elephant with scaly reptilian skin and a long cobra for a trunk that let out a hiss. The grootslang girl had blonde hair worn in a hairstyle that made her look like Clover of Totally Spies and also had large tusks like an African elephant. You then gasped because you forgot that the guards would strip search Hecate.

With no other option you find yourself hiding between Hecate's butt cheeks as the strip search is going on. Thankfully, Hecate doesn't appear to feel you and her tail obscures you completely. You're sweating heavily and panting right before the guards give Hecate her pants back. You breathe a sigh of relief because you've gotten thus far and Hecate walks into Under Gloom. You quickly slide down her pant leg as she walks inside and you see several jail cells down the hall with monsters of all species locked inside. Some of them were even trying to tear down the bars. Maybe this wasn't such a good idea.

Then you remembered something. Under Gloom's warden. You heard that the warden's name was Destiny Sirtis and that she was Whitney's college roommate and best friend. From what Whitney said about Destiny, Destiny was a gargoyle and she had a rather volatile temper. She was said to be constantly pissed off and from what you heard, Wade was number one on her hate list. But, she was gargoyle. How mean could she be? That's what you think.

Then you hear loud stomping as if a particularly large monster was coming forward. You heard that Destiny was much bigger than any staff member or inmate in Under Gloom. "Is the reporter from the Daily Tombstone here already?" you hear the warden ask. "Yes, ma'am." It was there you see Destiny show up and you look in horror as you learn what the feared warden of Under Gloom looked like. Destiny was a light blue-skinned and hourglass shaped gargoyle with long pinkish red hair worn in a style that looked like a cross between an Afro and a mullet and she also had large horns on her forehead that you could swear looked like they were in the shape of a crown.

You let out a gulp and begin to sweat. Aside from having a pinker tone in her hair, Destiny was completely identical to Demona. Come to think of it, you never noticed before how much Whitney resembled Fox. But that was beside the point. You can tell from looking at Destiny that she was not somebody to pick a fight with. Then you get an awful thought. Destiny might actually be more aggressive than Whitney. She's a prison warden so unlike Whitney who's courteous towards the patients, Destiny would probably have nothing but hate and malice towards the inmates. One thing's for sure, if Destiny saw you trying to break Wade out of prison, you were dead meat.

Destiny gestures for Hecate to follow her as she and the werewolf walk away and then you run down another hallway so nobody sees you. This definitely wasn't going to be easy.
1511111112121.title: To Under Gloom You Go

choices: In the Side of the Coffin
15111111122.content:
You let out a yawn and realize that you were tired. Hiding from Whitney then running all the way from her house to the street to jump on a car was tiring. You needed to get some sleep if you were to get Wade. If you passed out and fell asleep while trying to break your boyfriend out, you'd most likely be eaten by one of the guards.

You hear Tara's thunderous snoring and look forward to see her hideous half-burnt face. It was real nasty looking and you feel like throwing up when you see it. It reminds you that you have to find a place to sleep where she won't see you. You can imagine her finding you, biting off your head and sucking your corpse dry of blood and it frightened you. The problem was that even at your small size, there wasn't a lot of room in the coffin.

Where to sleep?
15111111122.title: Sleepy Time

choices: Tied up and on a Plate in Tara's Kitchen!
151111111222.content:
You let out a yawn and walk to the side of the coffin. You let out a grunt and squeeze in between the soft violet fabric to make sure the vampiress didn't see you. It was so smooth and comfy. You heard the vampire complaining about how it was too small, but otherwise it was nice and cozy. You could easily drift off to sleep.

As you close your eyes, you turn your head away from Tara's face. You didn't want to see that horrifying visage one more time. It would give you nightmares. With that you fall asleep. But in your dream, well, to say it was an unpleasant dream would be a gross understatement.

In your dream, you're running down a road surrounded by fire and brimstone. You scream and look back to see a nightmare version of Whitney, except this nightmare rhinoceros was bigger than the normal one and had magma like veins on her body with red horns and demonic looking wings. "Syvia!" shouted the nightmare Whitney. "How dare you escape!" You let out a scream in the nightmare as the ground begins to crack below you. You see lava bubbling and out from the lava comes a giant stone gargoyle's hand that looks melted to the bone. The hand opens up and you see Wade reaching out to you. "Sylvia!" he yells as he begins to melt. "Help me!"

As you see the dream Wade melting, you grunt and scream because the nightmare Whitney has picked you up and held you over her jaws. The giant demonic nightmare rhino raises you into the air and snorts. "You are a criminal Sylvia," says Nightmare Whitney. "Which is why you're going straight to hell." The nightmare whitney opens her mouth to reveal a fiery pit inside and drops you screaming in.

As the nightmare Whitney snaps her mouth shut, you wake screaming from your dream and pant. But where are you exactly?
151111111222.title: Sleep Tight

choices: The Lid Comes Down and Traps You Inside
You Slip and Fall into Cleotiti's Sarcophagus
1511111112221.content:
You wake up and see that you're still in the coffin, but Tara is nowhere to be seen. You look up to see Tara outside the coffin and right behind her was a 300ft tall mummy girl. Like Tara the mummy was pear-shaped. She was wrapped up to her neck in yellow gauze but despite being a mummy, she looked like a dark skinned human girl with long green hair worn in dreadlocks with scarab shaped gold earrings. Tara was talking to a gremlin dressed like a clerk.

"I paid 1500 skulls for this coffin in Terrordale," says Tara explaining her case. "But big surprise, it's too small." "It's not too small," says the gremlin clerk. "You're just too pear-shaped." "Excuse me?" asks Tara sounding angry. "Are you calling me fat?!" "No, no, no. But you do have a little junk in the trunk." Tara hisses and slaps the gremlin in his face. "Jerk!" "Calm down Tara," says the mummy girl. "I'm certain you can exchange it." Tara lets out a hiss. "Better be careful Cleotiti," she says. "I'm not the only one picking a bed out. They just better not gyp you too." The gremlin gets up to escort Tara to buy a new coffin. "Right this way to our plus sized vampire section." He jokes. Tara hisses angrily and then Cleotiti turns to see a succubus girl wheeling out a large golden sarcophagus with cobras and hippopotami painted on the sides and emeralds embedded into it.

Cleotiti squees with delight as she looks at it. "You're in luck Ms. Cleotiti," says the succubus. "Your new bed just arrived." "Ooh," says Cleotiti. "It looks so faboo. I can't wait to try you out."

While Cleo and Tara are both distracted, you begin to frantically climb out of the coffin. You definitely couldn't stay here where any vampire, zombie or ghoul could buy the coffin and find you. But just as you're out of the coffin..
1511111112221.title: At the Coffin Shop

choices: You Spend the Night Plastered to Cleo's Ass
15111111122212.content:
Suddenly, you lose your footing and yell as you fall into Cleotiti's sarcophagus. You grunt in pain as you land. It definitely wasn't as soft as Tara's casket, but it would seem that it was soft enough for a three thousand year old living corpse. This was terrible. You had to get out fast before

KLANK


Just your luck, outside the succubus selling the sarcophagus to Cleo shut the casket as Cleo was paying for the golden tomb. "I can't wait to try it out," she says. "It'll be the best sleep I've had since before I was mummified." Inside you scream and bang on the sarcophagus walls before you feel movement. This was bad, they must've been moving the sarcophagus to Cleo's car. Oh, this was horrible. You break down and cry. You escaped from a vampire's coffin, only to be trapped in a mummy case. It's like taking one step forward and eight steps back.

Wait, you couldn't cry. You had to be preserving oxygen. Oh, you really hope you can last in this coffin without suffocating. For hours, you're trapped in the mummy's tomb. You take it Cleo was busy with errands and wouldn't be home for a while. If you get out of this alive, Wade had better appreciate it. This was going to be hell.

You're just about to pass out when you hear a yawning from outside. "Well," says Cleo's voice. "I hope that Tara resolved her coffin problems. I can't wait to see if this sarcophagus was worth it."

You let out a gulp. Mummies don't eat humans, do they? Before you have any time to react, Cleo opens the sarcophagus with a yawn and climbs inside. This was horrible, she wasn't even checking it out. Before you could do anything else, Cleo lies back in the coffin and pins you underneath her ginormous, mummified ass as you groan. As you struggle, you get tangled in the mummy's wrappings and wind up wedged between her cheeks.

You let out a groan. Stuck to a giant mummy's butt. Of all the rotten luck.
15111111122212.title: The Sarcophagus

choices: The Phone Rings and Tara Leaves You Alone to Answer It
1511111112222.content:
You look down and gasp because from the looks of it, you've been tied up in your sleep. You look around and your face becomes pale because in front of you there appears to be what looks like a giant tater tot and behind you there appears to be a mountain of scrambled eggs with what looks like giant slices of bacon by your fee and in the distance appears to be a giant glass of what looks like blood. You're now suddenly very afraid.

Then you look forward to see a giant chalk white cleavage wearing a Batgirl t-shirt and then look up to see Tara's half disfigured face staring down at you with hungry eyes. "Look who finally decided to wake up." The vampiress says as she shows you her fangs. You could see her drooling and you realize just what Tara has in store for you. "P-Please," you plead. "This is all a big mistake." Tara scoffs and holds up a knife and fork. "Yeah, you made a big mistake sleeping in my coffin. What do you think vampires do to humans? Well, now that I've got breakfast ready, here's what I'm going to do. First I'm going to drain every last drop of blood from your teeny weeny human body and then I'm going to chew your bones." Tara licks her giant purple lips at that and you get a look at her gruesome face as you shiver.

"Please don't eat me! I was just trying to get to my boyfriend! I don't want to be eaten by a skyscraper sized vampire and get stuck to the fat on your ginormous ass." You gasp at what you say and from the looks of it, Tara is offended as she hisses. "Oh, I'm definitely going to enjoy eating you, you insulting little bug." Damn. You had to have run into an easily-provoked vampiress.

Tara holds up her knife and fork and laughs evilly as you scream. First she squeezes an entire ketchup bottle over her breakfast, soaking you in some as you scream and the ketchup gets in your eyes. Figures she'd go overboard with something that reminded her so much of her favorite drink; blood.

Once Tara has covered the plate in ketchup, she uses her fork to devour her eggs like some sort of ravenous beast and then gets to work on the tater tots. You look up in fear and disgust. Because half her face is charred, that means Tara is missing part of her lips and has half her mouth exposed, meaning she was effectively chewing with half her mouth open. The sight made you sick as ketchup leaked down her jaw. You then watch her pick up each strip of bacon and munch on each piece until they're all gone. Finally, you watch as Tara guzzles that huge glass of blood and you see some of it drizzle through her exposed jaw.

The vampiress then looks at you and you look up in fear. You were the last part of her breakfast and she was licking her fangs, ready to suck you dry and chew the rest into dust. You shiver in place and hope for a miracle.
1511111112222.title: Joining Tara for Breakfast

choices: You Reach Dreadberry without Being Detected
Emerald Finds you in her Purse
1511111121.content:
You climb into the car and you land in the back seat as you land with a grunt on the upholstery. In the front of the car, there are actually two monsters. A married couple from the looks of it. The driver was a male golem with red brick like skin, beady eyes and it didn't look like he had a mouth. He sort of looked like the Thing. The wife of the couple (at least you think its a woman) was a skeleton with long reddish brown hair (obviously a wig) and surprisingly her bones were bright red at the moment, as if she was burned.

Then you hear strange noises and you look up to see you're not alone in the backseat. Apparently these monsters had a daughter, a teenager form the looks of it and she looked really strange. She was a gigantic green skinned girl who looked like she was made of felt. She had yellow button like eyes and a zipper where her mouth should've been. You see that she has mitten like hands and didn't appear to have any fingers other than her thumbs and appeared to be playing a handheld video-game. The girl looked like a rag doll. Given that her father is a manmade golem and her mother is an undead skeleton, you take it she was either adopted or artificially created herself.

In the front, the skeleton woman groans as she feels herself. "It happens every time," says her golem husband. "We go to the beach and you end up getting fried. How do you sunburn bones anyway Meryl?" "Shut up, Flint," says the skeleton woman. "It's not as if that was the worst part of our vacation. You should know better than trying to surf. You're a golem. You know you can't even swim." Flint just blushes at that thought. "Well," he says. "At least we'll be back in Dreadberry by the morning."

"Dreadberry!?" you ask to yourself. This was just terrific. "You were on your way to Dreadberry. That was miles away from Fearfield. You didn't know much about Dreadberry, but you knew it was out in the boonies. You're a Kansas girl born and raised but you don't want to take chances with monster yokels. You then look and see that right behind you is the rag doll girl's purse. It's even monogrammed with the name "Emerald". You take it that was her name. Fitting for someone with green skin. You climb into Emerald's purse and figure you might as well stay for the ride.
1511111121.title: To Dreadberry You Go

choices: Emerald Tells Her Parents About You
Emerald Keeps You Hidden Until they Reach Dreadberry
15111111212.content:
You wonder what to do. You wanted to go to Fearfield but now you're on the way to Dreadberry. After an hour passes and you don't think things can get any worse, Emerald finishes with her game and opens her purse to put it away. You gasp and sure enough, you have a 550ft tall living doll looking down at you in surprise. The next thing you know, Emerald grabs you and lifts you up to her face. Being held in the air like a doll, by a doll. If you weren't so scared, you'd find it ironic.

"P-Please don't hurt me." You beg." Emerald unzips the zipper on her mouth before she speaks to you in a childish sounding voice. "Why would I want to hurt you? What were you doing in my bag?" You look forward and you're still shocked as Emerald takes you closer to her eye. You freeze but Emerald smiles at you. "Relax," she says. "I don't harm humans. In case you haven't noticed, my mom used to be one. My uncle's even human." You then realize this is true. Emerald's mother, Meryl, she was a skeleton but she looked like a human skeleton. You breathe out a sigh of relief before Emerald holds up a giant hand.

"I'm Emerald by the way." She says with a smile. You look at her giant mitten shaped hand and nervously shake it. "Sylvia. I'm sorry, it's just. What exactly are you?" "I'm a rag doll," says Emerald. "You see, Mom and Dad were jealous when Uncle Neil and Aunt Maggie were expecting, because they couldn't have kids themselves in the tradition way. But Mom found a spell book in the library and found a spell that could bring inanimate objects to life. So Dad stitched me together from felt, Mom cast the spell and the rest is history."

That really frightened you. This girl might've been born through black magic. A spell that could give life to toys? That can't possibly be any good. "And you?" asks Emerald. You didn't know how to break it to Emerald and from the looks of it, her parents didn't even notice your conversation with their daughter. You let out a sigh and then come clean. "If you must know, I broke out of the K.D.P." "K.D.What?" asks Emerald. Obviously Emerald had never heard of the K.D.P.

You let out another sigh. "It's a mental hospital for monsters and no place for a human. I was in there for a crime I didn't commit and I need to get to Fearfield A.S.A.P." Emerald smiles at that. "Well, you're in luck. Aunt Maggie is the sheriff in Dreadberry. Maybe she could help you." You couldn't believe it. What luck. Wait, if this 'Aunt Maggie' was the sheriff, how would you explain that you were needed to get to Fearfield to get Wade out of prison. Also, you don't know what species this Aunt Maggie even was. You doubt that they'd let a human be sheriff of a monster town so she obviously had to be related by marriage and it's doubtful she's the same species as either of her in-laws. But Emerald said her uncle was human so if Maggie was married to a human, she was probably harmless. You hope.

The question is, what now?
15111111212.title: Hello Dolly

1511111122.content: What about to Scream Town (See Monster Cove)?
1511111122.title: Somewhere Else

15111111221.content:
You climb into the trunk and then you see exactly who is driving the car. The driver looked human looking from the waist up. She resembled a chubby Hawaiian woman with blonde hair and a starfish at the side of her head. However, you see her driver's license on the visor and read it. "Joanne Xever," you read. "Species: Mermaid. Screamtown Driving School." You had never heard of Screamtown. But wait, how could a mermaid drive a car. Mermaids couldn't survive outside of the water because otherwise they were completely immobile.

You take a closer look and see that Joanne had a pair of mechanical legs attached to a harness she was wearing. That would explain it. But then you gasp. The only other mermaid you knew was Paisley, a mermaid that lived in the ocean by the K.D.P. and she was a man-eater. What if Joanne saw you and decided you'd make a snack. Given how fat she was, she could probably wipe a human city off the map. Fortunately she hadn't seen you and you walk behind her seat to prevent Joanne from spotting you.

"It was nice to see my cousins," says Joanne. "But it will be good to go back to good old Screamtown." Five hours later, you reach Screamtown and decide to climb up to the window. You wanted to see what kind of horrors this monster town had in store for you. At the entrance, you find that Screamtown looked a lot like Terrordale since it was at a beach. But what you see outside makes your jaw drop. There were giant monsters much bigger than the ones of Terrordale but there were humans around them that weren't being stepped on or eaten.

You see a kappa swimming in the water as humans rode on top of his shell, an elderly human playing chess with an elderly gargoyle and there was even a succubus sunbathing as a male human rubbed sunscreen on her back. "What the hell?" you ask as Joanne parks the car. You immediately run across the window and leap onto the back of Joanne's bra as the mermaid giantess uses her mechanical legs to walk out. You still couldn't believe it. There were humans and monsters living together peacefully.

There was even a family on the beach that consisted of male humans and female hellhounds. Hellhounds eat humans. You couldn't wrap your head around this one. Most of the monsters on the beach were human eating species but none of them were making a grab at the humans around them. You slide down Joanne's bra and tail and then you walk along the beach looking around in confuse. Just what kind of weird place is this?

What do you do?
15111111221.title: Scream Town

151111112212.content:
You figured that you needed to find out more about this town. It was really odd that none of the humans in the area were showing any fear of the monsters. You even see a group of human children playing on the belly of a sleeping behemoth woman. Most of these monsters were man-eaters and yet none of them were attacking the humans. As you're pondering your situation, you look and see what looks like a staircase. At the bottom was a sign that read, "Bus Stop". There were other humans at the top, so you quickly run up.

You see one woman carrying groceries and tap her on the shoulder to get her attention. "Excuse me," you say. "When does the bus get here." "You're obviously not from around here," says the woman. "It isn't exactly a bus." It was there you hear rumbling and soon before you is a giant deer woman with golden bejeweled horns. She had bluish fur and muscular arms and legs but a big bulging stomach. "All aboard that's going aboard!" she yells. You let out a scream as soon as you see her, getting her attention.

"Please don't eat us!" you shout as you crouch. All the other humans look at you as if you're crazy and the deer woman raises an eye. "Eat you? Are you lo lo loopy?" "B-B-But you're a weredeer. The only other weredeer I know eats..." The deer woman gives a glare. "Who you calling a were deer? I'm a Ceryneian Hind. There's a difference. I'll have you know, I'm the last Ceryneian Hind, so show me some respect. The name's Hera in case you want to know. You want a ride in my belly bag or do you just want to waste my time."

You didn't know what to make of this. This Ceryneian Hind was basically a giant taxi. You figure you might as well get in line as she unzips her fanny pack and reveals several seats inside. "Where to girly?" she asks. "You're in Summer Side so it's either Autumn Avenue, Winter Way or Springtime Street?"
151111112212.title: The Ceryneian Express

1511111122121.content:
"Uh," you say. "Autumn Avenue, I guess." Ms. Hera nods her head and tun pushes you in the back, forcing you to walk into her belly back. You take your seat next to a woman with a giggling baby as everyone walks inside and Hera zips the bag before she starts to run and you feel her movie. You couldn't wrap your head around this. You've been in this strange town filled with giant monsters and yet none of them were trying to eat you. Not only that, but this giant muscle-gutted Ceryneian Hind was acting as a taxi for the humans. You inch to the woman next to you before you ask her what is going on.

"Why isn't anyone afraid of the monsters? What's going on with this town." "You're obviously not from around here, young lady," says the woman as she bottle feeds her baby. "This is Scream Town. No monster eats humans here. When Mayor Gacks came into power, she outlawed human consumption and turned Scream Town into a safe haven. Here, humans and monsters live together in harmony. Even monsters like succubi, werewolves, hellhounds and wendigos are completely harmless here." You couldn't believe it. A town where humans live alongside monsters without fear of getting eaten. "You're kidding," you say. "No monsters eat humans here?" "Not one," says the woman. "The closest thing to a predator is one pink furred weresheep in Winter Way and even she can't gulp us down unless she wants to go to jail. The wereboar librarian even has a human husband." You couldn't believe it. You shake your head. "Autumn Avenue and Winter Way?"

The woman lets out a laugh as her baby laughs as well. "Screamtown is separated into five parts. First is the center but the four corners are each permanently locked in one of the four seasons; Springtime Street, Summer Side, Autumn Avenue and Winter Way." Now that was just weird." Soon, Hera stops and unzips her belly bag. "Time to get out everyone." Says Hera as everyone walks out onto another terminal. You walk out and are in surprise. All the trees are decorated with yellow, orange, red and brown leaves and there is one garden where a big magenta mock turtle woman is tending to pumpkins. You walk down the steps and see several leaves all as big as buses. You look up and see a behemoth woman walking by as she carries a purse decorated like a school bus. It even has several human children inside. You then turn to see a dragon playing Chinese checkers with an elderly human woman. It amazed you that Screamtown was free of hostilities between humans and monsters.

Suddenly you feel tremors and look up to see somebody walk up towards you. It was a monster girl, pachydermic given her huge flat feet. You look up and see that she appears to be wearing, fishnet stockings, a black miniskirt with a pair of purple panties covered in skulls. You scream at the sight and the giantess stops in her tracks. You step back and you can't even see the giantess's face past her enormous bulging belly and her titanic breasts that would be the size of pumpkins if she was human sized. The giantess bends down and you try to run but then you scream as she grabs you by the leg and pulls you up. You then gasp because you look in the face of a giantess were rhino who had to be close to the same size as Whitney. She even looked like Whitney, except for a few minor details; Her skin was a dark, almost blackish shade of gray in contrast to Whitney's albino hide, she had long black hair in contrast to Whitney's red hair and finally, she had black lipstick that contrasted with Whitney's red lipstick.

"Sorry," says the rhino giantess. "I kinda, almost stepped on you." You're in too much fear to speak. After all, all your experiences with Whitney made you scared to death of rhinos. "Y-You're not gonna eat me are you Ms. Wererhino Goddess?" you ask forgetting about the law in Screamtown. The gothic rhino goddess rolls her eyes. "Even if it were legal, I wouldn't swallow you. I'm a vegetarian. I don't even eat dinosaurs. But that doesn't mean I don't like being heavy. It's considered attractive for girls of my race. You're obviously a newcomer. I better show you around." The were rhino goth puts you on her left boob and you have to hold on tight as she walks, making her body jiggle.

Well, she seemed a lot less aggressive than Whitney. This goth girl sounded harmless. But you couldn't help but think of Whitney when you look at her. "Uh," you say. "You wouldn't happen to know anyone named Whitney would you?" The goth rhino raises an eyebrow at that subject. "How do you know my big sister?" she asks. You mentally gasp. Whitney's sister? You didn't even know Whitney had a sister. From the looks of it, Whitney's sister was either in the monster equivalent of her late teens to early twenties, making her the younger sister. But you had no idea if Whitney told her sister about you or how close they even were. You have to hide for now. You definitely can't tell her your name.

"Uh, I don't. Just curious. My name is Sil... uh Cynthia. How about you." Whitney's sister lets out a snort. "The name my father gave me is Noreen," she says. "But I don't like it. Everyone calls me Shego and I like that name a lot better." "Shego?" you ask. "As in the villain from Kim Possible? Why would you want to be called that?" Noreen just smiles. "I like her style. I also think she looks a lot like me. Whitney doesn't understand though. She doesn't like human cartoons. Personally, I think she's wound a bit too tight." You let out a laugh. You never though you'd be having a pleasant conversation with your arch enemy's kid sister.

You then slip slightly and Noreen uses one of her black fingernails to push you to the safety of her cleavage. "I better show you around Screamtown, Cynthia." Says the goth goddess. Where does the wererhino queen of the goths take you?
1511111122121.title: The 950ft Goth

15111111221211.content:
You see that Noreen is heading into a large library. "Screamtown Library?" you ask. Noreen nods her head. "I like to pop in at least once a week. Books are my friends." She was definitely more mellow than her big sister. You wonder how she could possibly be related to Whitney. As Noreen walks into the library, you gasp and start to hide in her cleavage the moment you get a look at the librarian.

A tap on your head snaps you out of your reverie and makes you flinch. As you come back to your senses, you notice Noreen looking down at you again. "You alright there, Cynthia? You were spacing out...didn't say a word since I asked if you wanted to browse." She reaches into her cleavage, dark grey fingers closing in around you, and gently lifts you up to her face to examine you closer. It takes a considerable effort to look at her face, and not just her mouth, as KDP-borne panic responses try to trigger. "Just...daydreaming. Got lost in my head for a bit, there. Nothing to worry over, really." You're almost surprised at how casual you're able to sound. Were you better at faking it than you thought, or had you already settled in to this oddball town? "But don't mind me; let's look through some books."

The Goth titaness raises an eybrow for a moment, but shrugs it off. "Fine by me. I'll put you on my shoulder so you can get a better view...just remember to hold on." With that, she plucks you from her palm with her free hand and sets you on her shoulder. When you grab onto her shirt, Noreen sets to browsing through the bookshelves, pointing you towards the human-sized copies.

...Which would have been helpful, if anything you saw grabbed your interest. You did like a good fantasy romp, but some part of you was still reeling from being at the KDP. It would be a while before you could even READ about dragons and the like trying to eat tiny heroes without getting nightmares. And, ever since meeting Wade, you hadn't really dove into a series like you did before hooking up with him. His vitriol toward monsters was so bad he even hated stories about them, even if they were the villains. Just seeing you reading a book about dragons (that you'd had since you were a kid) had put him in such a bad mood one time that it took half an hour of arguing to convince him not to throw it away.

Maybe a history book about Screamtown, or some newspapers? If you were going to lay low here, it'd be a good idea to get a feel for the place. Then again, you didn't fancy ending up as a seat cushion for a monster either, accidentally or otherwise....
