The next thing you hear makes you tense up. Diana is sniffing the air. You hold your breath but are surprised by the enormous wolf suddenly lowering herself to the ground. With her immense weight she creates a thunderous boom. Apparently whatever happened to her mind didn't affect her senses as she peers under the desk and spots you. "Ooh, whats this?" she says out loud as she reaches out and snatches you. You tremble as the werewolf stands up and brings you to her face. "You're the human! Uh... Silly!" You sigh and correct her. "Sylvia." Diana blinks at you. "Oh, right." She looks away for a couple of seconds and you sit in her palm wondering whats going to happen. When she turns her head back to you what does she do?
1523.title: The Airhead of Earth

15232.content:
Diana looks at you briefly before scanning the office again. "I guess Dr. West isn't here." she says to you. "Yeah..." you say, unsure of how to respond to the giant werewolf. You are thrown off balance as Diana turns around. She's leaving the office and heading somewhere else. You were hoping to escape the office, but there's no telling where Diana will end up going.

You watch the walls fly past you as Diana carries you through the halls. She looks down at you a starts talking. "So what are you doing out here?" She's the one who carried you out here! "Uh, just...you know, exploring." you tell her, hoping she goes along with this. "Oh thats nice." she says. "Where are you headed now?" Again, SHE'S carrying you! This might work out for you though.

An idea forms in your head. Maybe Diana can get you out of here. "I was actually about to head to the beach for a swim." you tell the massive wolfess. "The beach?" she asks with her head cocked. "Yeah, there's a beach nearby, maybe you could give me a ride to the exit?" you say a little nervously. You're already shaken up being carried by this huge monster, and now you're trying to trick her. Does Diana fall for your your, scheme?
15232.title: Headed....Somwhere

choices: Diana Escorts You to the Beach
152321.content:
Diana rubs her chubby chin and you shake in the gray wolf's palm and cross your fingers. Fortunately Diana nods her head. "Okay. That sounds fair. I was going to visit my niece April anyway. Wait, is it April who works at the beach or Selene? I have so many relatives I can't keep track. Okay. I guess it couldn't hurt."

You sigh in relief as the wolf giantess walks closer to the door. You were getting out of this mad house. No more man eating sand crabs, no more vampire bats to dress you like a doll, no more pirate spiders, you couldn't believe how easily you were going to get out of here. It was almost impossible. You're absolutely giddy. It was on the beach too. You could catch a boat back to the human world.

As Diana holds you in her hand however, you realize something. There are giant monsters on the beach too. There was that gargoyle woman Roxy and you didn't know if she ate humans or not. Normally gargoyles don't, but Eartha defying that diet left you scared of those flying statues. And then you heard the beach manager was a troll and you HATED trolls. But you gulp and decide that anything was better than the K.D.P. You only hope Diana's niece doesn't have a taste for humans.

"Come on Diana," you mumble to yourself. "The sooner, the better." But Diana stops in her tracks and looks around as she rubs her big belly. You slap yourself in the face. "Don't tell me you forgot where the exit is." Diana then snaps her fingers, nods her head and starts walking in the left direction.
152321.title: Wolf's Escort Out

1523212.content:
You pray to god that Diana can come through for you and help you escape. Your prayers are answered as you see the open space of the main lobby come into view. As Diana walks through the room you try to shrink into her palm to avoid being seen by anyone. Luckily the two of you make it to the door without raising any suspicions. Everyone probably just assumes Diana's wandering about again. You breathe a huge sigh of relief as you hear the door open.

You're assaulted by fresh air as Diana steps outside. You can't believe it! You're finally out! Now you just need to get away from Diana before Dr. West finds out you're gone. "Diana, I think you can let me down here." you call up to the enormous wolf. She looks down at you and smiles. The smile also looks somewhat confused. "What do you mean? We're going to visit my niece, remember?" You never agreed to that! This fat monster's absentmindedness is enough to make you want to pull your own hair out! Its like taking a step forward and two steps back!

You gaze at the ocean as your captor makes her way across the beach. You're so close! If only you could get away from this giant ditz! You rack your brain to try and come up with another plan. You hear Diana's heavy footfalls as she walks on the sand. You look down to see exactly how high up you are. You're met with sight of Diana's belly filling your vision. As you marvel at how truly big she is, she comes across another monster. Who is it?
1523212.title: Fresh Air

15232121.content:
A shadow is cast over you as another monster walks up to Diana. You look up to see a pear shaped werewolf girl. "Hi aunt Diana!' she says and opens her arms to give Diana a hug, which Diana returns. Since you're sill in her palm you get pressed into this new girl's back. As the hug goes on you struggle for breath while you get a mouthful of fur. The wolfgirl feels something and ends the hug. "What have you got there?" she inquires. Diana looks at her confused and then looks at you. "Oh! This is Sylvia! Sylvia, this is my niece April." she says, introducing you to each other.

April offers you a clawed finger, which you cringe back from at first. "Hello Sylvia. I have to say, I didn't think I'd see another human on the beach." Another? She must mean that lifeguard, Stephen. Diana speaks up."Thats right, isn't that lifeguard your boyfriend?" April smiles at her aunt and nods. "Yeah, and he's the cutest little thing ever! We're just meant to be!" She looks at her aunt and then at you. "So how do you two know each other?

Diana holds you up. "She's a patient at the KDP. She said she wanted to come along when I visited you." You definitely didn't say that, but whatever. The younger werewolf stares at you. "Should she be allowed out? Uh Oh. You quickly think of a response. "Diana gave me a special pass for the day! As long as she keeps an eye on me, we're good." April accepts this, which fills you with relief. She apparently doesn't know the rules, as you doubt Diana has that kind of authority. Unfortunately you just damned yourself to be by Diana's side. You'll have to wait for a chance to get away. The two werewolves begin walking. Where are they headed?
15232121.title: Her Niece, April

choices: Diana gets you back to the institute.
152321212.content:
Diana and April head to a small building a little ways away from the beach. When they enter you look around and see various trinkets on display. You see that many of them are made with various seashells. Diana smiles at you. "Isn't it lovely? April here runs this shop, she's very talented!" She seems really proud. "Oh cut it out aunt Diana. Its nothing really, just a small business." April says humbly. Diana continues though. "Even if its small, you're still a self-made woman." April blushes slightly. "I guess so, and when Stephen and I get married I can take care of him forever!" She really seems to like that Stephen guy.

The two werewolves head behind the counter to a room in the back. There are various tools and materials back here. You assume its where April makes her crafts. In a stroke of luck Diana puts you down absentmindedly and you find yourself on a worktable. Above you the towering wolves are still talking to each other. April seems nice, even if she still scares you, and Diana looks like shes really happy. You decide to take this opportunity to make your exit.

You scurry across the table, climbing over some materials on the way. You almost make it to the edge when you hear a voice. "Is she supposed to be over there on her own?" Then you feel yourself being lifted up. You are then brought to the massive face of April. "Where do you think you're going?" You cower at her question. Diana gets a look of realization. "Oh! I almost forgot about her!" You silently curse and April gives her aunt a small smile. "How about I help you keep her under control?" With that you find yourself being lowered into what looks like a giant clam shell. It snaps shut and you are trapped inside. "Here you go auntie, you can keep her in this necklace." Great.

You sit there in your prison while the two of them have more family time. Good thing air can still get in so you can breathe. Eventually you hear the two of them say their goodbyes.You feel yourself moving as Diana walks away with the necklace. How are you going to get away now? You hope nothing goes wrong while you're trapped in this thing. What happens?
152321212.title: Workshop Woes

1523212121.content:
You're tossed around as the necklace you're trapped in sways back and forth. Diana is on her way back to the institute, which means you lost your chance of escape. You were so close too! You were outside and even left the beach! If it wasn't for Diana's niece you'd be free by now. All you can do now is wait until Diana lets you out of the necklace. That is, if she even remembers you're in there.

You hear the front doors of the institute as Diana returns. She walks through the halls as you sit in darkness. Suddenly you hear incoming footsteps and Diana stops. "Hey Diana, what have you got there?" the mystery person says. "Oh this? Its a necklace my niece April made for me! Isn't it lovely? She's very talented!" Diana says. Looks like she did forget about you. "The shell even opens, see?" You feel your prison moving as Diana starts to open the clam shell. This is bad, you're sure to be caught now. The shells opens and you find yourself staring at.....
1523212121.title: Diana gets you back to the institute.

1523212122.content:
As you sit in the clam shell, you rock back and forth as Diana's body jiggles. The wolf woman is humming to herself as she walks back up to the K.D.P. You wonder what to do. You bang on the walls of the shell but you groan as you hold your head.

Things then get much worse because nearby there are a few surfers playing volleyball. There was a pink skinned vampiress with pigtails holding up an umbrella and acting as the referee while four monster girls were at the court. One team consisted of a blue skinned tengu girl and a white furred baku, an animal resembling a tapir. The other team consisted of a bright yellow and orange furred Bandersnatch sucking on three lollipops at once and an overweight tan skinned naga girl with the tail of an anaconda. From the looks of it, the naga and then bandersnatch were winning.

The bandersnatch girl spiked the ball and it bounced off the tengu girl's long nose and made her scream. "Oops," says the bandersnatch in an Australian accent. "Sorry about that Hannah." The baku girl grumbles before the Naga serves the ball. The baku jumps up and then hits the ball and causes it to come barreling out towards Diana. The ball hits Diana and makes her scream in pain.

Unfortunately for you, in the process the necklace you're inside is sent flying and you scream. The necklace lands in the sand and nearby Diana is rubbing her head. "Way to go Reimu," complains the naga girl. "Sorry about that Diana." Diana rubs her head and walks away, not noticing that she dropped the necklace. You scream and tap on the walls of the oyster and then break down in tears. This was a regular cluster you got yourself into. You hope Diana remembers the necklace and soon.

That's when you feel the necklace being lifted into the air and yell as you're knocked about. One of the lifeguards found the necklace. But who?

(You might want to go to Monster Shores to get information on the lifeguards)
1523212122.title: Clustercuss

15232121221.content:
You look out of the opening of the shell necklace and then you gasp as you see that the necklace was picked up by a large chubby yellow hand with sharp claws for fingers. You look out and see that the woman who picked you up was an obese yellow-skinned gargoyle girl. She had pointed ears, cat-like eyes, a small nose, brown lips and long black hair that reached down to her massive butt. She also had large leather wings with dark brown membranes. The gargoyle woman was so fat and enormous that it was surprising that she could still fly. Her lifeguard outfit looked tattooed on. You remember seeing this lifeguard lady flying around Gravefield Beach. But the only detail about her that you could actually remember was her name. You heard several monsters call her "Roxy", which was all too appropriate given that she was a gargoyle.

Looking up at this big gargoyle lady made you really nervous. The only other gargoyle you knew was Eartha and she was a mean and foul-mouthed human-eating hothead. But then again, this behavior was said to be atypical of the average gargoyle, making Eartha more similar to a certain fiery redhead with malicious intent, albeit at a smaller scale. From what you heard, gargoyles were actually the least dangerous monsters when it came to humans and there were rumors they had a strict moral code to protect, rather than destroy. Of course, "Roxy" was rather obese, to the point where she seemed to have multiple chins. Perhaps she ate humans when nobody was looking. You step back in the shell necklace as Roxy holds it up.

"Gee," says Roxy. "This looks like one of April's works of art. Why would it be laying on the ground? Somebody must've dropped it. Hmmm. Looks like April's best work yet." From the sound of it, this gargoyle lady was a friend of April's. Perhaps Roxy was your best bet. You were about to change your mind and reveal yourself to the titanic lifeguard, but then something happened that made you change your mind. Somebody lets out a yell and states "Attention, beach goers! Please vacate the area! A whale just beached itself on the shore and from the looks of it, she has a severe case of jaundice!" Roxy realizes immediately that this rather rude voice was referring to her. She grits her teeth to show her fangs and her eyes turn bright red.

You shake. You didn't know female gargoyle eyes really did glow red when they're mad. You start to wonder if male gargoyle eyes glow white. Roxy growls and turns to see a blonde-haired fairy with peach-colored skin holding a megaphone. She had golden wings like that of a butterfly and stood less than half Roxy's height. She was also much thinner than Roxy and looked slightly younger. She was laughing to herself as Roxy growled. "One of these days, Stella," warns Roxy. "You say one fat joke too many and I'll tie your tongue in a knot!" Stella blows Roxy a raspberry and leaves the gargoyle lady stomping away in rage as she holds the necklace you're in.

"Okay," you think to yourself. "Somebody is really sensitive about her weight. I don't know if this gargoyle is friendly or not, but an angry gargoyle is dangerous no matter what the alignment." As Roxy stomps away, she makes her way towards...
15232121221.title: Roxy the Gargoyle

choices: Stella Takes the Necklace to the Lost and Found
Stella Decides to Keep the Necklace for Herself
15232121222.content:
You peak outside the opening of the shell to see that the lifeguard that picked you up looked almost human, except for the glittery orange butterfly wings growing out of her back. From the looks of it, she had long blonde hair and was hourglass shaped. That woman was a fairy. From the tag she was wearing, it would appear that her name was Stella. Kinda weird since she looked a lot like the fairy of the same name from the Winx Club.

Suddenly you remember something and gasp. Stella was one of the lifeguards who retrieved the patients that escaped. Given her petite frame, she was called on to catch the patients that weren't dangerous or large enough to warrant the gargoyle lifeguard. However, Stella had a tendency to be condescending and even mean towards the patients. The woman had a mean streak a mile wide. You heard that Roxy couldn't stand her. You really hope that Stella doesn't decide to open the shell necklace.

The giantess fairy looks over the necklace and smirks. "Well look at this," she says in an obnoxious tone. "Looks like some klutz dropped their necklace. Hmm, from the looks of it, this is April's handiwork. Seems actually well made for something created by that ditzy mutt." Stella laughs obnoxiously as you let out a groan. You've dealt with girls like her in high school and you're certain everybody else did. Stella was basically the Alpha Bitch all grown up. But the question is, what is that fairy going to do with the necklace now?
15232121222.title: Stella the Fairy

153.content:
As you tremble you realize the sound was coming from the K.D.P.’s B-Block and remember that the orderlies protecting B-Block were water elements.

First was your archenemy, Lilith the werecrab. That crustacean was friendly and jovial towards the monster patients, but when it came to you, she only saw you as a snack and taunted you in your cage by snapping her big claws and telling you she was going to eat you. One time you remember her saying that you might taste good dipped in butter. It didn’t help that you were already terrified of sand crabs before finding out monsters were real.

Then there was Jedda, a bahamut, except her species was a combination of the mythical and Final Fantasy version of the bahamut. Jedda was a hippo with the wings and skin of a dragon and the gills of a fish. Unlike the rest of her family, including her big sister Elisa, Jedda ate humans. You heard she was dared to place a human in her mouth as a kid and discovered she liked the taste. However, you heard she was in a self-help group for predators who want to stop eating humans because she was afraid she’d wind up eating a friend of her sister’s. Unfortunately for you, she’s not showing much improvement. One time when she was trying to give you a friendly smile, you saw a human skeleton sticking out of her lower lip before she nervously sucked it back in.

Lastly of B-Block as far as orderlies go was the worst orderly in the building, the mock turtle Tarja, a creature resembling a cross between a minotaur and a sea turtle. Tarja was the only orderly to not care about any of the patients. In fact, you’ve seen her tease some of your fellow patients, seemingly trying to keep them insane. Not to mention she’s managed to sneak alcohol on the job with neither Dr. West or Whitney finding out. You wouldn’t be too surprised if she even tried to steal from the K.D.P. But she knows you know of her crimes and threatened to gulp you down if you told Kaguya or Whitney.

Water was definitely not your favorite element. But who’s the orderly coming through that door?
153.title: Making a Splash

choices: She has to visit a patient
1531.content:
As the sound gets closer you can more clearly hear the stomping of a monster. You can also hear a clacking sound that makes your blood run cold. You know that sound, and its source enters the room. Its Lilith the werecrab, one of your least favorite orderlies after Whitney. She may be nice to the monster patients but she's made it quite clear that she likes to eat humans. Every time she's around you she gives you threatening and hungry looks. It doesn't help that you're even terrified of regular sand crabs. When she enters the room you cower behind the desk leg. Staring up you see her hard shelled body and while she's very fit, its ruined by her face. She's got stalks for eyes that make you cringe when you see them. Then there's her claws. One is bigger than the other, and they clack as she opens and closes them. Lilith has put her claws in your face many a time and you dread the day she has you in them.

"Now where is the doctor?" you hear her say as she walks around the room. She walks to the desk and inspects the top. "Hmmm." you hear her mutter. You don't know what this means but you continue to watch her carefully. Suddenly she drops to the floor without warning and spots you peeking out from your hiding spot. "Ah ha!" she says. One look at her face up close is all you need to take off in the opposite direction. You run out from under the desk and frantically search for a hiding spot. Lilith chases you creating booms with each step. Before you even get close to a good spot her claw slams down and snaps shut right in front of you. You fall back and scream in surprise. Looking up you see the other claw coming to get you and you close your eyes in terror. You feel the claw close around you and cry out.

After opening your eyes you see that you're not being snipped in half. Instead you're being lifted into the air. Lilith is holding you, but not tight enough to snip you. She brings you to her face and smirks at the tears streaming down your face. "Did I scare the little human?" she asks. You can't even say anything because you're so scared. She brings you in for a closer look and you rear back from her gross eye stalk. This causes her to tighten her grip slightly, making you yelp. "I wouldn't move around too much. You might hurt yourself." she tells you. "Looks like I finally got you Sylvia. You remember what I said right? You're gonna be a good snack." She opens her mouth, but shuts it again. "I did say you'd be good with butter though. As hard as it was to finally get you I think I should make it good." She then lowers you into her cleavage and pushes you in until you're hidden. "I'm going to have you with my lunch, and its going to be delicious!" she tells you and exits the room. Where does she go?
1531.title: Lilith the Werecrab

choices: Jedda finishes just as you run...and notices your empty cage!
1532.content:
Sliding behind one of the desk's legs, you take a breath to steel yourself before peeking around at the B-Block door just as it opens, revealing none other than Jedda. The blue-skinned hippo/dragon titaness trudged in, humming a jazzy tune and tucking a folder under one arm. Her footsteps thunderous at ground level and sent faint ripples through her wide girth, especially her belly and behind. That bikini she always wore didn't do much to hide her girth, either. You weren't even sure how it stayed on.

But there were more important thing to worry about with Jedda around...namely that she might eat you if you were spotted. As friendly as Jedda was, all it would take was one little slip of willpower, and you'd be a snack. Just a little more fat on her big belly, some more bulge on her rump that was already big enough to crush a city block. Whimpering, you flatten your back against the desk leg and hope to Christ she doesn't see you. Please just walk through the office, please don't stick around, please just leave....

You peek around the leg again, and catch Jedda close the B-Block door with a hip-check. ...Or try to: she only taps it lightly, and despite the size of her butt and the force it carries, it's only enough to close the door halfway, leaving a small crack open. Jedda, meanwhile, looks at her rear and chuckles. "Not quite enough...oh well, better drop these off." Pulling the folder from under her arm, Jedda opens it and gives its contents a once-over...you guessed they were reports on the various patients.

Oh no...oh no.... This was bad. Very bad. Orderlies left patient reports on Dr. West's desk! Jedda would surely notice your cage was empty....and go looking for you. And is she thought of her search, even for a second, as hunting...

You shiver as an old nightmare springs to memory.
Jedda pinching you high in the air, held over her wide jaws. The bahamut girl giving you a nonchalant shrug before letting you go, to fall into her maw...seeing her massive teeth from the inside of her mouth....Jedda giggling at your taste...

With a great effort, you wrench yourself back to reality, wiping the cold sweat from your brow. No. You would not have a panic attack! Not here, not now. You could be scared later, now you had to think.

You look up at Jedda again, to find her still leafing through the folder. Perfect, she was distracted! You had a chance! With one last deep breath, you sprint out from under the desk and charge towards the half-open door to B-Block.



But does your gamble pay off...?
1532.title: Big Blue Bahamut

choices: Jedda controls herself, and puts you back in your cage.
Jedda licks her lips opens her mouth....
15321.content:
Your lungs burn in protest on your mad sprint towards the door, your legs ache like the muscles had been stretched on a rack. The rush of adrenaline is barely enough to keep you going, even with escape as a prize and your life on the line. And still, you run as fast as you can, the open door getting ever closer....and only make it halfway to the door when you hear a familiar voice.

"What the...Sylvia! Stop!" Jedda calls out, the floor shaking as the bahamat steps towards you. You wail in fear and try to push yourself faster, feeling on the verge of passing out. Just a little bit further, and you'd make it to the door!

...But your confinement in that cage hadn't done any favors for the shape you were in. A small space, coupled with constantly being surrounded by man-eating giant creatures had put excercise off your mind. Add to this the very, very, very big difference in scale between you and Jedda--who could cover what would take you half and hour of running in just a few steps--and it was all but impossible for her not to catch you.

A shadow suddenly envelopes you, and before you can even look back, two giant blue fingers close around your form, stopping you in your tracks "Gotcha!" Jedda quips, chuckling. Enveloped by her chubby fingers, you feel yourself lifted up, up, and up...until you're staring your captress right in her massive face; her hippo's snout and mischievous eyes all but filling your view. You try to cower away, but Jedda's pinching you in such a way that you can't look away from her.

"How'd you get out, Sylvia? Were you really trying to sneak out?" she interrogates, tilting her head.

All you can look at, though, is her mouth. "P-please don't eat me..."

Jedda snorts. "You know I'm getting help...and don't change the subject! How did you get out, and were you trying to sneak out of here? Go see another patient?"

"I...I...I...put me down, please, Jedda. Just p-p-put me back in my cage--and don't tell Whitney! Please!" You'd seen humans beg before, it never worked. Monsters just ignored the pleading and ate their prey; or even worse, found it amusing and toyed with humans before gulping them down. It didn't matter. All you could think of was getting away from Jedda before she had a lapse in willpower...and not earning Whitney's wrath.

Jedda loosens her grip and pulls her head back. She even smiles at you...thankfully, no skeletons are stuck in her teeth this time. "Calm down, Sylvia. I'm not going to hurt you, and I won't tell Whitney. Even if I did think you were faking, that rhino just takes it too far. Just calm down, alright? Now, I'll just put you back in the cage and--"

It was then that a rumbling, liquid noise resounded. Like a rockslide under water, or....
Or a massive stomach growling.

Jedda looks down at her rotund belly, poking it with her free hand. Then she looks up at you. You are both silent for a long moment.

"J-Jedda...please, t-t-try to control yourself. Please..." This time, you start to cry.
15321.title: The Not-So-Great Escape

choices: Jeddah Comes to Her Senses and Spits You Out
153212.content:
You begin to sweat and really hope that Jedda doesn't loose control. You heard that Jedda was from a family and species of monsters that normally don't eat humans. According to Charlene, both Jedda's older sister's were friends with humans. But when Jedda was a kid one of her friends dared her to put a human in her mouth and apparently she liked the taste. You really hope Jedda's willpower training pays off.

Unfortunately, this doesn't look like the case because as Jedda looks straight at you, she opens her mouth and licks her fangs to your absolute terror. You get a good look at Jedda's enormous fangs. Because of her hippo like physiognomy, she had two large fangs on the sides of her bottom jaw, each one had to be at least 100ft tall. Jedda rubs her stomach as she looks down on you.

"You know Sylvia," the hippo/dragon giantess says. "You look absolutely heavenly today." You scream and try to back away but Jedda grabs you in between her chubby fingers and hoists you up into the air. "Please Jedda!" you yell. "Control yourself! Please don't eat me! Please don't eat me!"

However, your cries fall on deaf ears because Jedda holds you over her mouth just like in your nightmare. You're frozen with fear right before Jedda shrugs and drops you screaming into her enormous maw. Jedda snaps her jaws shut as you land on her long wet tongue that had to be the size of ten football fields. "Jedda!" you yell. You then scream as Jedda's tongue wraps around you like a snake and tangles you as you shake and struggle to break free.

But it's no use, the bahamut's massive tongue pushes you to the side of her teeth and starts flaying you about as you break down crying. Jedda moans in ecstasy as she enjoys your taste. "I gotta say Sylvia," thinks the giantess to herself. "You taste absolutely divine." Inside the giantess's mouth, you try to pound on her teeth to get her to snap out of it but then you find yourself trying to grab onto the tongue as Jedda tilts her head.

You're going to fall down to her throat if Jedda doesn't snap out of it. And then you'll just be another layer of fat on her already massive body.
153212.title: Jedda is Hungry

choices: Too late! Dr. Kaguya came back.
1532121.content:
You struggle, gasp and scream for mercy as Jedda tilts her head a full 90 degrees, and your world suddenly turned vertical, leading straight down into a hole that lead straight to your death. Unfortunately for you, the tongue is not the worlds most reliable surface to grab onto, as you're quickly learning. Your grip on the top of the tongue doesn't hold, and you fall with a fright, frantically grasping and fumbling about to get a hold on anything. The comparatively thick bumps on the hippo-dragoness's tongue serve as functional hand holds, but they're just as slippery as the rest of it, and you quickly lose your hold and begin to fall further and further. With nothing to grasp on to, you merely hug the surface of the tongue as the edge of Jedda's throat comes closer.

The world seems to slow down, and you feel weightless, like you're underwater. You watch as globs of saliva go trickling past you, hit the back of Jedda's mouth, and slide down her esophagus, disappearing down the dark cavern of her gaping maw. You really, really didn't want it to end this way, but your fate seemed settled. And in the end, you having survived as long as you had was impressive. You could at least take solace knowing that you'd fared better and lasted longer than most humans in the monster world have, and you were momentarily proud of yourself, before the realization that you were going to die came rushing back to you, slamming in to you like a ton of bricks. Your innate 'fight or flight' response was of no use in this situation, and after what seemed like hours, but were merely seconds of struggling, you knew you couldn't win. So you did something crazy. You let go.

Suddenly in free fall as you drifted away from the mass of wet pink, the sliver of light pouring in through Jedda's sharp teeth becoming fainter and fainter, you closed your eyes, and you found yourself at peace. You no longer had to worry about surviving. About avoiding the grasp of these giant, carnivorous beasts every day. You would finally have the peace you'd craved ever since you'd been locked up in this hellhole. Your life began to momentarily flash before your eyes as they began to close slowly, thoughts of all the happiness you'd experienced in your life flooding your mind as you embraced-

"Jeez, Sylvia, why do you gotta look so tasty?" the Bahamut asked accusingly. "Let's get you cleaned off and back in that cage, I guess. Can't believe I almost let down the people at the anti human-addiction meet-up... I really can't allow this to happen again."

You, however, couldn't move. Or rather, didn't have the strength to. You had been so prepared to die that the thought of being alive paralyzed you. You'd been in some close calls before, but none were ever so...surreal. You'd been in danger of being eaten before, but it never got far enough for you to endure what you'd just dealt with. The struggling. The panic. The denial. The acceptance. You were so ready to accept death that you had actually accepted it. To come back from that, to still be alive after the feeling of terror had washed away, and only peace remained...it was difficult, to say the least. The trials and tribulations of you living were nowhere near their end, despite how seemingly close they were a mere few seconds ago. Would it been better if you... had died? No, no... you wanted to live. But... no longer having to worry about surviving every second of every day... it had a very pleasant ring to it...

As Jedda began to spray you with insurmountable amounts of water (the spray of a simple bathroom sink) you stood up, your clothes soaked, and wiped the layer of saliva off you, and then wiping your tears away. Standing under the faucet, you simply stared up towards the Bahamut, not saying a word. You were a little too terrified to say anything. Jedda's stomach grumbled again, and for a moment your knees felt weak, but she merely turned her head away from you, clearly resisting the temptation. But that didn't help ease your concerns.

After being properly cleaned, and placed back in your cage, you just slumped to the ground, your muscles aching from your adrenaline-fueled struggles to stay alive. Jedda shoots you a frown, despite you knowing how little she cared, and walked away, leaving you to lie there, and stare up at the cage's roof. You sigh. You just couldn't believe what had happened. And you were still alive to tell the tale! The thoughts of a death that could've been left your mind, as you got to your feet, if only to stretch. Groggily, you look over towards the cage door, and your jaw drops.

Jedda forgot to close the cage.
